Reviews.Title: “Ideal location beautifully decorated”
Reviews.Author: LIndyLou2012
Reviews.Content: Three nights with my sisters at this wonderful hotel. All the staff were so welcoming and could not have been more helpful. The bedroom was beautifully decorated , very stylish and comfortable. The location is ideal only a few minutes from the metro station and the beautiful Luxembourg gardens. After spending a lot of time looking for a Hotel I can say we made the right choice and I would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Steveprince
Reviews.Content: Great location, very well priced, the rooms are lovely if to be fair small but you need to remember you are in Paris in the suburb Latin quarter and there is a quaint “Boulangare Moderne Patisserie” just behind the hotel to stock up for the day’s supply’s and providing you are happy with a little exercise you are able to walk to all the main attractions from this Hotel. The staff are friendly and a delight to speak to The only thing that I would comment on they are refurbishing the hotel which to be fair does not blot your stay at all however you will not need that early morning call and ‘lay-ins’ for the more romantic my be slightly impaired and you are unable to appreciate the beautiful buildings façade a fact that was not disclosed at time of booking but does not impact on the over all enjoyment of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: fgrandjean
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. We selected it because it is easy to reach with the RER B that goes to CDG airport and the Gare du Nord. This 3 star hotel is not cheap but offered a discounted price because it is being renovated and there was some noise. Indeed there was some noise at siesta time but it was very quiet during the night. The staff is very friendly and helpful. When we indicated that the water was not hot on the fifth floor, they immediately reacted and found a valve that had been shut off. We did not try the breakfast at 10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional quality”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan H
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a great experience and made our stay in Paris really enjoyable. High praise for the staff who are friendly and efficient. The location and surrounding areas are exceptional and it is so nice to be situated in view of the Pantheon and not gazing into another window! We consider our choice to stay here a fortunate choice. Book here to enjoy Paris . Magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandraB1962
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two nights at this gorgeous little hotel situated smack bang in front of the Pantheon and very well located for the Left Bank of Paris. The staff were utterly charming and couldn't be more helpful. Our room (number 10) was beautifully decorated had a nice big, comfortable bed, a lovely outlook over The Pantheon and a spacious bathroom with a bath. The room is entered by your own little hallway with the bathroom to the side and a separate door into the bedroom - nice and private. And, for all the reviewers who complain about room sizes, the room was a normal size for Paris but the owners had fitted in a desk, two armchairs, two robes for hanging space, a TV and mini-bar - you don't get a big room in Paris unless you want to pay an exorbitant amount of money - considerably more than the rate at this hotel (which is about average for a property of this level) so don't expect a massive floorspace at this hotel or any other in the price range. We really enjoyed our weekend and wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Merci Hotel des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: randbcoyne
Reviews.Content: We traveled with the children (ages 12 and 11) on their first visit to Paris. The reception staff greeted us warmly and were great hosts during our stay. The rooms were very stylish and we loved the location and views. Merci Beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Met our best expectations of an old world Parisien hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgsailor66
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 3 day stay and were delighted with our choice of hotel. We booked on-line well in advance and got an excellent rate as the hotel was undergoing refurbishment , due to be completed by our arrival. Although there was still some exterior work ongoing this did not prove a problem and we were charmed by our room (21), which faced the Panthéon, was ornately decorated, somewhat larger than expected with good closet space, and with a good-size well-appointed bathroom. Apart from carpeting showing signs of age, everything was extremely clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and professional, the location very convenient to the RER and other transport, walking distance to several major sights ( we could see the Eiffel Tower twinkling at night from the square of the Panthéon ) , and close to restaurants of all levels. Highly recommended as great place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, centrally located in Paris”
Reviews.Author: citygirl32_23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for 3 nights over the weekend. The room was quite small but I was expecting this from a Parisien hotel. It is a lovely boutique hotel in the Latin Quarter. If travelling from Paris CDG, take the B line RER and get off at the Luxembourg stop - the hotel is literally 2 mins walk from this station. The staff were helpful and friendly with very good English compared to our broken French. Thoroughly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. A bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: marquis73
Reviews.Content: Just one night. Special offer because of works in the hotel. So no elevator, paint smell, a bit dirty. But we knew that, so no complaints, better tha expected. Service correct. Room nice, cosy and romantic, but small (well, is Paris what can we do?). Great bathroom. Nice area. Good hotel but a bit overpiced. We would never pay the offcial rate even without works.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly hotel, even whilst undergoing a refurb.”
Reviews.Author: MargotHBirmingham
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and we were glad to be back again. We had a standard room which didn't have great views, but was charmingly decorated and very comfortable. The hotel is in a peaceful area of Paris, but conveniently located for the Luxembourg station and the RER straight to Charles de Gaulle airport/Gare du Nord if you are flying/Eurostarring. The breakfast is good value and a wide variety of choices are offered. Helpful and friendly staff made the stay perfect again. The refurb. will probably help the ambience further. We will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view from spacious terrace”
Reviews.Author: liwa33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Easter 2011. The weather was warm and we enjoyed Paris for 4 days. Staying at Hotel des Grands Hommes made our vacation special. We had booked room at the upper floor with terrace and fantastic view towards the Pantheon, Place du Pantheon, University and historical buildings. The hotel is placed less than 10 mins walk from the Metro, making it easy to get around in Paris. The room was spacious, lovely decorated and clean. The terrace was great, with nice furnitures and flowers. We enjoyed our breakfast here every morning, delivered by room service. We found the service at the hotel friendly and to our request.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect even whilst undergoing refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: Nos6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Des Grandes Hommes for a long weekend. The location was perfect being literally opposite the Pantheon, with plenty of decent places to eat etc. A pleasant walk to Notra Damme adds to the possibilities. Plus only three stops from Gare de Nord makes getting to and from easy for those, like us, using the Eurostar. During our stay the hotel was being refurbished with scaffolding outside and on the last day extensive carpet fitting to the communal areas. However, this was mentioned when booking and a reduced rate applied etc. Plus once inside you wouldn't really notice. Room decked out in a classic style and although small more than adequate. Staff were extremely friendly and pleasant. Would certainly recommend and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Joshua S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. My partner and I stayed here on holiday from Australia. Guillaume was incredibly helpful I don't even know where to start. I asked him if he could recommend a place for me to take my girlfriend on a surprise date. He searched tirelessly for two days and spent a lot of time going out of his way for me until he found the perfect evening at a Paris Orchestra. It was a fantastic night. Thank you so much. I felt as if I could ask all of the people at reception for anything and they would do their best to help me whole-heartedly. The location of the hotel was perfect. The rooms are beautiful, spacious, and ours had a lovely terrace with a view of the Pantheon which is breath-taking. No issues with the room. I had great sleep and it was decent value for Paris. Cheers guys!

Reviews.Title: “Real deal, quick and easy”
Reviews.Author: nfrasercolumbia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in the hotel while in paris. The hotel was highly rated and reasonably priced (for paris). The best part of the hotel is the location, just a few blocks from the amazing latin/german quarter. Lots of good restaurants, bars in this area. Plus the Gardens are just 2 blocks down the road. The gardens are simply amazing, one of the highlights of our trip was simply relaxing on the many benches. The tourist bus system "le' open" was just a block also so it is a easy way to hop on the double decker bus to hit all the tourist sites. The hotel itself was clean and pretty nice. It is older and the parisian fashion shows. rooms are small, beds are small, tv is small, but the bathroom is really small. It doesn't help that I am a big dude either but my wife is tiny and she felt the same way. We never ate anything from the hotel so I can't comment on the food. We always grabbed something in one of the cafe's in the morning. The room was stocked with some water, beer, soda, chocolate, etc. Enough to get by if you need something to eat/drink. Be careful when reserving your room, I thought i was reserving a pantheon view room instead i reserved a garden room. My fault though. I had to pay up another 50 bucks to stay in a room with a view per night, which we did bc the view is pretty awesome. Looking out the window onto the pantheon and plaza was amazing. i remember the bed being comfortable and I slept well. The elevator is scary and i used it only once, we walked the stairs the rest of the time there. So bottom line, if you want american style hotel with big rooms/bathrooms you won't find it here but you will find nice people and good/clean accomodations. I probably won't come back here bc i like to explore new hotels but i am comfortable recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 745Daniel
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent 5 nights at Hotel des Grands Hommes during the Holliday season and I have to say that everything went perfectly well during our stay. This is a very charming hotel with a very friendly staff, always happy to help with any request. Yes, the rooms are small as most of the hotel rooms in Paris are but if you are not traveling with a lot of luggage this should not be a concern. We stayed at room 61 at the top floor and the room has a lovely balcony(which we didn't use since it was 1 degree C outside) and a great view. Location is great right across the Pantheon and a short walk away from jardin du Luxembourg, Notre Damme Cathedral and saint germain de pres. We even walked to the Louvre but for those who doesn't enjoy long walks there are a couple of metro stations 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Abudhabi2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week on my trip to Paris. I found it a lovely hotel in the best possible location. From CDG airport, it was only a 22 minutes train ride to Luxumburg stop and a 2 min walk to the hotel. The hotel is right across from Pantheon and you can even see the tip of Eiffel Tower! There are some wonderful cafes on the same street where you can have your breakfast(There is a lovely Creperie, dont miss it!)It is alsoo a walking distance to many attractions as well, not very close but a pleasant walk. You just walk down St. Michelle Blvd, and there in front is the Seine! If you take a right turn, you can go to Notre Dame, and le Marais, and if you take a left turn, you can walk down to the Louvre, Versaille, Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysees, and many more. The hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful. Although it was high season, the hotel was very quiet at night. Classic rooms are slightly small but OK if you are travelling solo. The room was charming and very clean. It was a beautiful hotel and I recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in a place quiet but close enough to all the action in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Not so desirable”
Reviews.Author: Lee59
Reviews.Content: I think there is something wrong with the current Tripadvisor ranking (approx. 30th in Paris) for this hotel. We travel extensively, and would not rate this hotel quite so highly. We stayed on a balcony, street-facing room in December. First, the fixtures and bedding have not been renovated in an excessively long time. The beds are at the point where the mattresses are sagging. The sheets on top sandwich old blankets between them. The inner top sheet on our first night had holes in it. The quality of the towels varies from reasonable to threadbare. There were industrial-grade plastic "twist-ties" holding a lamp together. The daybed cover had been patched with similar-patterned material. Etc. Some other points regarding the room. It was of a reasonable size for Paris - larger than my usual Paris hotel. The bath was not exciting, but was in better shape than the sleeping room. The heating (in December) worked quite well. The location is a mixed bag. Yes, our room looked directly out at the Pantheon, which my wife greatly liked. However, that is a very large square with a parking lot. At night, drunks tended to gather there. Unfortunately, one night, this became an extreme problem. There was a significant number of youths hanging out and drinking beside their cars. They would scream intermittently, particularly at passersby. Even with the windows shut, it was impossible to sleep. Eventually, around 3AM we called the desk. After some more time, the drunken party was removed. However, another (related?) party returned some time even later, and it was quite noisy again. Amazingly, this was in December. The desk staff were very friendly. However, we did have a problem with restaurant suggestions. We asked for some help with a restaurant for a special evening. The desk person set up a reservation at a hotel-restaurant, where we were surrounded by American tourists. As my wife specifically asked for a very French restaurant, this was inexcusable. (Yes, our French is quite reasonable.) Afterwards, I went on the web, and found that that restaurant had previously appeared on our hotel's blog. Very strange. All in all, the hotel is "OK", with the view of the Pantheon being the main attraction. However, be aware that the Tripadvisor ranking should be somewhat lower than its current ranking of 30. I saw this occur with another hotel a few year's back; that hotel did eventually move back down to an appropriate rank.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jessica M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of July 2011. We arrived here before the 2pm check-in time, but were told there were no rooms ready at the moment and it would be approximately 30mins. We had the options of waiting in the comfy lobby or leaving our luggage there and exploring the area a bit! The woman at the front desk was extremely helpful during our 3 night stay, helping with directions, providing maps, calling taxis, and just providing excellent customer service and always very friendly. When we arrived back to the hotel 30mins later the room was ready and our luggage was already up there waiting for us. The room itself was very small, but surprisingly we had a fairly large bathroom! The room was very clean, beds were average comfortable and the cleaning service was great. There are lots of cafes within walking distance and the Pantheon is across the street. Overall we had a great stay and would definately recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Friendly and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Bec M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mum for a short break in Paris. We were so impressed with this hotel and found the staff incredibly friendly. The hotel is very clean and had a lot of character. It was very quiet and in such a beautiful and peaceful spot in Paris. We were amazed at it's proximity to the Pantheon - it was a beautiful location! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Xmas Stay in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sanandjezz
Reviews.Content: From first contact with the Hotel from booking to staying was excellent. Location is great for access to major sights and local areas for eating out. Booked the Classic room at the rear of the hotel due to being a light sleeper and did not have any problems. Classic room slightly small but adequate for 3 nights. The hotel staff are excellent especially on reception and very friendly. Did not have breakfast as there are too many nearby alternatives. Its been twenty years since we last came to Paris (too long after this experience ) . This would be a great choice for a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: Alb6stringer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July for a week while I attended a conference. The hotel has easy access to both the Paris subway system and the RER line serving both major airports; we took the train to and from CDG instead of an expensive cab ride, and both the conference center and the many tourist sites we visited were easily accessible by subway. It was a short walk to the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens, and a reasonable walk to the Seine and Notre Dame. The staff were very friendly and very helpful, in English or French, and there was an inexpensive stand with wonderful coffee and croissants on the way to the subway. Breakfast is available in the hotel, but we always went continental to save a few euros. Our room was not large but comfortable, with a surprisingly large bathroom. No noise problem, but our window faced an enclosed courtyard/airshaft. Many restaurants nearby, and close to the church steps from "Midnight in Paris" though Fitzgerald never sent a car for us. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location... Really Cosey”
Reviews.Author: stretch47
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend on a recent trip to Paris. I was extremely happy with the location of the hotel. We got off the RER train from CDG at Luxembourg station which is a short walk down the street. The street has lots of cafes and 1 or 2 nice shops. The hotel itself was lovely. The staff were extremely helpful. The room was a bit on the small side though. When you enter the room there was a double bed but not much walking space, however, the bed and bathroom were excellent. Our room also had a disappointing view but this was more bad luck than anything. I would recommend this hotel because of it's great location and also when in a city like Paris, you spend little time in the room anyway! We didn't sample breakfast in the hotel as there are plenty of cafes in the vicinity. All in all a good place to stay and a brilliant trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MIA002
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in this hotel and I really enjoyed it. The staff is extremelly friendly and the breakfast was simple but good. The room was a small but confortable, and if you are a light sleeper like me you should ask for a room facing the back since I stayed in one with a great view of the Pantheon but I kept waking up with people talking loudly in the street (this was a Saturday night). My only negative comment is that the towels were old and had stains and since this is a fancy hotel, this should not happen.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing cold stay”
Reviews.Author: Tlot2011
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel in oct 2011. The first night we were on the 6th floor and it was nice. The second night was awful! The second night we were offered a room upgrade with a nice view and they moved our luggage for us. We went into room 21 at 5pm and it was freezing--we complained to the man at the front desk and he said he would look into it. Arrived back at 9pm and it was still freezing. We were handed blankets and given a space heater and told there were no other rooms available. At one point we were even told that since the rest of the hotel had heat we could just sleep with our door open. We were cold all night. We were not offered any money off our stay or anything! In addition it was extremely loud in that room since it was a Friday night . It was our last night in Paris and it was ruined by this. I was just now able to write the hotel and complain about this issue. Since it had been a month, they just said they were sorry and offered an upgrade if we ever stay there again. I would not stay there again. I am extremely disappointed and wish we had never switched rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every sense”
Reviews.Author: holymadness
Reviews.Content: My stay here was close to perfect. I was greeted with graciousness from the staff when I arrived and every time I dropped off or picked up my keys or asked a question. I checked in early, which is often a problem, and was upgraded to a top floor room with a balcony overlooking the Pantheon and with a spectacular view of Sacré-Cœur. The room was quiet at night and the bed comfortable. The toiletries had a rich fig scent that made bath-time luxurious and relaxing. Breakfast was delivered to my room for no extra charge. Overall my experience was delightful, easy, comfortable and relaxing. This isn't a super-luxury hotel, but there is a great luxury in the attention to detail, the classic decor and human friendliness on offer here.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beatrix19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here by chance as our usual hotels in Paris were all full. It is in a beautful location, right opposite the Pantheon but convenienlty located for a brisk walk (needed after all that delicious French food) down to the Seine and the Louvre etc. The room was compact but comfortable and clean. We had a room on the interior so it was quiet - something which can be a challenge in Paris! The staff were courteous and efficient. All in all, we had a very pleseant stay and I think the hotel represents good value for money. we certainly return there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: tarbabyChicago
Reviews.Content: I managed to miscount the number of nights we needed, but the staff cheerfully made space for us to stay an extra night. We did not have anything but a delightful stay with a wonderful hospitable staff helping us to enjoy our time in Paris. Well done, Hotel des Grands Hommes!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geoff B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Grands Hommes, made our trip to Paris so much more enjoyable. The location was fantastic. The room was beautiful and our view over the Pantheon was unbelievable. My wife and I travelled with our 6 month old son, the room was large enough to accomadate the cot supplied and still leave enough room for us to move around. The staff where sensational and went out of their way to make our stay, be that much more enjoyable. To everyone at the Hotel, Thankyou. If you are reading this, I suggest you stay at The Hotel des Grands Hommes and I hope your stay is as enjoyable as our's. I am sure it will be. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “A really friendly hotel in a good part of the city”
Reviews.Author: gabby b
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazingly friendly, with fabulous staff. The rooms are a little small, with not much room for bags (as are most in Paris) but its perfectly comfortable. The bathroom was a good size. We didn't have breakfast there but heard great reports about it. Its a little "twee" with the fancy floral wall paper and furnishings, and would perhaps be more suited to older clients. I was really impressed with all the friendly staff, who went out of their way to welcome and help us. The hotel emailed me in advance to check on the booking and arrival time, and confirmed the request for twin beds quickly. It's close to the Latin quarter and lots of restaurants and shops, (although perhaps a little bit touristy for my liking). I will certainly recommend it to my older friends

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: SaddlebillStork
Reviews.Content: This is an authentic French hotel with an unbeatable location, lovely American-standard service, and charm to spare. And great French coffee and breakfast. Splurge on a room with a view - it will be worth every penny. The superior rooms with balcony are the ones on the second highest floor. The balcony is small but big enough for a table and two chairs and breakfast outside. I don't think the rooms with a terrace have enough additional outside space to be worth it (but maybe the rooms themselves are bigger, I don't know). You can easily take the RER from the airport, get off at Luxembourg, and walk the two blocks to the hotel (even with luggage), saving enough to pay for the view. By American standards, the room sizes and televisions will be small, but if you want those things, you should be staying at an American chain in Paris. The bathroom was big by any standard with a full tub. The two "single" beds were very close together because of the small space, so I would only sleep there with someone I didn't mind being close to. Wish I had been there with a significant other because this place is super romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location! + Charming Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tanya W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in Paris and loved it! You could not get a better location than where this hotel is situated. We were in walking distance of Saint Germain des Pres and Le Marais, along with several of the main monuments one must see while in Paris. We were also right near a metro station which made it convenient for our airport traveling to and from. The hotel was spotless and incredibly clean! The staff was very helpful and even allowed us to check in early the day we arrived. The only draw back, which is not necessarily the fault of Grands Hommes but more of a characteristic of Paris accommodations in general is that the room we had was teeny tiny. The room was extremely charming and the bathroom was a good size but we had nowhere to put our large suitcases really. Still, I'd stay here again. Staying in a place with a great location in Paris makes a huge difference when visiting.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as I expected but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hatul_10
Reviews.Content: We asked for the Double room with balcony on the courtyard side. Balcony is useful if you are a smoker but if not it's not fun to sit there since its really close to the 3 other balconies on the same floor (outside is crowded and small) I didn’t find it worth the extra money. We asked for twin beds because we are not a couple, reception confirmed us it will be done. We were surprised to discover no twin beds… every morning the cleaning lady took away our second bedding so we found ourselves making our bed each evening. The room was big enough and bathroom was pampering There is no central heating, instead there is air conditioning. Two of the Staff guys where really helpful and friendly the rest where pretty snobbish Location is brilliant –that is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but just know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: Dorylicious
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of budget hotels in Paris so this time I decided to stay in a nicer place with a smack bang in the middle location. Hotel des Grandes Hommes was both, nice with fantastic location. However, it is small as a lot of other reviews have said. You may not mind this (Because I thought the same thing) but bear in mind that when you do your shopping, start packing, trying to find something deep in your luggage it is going to get frustrating, especially if you are running late. There is a fridge but no freezer so you won't have ice - this is fine if you don't need/want ice. The TV is small and is hidden in a cupboard so you have to open the cupboard to watch TV. Now you have an idea of how small it is. I have stayed in cheaper hotels that are more spacious, at least enough to feel somewhat comfortable. If you are staying on your own, this place is great! As a couple, not so much. On a good note, this place is very nicely decorated, the detail is amazing, even the bathroom looks gorgeous and this is really what sold me, so in that sense it was worth it to stay in a hotel that was so beautifully done. On an even better note, the hotel is literally next to the Pantheon. In fact you could have one of the hotel rooms that actually opens its windows to the Pantheon. Everything is closeby, bakeries, fast food, cafes, laundromats and you can connect to either the RER (airport) line or a metro line. You can walk to many nearby districts such as St Michel, see Notredame, walk towards the Seine River... Service was decent, the man at the front desk greeted us in English, even made a joke so we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff are helpful and the cleaning lady was nice too. They all seem a little eccentric in some way... but not unwelcomed.. Nice to stay early in the trip, I wouldn't recommend anymore than 2 days and definitely not if you have lots of luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: misskitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in one of the rooms on the higher floors. The room was clean and comfortable but very very small. The size did not bother us too much, even thought we were struggling to fit all our luggage and shopping. I think because our room was on the top floor, it was always quite hot and stuffy even though it was only spring when we were in Paris. I would definitely recommend trying to get a room on one of the lower levels. We were pretty happy with the location, as there were several metro stations less within a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Would we stay here again? Yes, if we can good a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Bed was not comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Izabellachen
Reviews.Content: I was extremely excited to stay here after doing extensive research on the best places in Paris. I stayed in room with the balcony on the 2nd story. The balcony was not worth paying for, and the bed was smaller than a usual Queen sized bed. It was also rather springy. I wished I pointed this out to the service staff, I'm sure they would have helped us change rooms if it had been possible as they were extremely friendly and very helpful. Frankly I think if I'd stayed in another room, I would have been a lot happier with my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mikeboston
Reviews.Content: A perfect home for our 5 nights in Paris. Ideal location, great neighborhood, & the metro is a short walk away as well. Room was very nice, with a view of the Panthéon from our windows. The staff was extremely friendly, lending us some silverware and a wine opener for our late afternoon snacks. We will most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel and thanks trip advisors”
Reviews.Author: Andrewkiri
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Rooms are stunning and not badly sized (first trip to Paris but reviews state normal rooms are tiny). The location of the hotel is perfect. In a vibrant part of town, close to a few of the major attractions and metro. Didn’t try the breakfast as we had a lot to see in a short time so we ate on the run. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic indeed”
Reviews.Author: HazzLondon
Reviews.Content: None of the hotels in Paris seem cheap, but this one offered good value and lived up to the reviews. I booked room 60, having seen the photos on TripAdvisor and it was great. It's small (as people have mentioned), but loads of character and the balcony is spot on if you have nice weather. Location is great. Booked early and got a 40% discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lesbrown1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grand Hommes in Paris in early October 2011, and enjoyed our time at this small, classic Paris Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, letting us check in early when our room was available, as we had just gotten in from the US. We had a room on the 3rd floor with a view out the rear, which overlooks the courtyard and faces other buildings on the same block, which was very quiet. Another couple traveling with us stayed in a room with a balcony on the front of the hotel, facing the Pantheon. There are stairs leading up to all of the guest rooms, with a small elevator. The hotel is small, but tall! The hotel staff recommended several restaurants in easy walking distance, which were great. The bed was very comfortable, but took up much of the guest room. The bathroom was huge, though, and beautifully appointed with new fixtures. The A/C worked very well, and there were outlets in useful places. We stayed for 5 days, and found this to be a relaxing, quiet, but easy to get to place to stay. The metro (RER B) was about 2 blocks down to Luxembourg Gardens, and the Sorbonne University’s buildings were right around the corner. There are a lot of good shopping options on side streets heading toward the river. There was a large (pay) parking lot in front of the hotel, although we only had a rental car the last day. Like many hotels we encountered in France, the room lights and electricity were controlled by a master switch that you had to use your room key to activate. The front desk keeps the room keys at the hotel, you check them in and out as you leave. While unusual from a US perspective, this is handy if you’re part of a couple doing independent activities, as there is only the one key.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly staff small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: oxuk2001
Reviews.Content: Just returned from here after a fantastic long weekend. The hotel is in a great location next to the Pantheon which is very close to lots going on but is very quiet at night so no disturbances. Really friendly staff lovely place to stay. Rooms are small but no smaller than most Paris hotels. Didn't try breakfast as plenty of good alternatives nearby at less cost. I love this area of Paris for some reason it feels like coming home after a day sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ina great location”
Reviews.Author: Brightthings
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location. Rooms excellent, a little small but only as one would expect for French hotels. The décor may not be to everyone’s taste but the room had everything you need and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had a room overlooking the Pantheon and the view was stunning. There was also a small terrace area with chairs & a table where you could breakfast in the warmer weather. Breakfast had lots of non-pastry options and although more than one would pay at a cafe we felt was worth the money for this. The hotel is in easy walking distance (with luggage) of Luxembourg Metro stop which goes direct to Gard Du Nord. A number of bistros very near. We went to the crêperie on the opposite side of the Place Du Pantheon which was lovely and good value for money. The general area was one we had not visited before and certainly one we will go back to. The Jardins De Luxembourg are lovely. The more usual Paris sites are all within walking distance. We only used the Metro when we had luggage with us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimmielou01
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 5 nights in a Terrace Room (room 60) which overlooked the Pantheon and had a small sitting room, bedroom, bath and large terrace. Room was pristinely clean, beds were very comfy, and terrace was wonderful. My daughter commented, and I completely agree, that the best thing about the HGH is the friendliness of the staff. They were ALWAYS polite, smiling and helpful. All staff spoke very good English which came in handy. Value for the price paid was excellent. Would not hesitate to recommend or stay at the HGH again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, Location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDog226
Reviews.Content: We made our decision for this hotel based on what we found on TripAdvisor and we were not steered wrong. A wonderful location with many cafes nearby, as well as an easy walk to Notre Dame and the Luxembourg Gardens. Our room was nicely decorated and easy to live in for the five nights we were at the Grands Hommes. Breakfast in the hotel is lovely and the service very friendly. If you use public transit this hotel is very convenient to both the bus and metro. If you book far enough in advance you can get a very noce room at a good price. We had a superior with balcony over looking the Pantheon and was well worth the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “A charming and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erik S
Reviews.Content: I can strongly recommend this charming hotel for its´ genuine atmosphere, nice location easy to reach, helpful and friendly staff. The Place Du Pantheon is tranquil and silent but the lively blocks start right around the corner. The only small cutbacks are the price which is rather too high when there are no campaigns and the rather simple breakfast if you do not choose a number of additions that you are charged extra for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so wonderful - the location, the decoration, the bathroom, the space and the overall atmosphere. It's a bit expensive, but the location is fantastic. If you don't want to dine in the hotel, there is a good cafe right around the corner and it's ideal for a short walk to many of the tourist bus stops. I felt very safe in this area, as well as welcomed by the staff. I had to make a call to the United States from the hotel, and they offered to let me make it from the front desk and didn't even ask if it was collect.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience overall...but”
Reviews.Author: ruma02
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel thanks to the Trip Advisor reviews and on checking their website and booking online. Paris was the last leg of a fairly lengthy 2 week holiday in Italy & France, and we were looking forward to the peace & quiet for the last 2 nights. First, let me say that the hotel is wonderfully situated in the Latin Quarter, overlooking the Pantheon. The first night, we had a triple room overlooking the Pantheon, as my teenage son was with us, and after he left for University the next day, we were moved to a classic double with balcony. The first was much better. Most France hotel rooms are tiny, and this was too. But very well appointed and the best thing I liked was the whimsical wallpaper. Beds were quite comfy, there was a safe and hairdryer in the room, and the first room had a two-part bathroom, which I like. The second room was miniscule, and we could't even open our bags without blocking the doors! But still a nice room. The staff all spoke English, and were helpful, even recommending and helping us make dinner reservations at a nearby fine dining restaurant on the last night (we didn't want to travel too far). The hotel is a short walk from the Luxembourg RER station, and well connected overall. Lots of cafes and eateries in the avenue nearby. At night, you can sit at the foot of the Pantheon and see all the way down the avenue to the Eiffel Tower! We didn't avail of the breakfast, so can't comment on that, but when we wanted a Champagne bucket with ice and glasses, they were obliging. The only thing which bothered me was, when we were being moved to the second room ( during the day, in our absence), an open bottle of Hors D'Age Cognac disappeared. We reported it to the desk, and they said they would look into it, but we have had no response to date.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay despite breakfast hassle”
Reviews.Author: Teresa1009
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night here before driving to southern France in September. The location is great - about 3-4 blocks from the Luxembourg garden and the metro and RER stop there, so getting to and from Charles de Gaulle airport was hassle-free. I booked it with a great deal on the hotel website. Watch out for those - could knock the price down significantly. Our room was not ready when we arrived, but we were able to stow our luggage and freshen up in the toilets near the lobby before heading out. We stayed in room 210 which had a view of the Pantheon (see photos). The room was small, but well-appointed. I did not sleep at all on the flight to Paris and after a whole day wandering in the city, had a great night's sleep on the comfortable bed. There is a balcony where you can have breakfast. The shower has a small glass partition and the floor will get wet, but towels can take care of that. Why don't they place shower curtains? I noticed a bit of road noise in the morning (the room is on the third floor). If this bothers you, consider a room on a higher floor or one facing the courtyard. The only glitch during our stay was breakfast. We ordered room service for 7:00 AM but did not get it. The lady at the reception could not find the breakfast server at 7:15 so we had to go down to the breakfast room, which is a cool room in the basement. The server said we ordered the breakfast for 9:00 and insisted on it, though it clearly showed 7:00 when he showed the card to my husband. The girl at the reception said she would talk to the server, but offered no compensation for the hassle. Oh well. Nevertheless we had a good experience here and would gladly stay here again next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dunfion39
Reviews.Content: I have just spent two nights at this lovely hotel near the Luxembourg Gardens in Paris.It has a fabulous outlook to the Pantheon and is in an excellent location. The rooms are lovely and the staff could not be more helpful.We did not eat there as there are so many great restaurants , cafes and bistros all around. A perfect place to stay in the heart of this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: texastraveler1563
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, I had come to Paris to visit my daughter who was studying there and had planned a 2 week stay with us traveling to Brussels, Bruges and Amsterdam during this period. The first four days we stayed here at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. Since you get into paris early in the morning our room was not ready when we arrived but we expected this, and they got us checked in quickly, took our bags and suggested some things for us to do while we waited on the room. We were very pleased with room, it was quite roomy and the bathroom with shower/bath was excellent ( I have been in bathrooms in Europe where you barely have enough room to turn around). The accommodations were very clean and the staff very helpful and nice. We had a lovely view from our window and all in all it was very pleasant stay, only wish they would have had a room for us when we returned from traveling ( they were booked for the last 2 days of stay and we ended up staying at another hotel that was not near a nice). Excellent location for this hotel also! Would definetly stay here again and highly recommend it to fellow travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mkaps
Reviews.Content: On a 10 day trip to France and this was a great hotel to start in. Fantastic location, we were able to walk to most sights although metro and RER lines are close. Room was extremely clean and a good size for Europe, we had a small balcony with a table and chairs facing an inner courtyard-quiet and perfect for reading in the morning or coffee & crepe's at night. Hotel staff was very helpful (all spoke english) with directions and advice on day trips and restaurants. Traditional breakfast left us a bit hungry I would order eggs or omelette. All in all we will loved Paris and hope to return soon and would have no hesitations on staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect taste of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 5invietnam
Reviews.Content: We, a family of five with children aged 9,14 and 15, needed a place to stay that was in easy distance of all the usual tourist sights, was in a nice location, and we also decided this was the night we would spoil ourselves with a non-budget hotel. Understanding that space is always a premium in Paris, we were happy to book two rooms at Hotel des Grandes Hommes. The hotel is easily accessed from Gare de Lyon via the RER, but you do have to walk a few blocks from Luxembourg station...so if you are heavily burdened, take a taxi! Firstly, the physical location and the ambience of the area are lovely...it is clean, open, and well provisioned with coffee shops,dre dries, little shops etc. (in one of the little side streets the children thought it looked like Diagon alley out od Harry Potter!). It felt safe, and is obviously a university area. At the tiny reception in the hotel the reception was warm, welcoming, and happy to help with our multitude of questions! the rooms were small by Australian standards, but beautifully appointed and had everything we needed. he rooms are classically decorated in the French style and very sweet and comfortable. The windows opened up on to the square of the Pantheon, and the view of the building and surrounding square was magnificent. I expected the night to be quite noisy with students, but was pleasantly surprised..it was a Monday night, and it was really very quiet. This hotel is warm, welcoming and comfortable..the staff are really lovely and speak excellent English. truthfully, I think if you had a lot of big suitcases this might not be the best place..although there may be bigger rooms than ours?? The children had a gorgeous room that slept the three of them on a double and a single located in what I suspect is usually a little lounge area. My only disappointment was that we did not choose to stay a few more days in this hotel."..it really made our brief Paris visit truly memorable. Highly, highly recommended if it is in your budget, and maybe even if it isn't!!! Pooh, and forgot to mention, the room and ensuite bathrooms were immaculately, and tastefully presented.

Reviews.Title: “Just As Great As Before”
Reviews.Author: baustin5
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to be able to return to Paris and, of course, stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes once again. The wonderful people who staff this always are willing to go out of their way to accomodate our needs. They have, in the past, even made a doctor's appointment for us. Having stayed for seven days this past trip, you would think that I could find one thing to complain about. I finally thought of one. The very helpful and personable Assistant Manager, Pierre-Louis Pelletier, decided to take his week off for holiday during our stay.I did nor need to worry. Valerie and the others did not miss a beat with their impeccable service. We love this place. Hope you guys don't overbook so that we will be able to stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Still the tops”
Reviews.Author: Le_Dap
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel once before - in 2004, and judged it a very good hotel indeed. I have visited a number of times over the years, most recently in August and September this year. I'm pleased to say that my earlier judgement still stands. In August, my wife and I stayed for one night on our way to the South. We had a balcony room on the 5th floor that was 'snug' but charmingly decorated and with a view of the Pantheon across the road. Two weeks later we were back and this time offered a larger balconied room on the 6th floor which must be the best room in the hotel. It has 3 sets of double doors leading onto a long narrow balcony with excellent views of the Pantheon, discretely lit at night, and of Sacre Coeur in the distance. Breakfast in a small basement room is O.K. but not exciting. My only small beef is that there was a vacuum cleaner placed dangerously outside our room at the top of the stairs making it difficult to take our cases to the lift when we were leaving. Hotels should avoid such carelessness.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful central stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleLG-84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our first stop in our honeymoon for 5 nights in September 2011. The hotel was in a great location, close to several metro stations and from our hotel you could get around the city very easily and quickly. The latin quarter where the hotel is located is great for cafes and bars and a reasonably priced feed. The room was a little small, as expected in central Paris, but the bathroom was a good size and the room had lots of cupboard space which made staying 5 nights very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was good. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: AmyG85
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in August with my boyfriend and another couple for one night. Location is very central and we walked all around Paris city from the hotel with no problems. The rooms can be on the small side but so are all hotel rooms in Paris. Rooms are very uniquely decorated and our had a lovel balcony over looking a small courtyard. The staff were very warm and welcoming and really could not have been muh more of a help to us. They had very good English and really went the extra mile to help us. I highly recomend this hotel and will stay there for sure when I am visiting Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, good quality, good value”
Reviews.Author: LadyLenton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights.. Wish we could have stayed for 3 more! Very Parisian, small but perfectly formed rooms. Plenty of cafes and bars in the area so no need to go far from base in the evenings if you don't want to. Great friendly service, close to notre dame n metro links. We would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot go wrong with this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Funtraveller62
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a nice surprise this turned out to be. I had researched the hotel through several resources and chose it based on that, but it really was everything that people said it was and more. When we got back from a day of sightseeing, we felt like we had left the crowded streets of Paris! It was on a square that is large and beautiful but close to restaurants and shopping. It is a short walk from the Luxembourg rer train stop, and minutes walk to the gardens. As the other reviews pointed out, the staff is amazing! We met four different people at the reception in our 6 days and they all were all wonderful and so helpful. We had an upgraded room with the view of the Pantheon, and I recommend it. It did not have a balcony and is quite small but beautifully decorated and so clean. Large windows open to a quiet square and windows could be left open at night. We ate breakfast in the neighborhood bistro called Fontaine, and recommend that over the cost of breakfast at the hotel which was not included and not special(we ate there one morning). We will return to this hotel without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel--Would Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne K
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel--service, location, rooms, breakfast. When my mother injured her knee, the hotel staff arranged a wonderful chauffeur and car to take us on an afternoon tour of Paris, including all the highlights--it was a great experience. Kids who wanted to see the new Harry Potter movie? Hotel staff got us the cinema info and printed out a map to get us to the theater. Restaurant referrals? Again--perfect and on target for our appetites and budget. On and on--everything was wonderful and we will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: cdo85
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I never write reviews. Something extraordinary would have to happen for me to even think about writing a review, good or bad. It was our first trip to Paris. We decided to take the train from the airport to save some money and because of the close proximity of the stop to the hotel. My purse was stolen in transit which included my passport, my wallet, credit cards, id, $1000, my watch and my phone. Not a great way to start the trip. When we arrived to the hotel we were greeted by Pierre and his colleague. We told them what happened and they immediately started to help me cancel credit cards by dialing my banks numbers, no questions asked. They were more concerned about helping me clean up this situation rather than how we were going to pay for the hotel, which was greatly appreciated. They also upgraded our room and made sure we were okay. All of the staff was extremely helpful with getting a new passport and directions/suggestions for things to do around the city. We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. The room was clean and comfortable. The location was great.. very close to an abundance of stores, restaurants and subway stop. I would definitely stay here again. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. The friendly/ helpful staff was one of a kind. Also, just a side note, everyone at the front desk speaks English. Thank you to everyone at hotel des grand hommes for turning our trip around!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing start to my 2 month Euro trip”
Reviews.Author: Cdchi1
Reviews.Content: Paris was the first stop of my 2 month European trip so wanted to make sure I had a great hotel to start so I did plenty of research. The TA comments and its rating settled me on Hotel des Grands Hommes. And it did not disappoint!!! Firstly, my room had BOTH a view of the pantheon and a balcony to which enjoy that view (was expecting only one or the other). The room itself was very comfortable, and this was important on the 3rd day of my 6 as I sufferred a climate change related fever and had to stay in bed to sweat it out. While not ideal, the room itself helped me endure this, as did the stafff that gave me some medication that seemed to resolve the fever quicker than rest alone I think. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was quite good with new types of jams every day it seemed though I only had breakfast twice. Oh and free WIFI was invaluable (especially during that bedridden day) If I ever return to France I Will be locking this hotel in! The only things I would suggest for the hotel to improve are to have an ironing board and iron in room (not needed for me, but others would like), and a longer shower screen (though when in france, have a nice long bath!!!) By the way, I am not sure as I ahve not checked my bill yet., but the stated international call rates from hotel room were incredibly low compared to say using your mobile with global roaming...expect this saved me quite a bit though need to confirm there were no additional charges to those quoted. Would add photos but am currently at a very ordinary internet cafe in san sebastian Spain (the room there has NO internet)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cflaw
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from six days in Paris where we stayed at Hôtel des Grands Hommes. I had been to Paris several times before but this was the most enjoyable visit due largely to the great hospitality and great location of Hôtel des Grands Hommes. I can't say enough about the hotel staff. From check-in to check-out, every staff member we encountered was friendly and made you feel right at home and they all went out of their way to make our stay fantastic. The Assistant Manager, Pierre-Louis Pelletier, is one of the most personable, helpful and professional hotel managers I have ever encountered and his entire staff is to be commended The room was typical Paris small, but had all we needed, including a fantastic view of the Pantheon. The rooms are very comfortable and super clean and traffic noise was not an issue. The comfort of the beds, the quality of the linens and the quietness of the air conditioning were outstanding. The location could not be better. Although public transportation is very close, we walked everywhere: the Louvre, Notre Dame, Musée d'Orsay, Eiffel Tower and more. Moreover, the hotel is situated away from the tourist crowds, in a lovely neighborhood with fresh produce markets, excellent cafes and restaurants, and interesting shops of all kinds. If you are looking for a small hotel that has old world charm, a warm friendly helpful staff, and a great location, look no further. If you want a huge, ultramodern, chic hotel in the hustle and bustle, look elsewhere. For us, this is the hotel we will always return to when we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this small boutique hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: JetSet_0000
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly staff, very very cute boutique hotel in a fantastic location. Get the view room, it is worth it. Small room but expected for France.

Reviews.Title: “My nieces went absolutely crazy for this hotel - mission accomplished!”
Reviews.Author: PearlEscapes
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, view was out of this world. Breakfast was also great and the coffee was some of the best I've had!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Gerbeno
Reviews.Content: This hotel definetly deserves all the good reviews. The rooms are small, but clean and well furnished. The location of the hotel is very convenient, close to a public parking garage, RER and metro stations and lots of restaurants. My only complaint is that there are no alternative escape routes in case of fire and no emergency exit information in the room itself.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: ktizme
Reviews.Content: My daughter gifted me with my first trip to Paris for my 60th birthday. What an incredible trip! I cannot even begin to express how wonderful it was to spend 10 days with her -- and to experience the beauty of Paris!!! We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes and were very happy with our stay there. The staff was wonderful, spoke English when we needed it, and it was in a lovely part of the Latin Quarter - just across from the Pantheon. You could walk to the corner and see the Eiffel Tower sparkling...or walk several blocks to La Rue Mouffetard.... or a few blocks down the hill to Le Jardins Luxembourg. There were many excellent restaurants nearby and it was very near Le Metro. The bathroom was lovely....and the room very quiet and peaceful. The beds themselves could use some upgrading -- the only thing that was not perfect. I actually slept upside down on the bed to find a little firmer mattress. I have a very bad back....so that was tricky. But...despite that... I would definitely think of returning here in the future....It was and is a lovely memory of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....But”
Reviews.Author: TeeBee_2
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general lived up to its billing. Our courtyard room was small but well furnished and more than enough for our needs. A great location next to the Pantheon and east access to RER,Metro and bus routes. Locally there are cafes and restaurants typical of the Paris scene. Our only complaint was Breakfast. we only used the vaulted dining area once for breakfast over the weekend. We were told that breakfast was 11 Euros, typical of Paris. However, on taking our seats we were simply asked what we would like, we were not offered menus. My wife chose an omelette and I chose toast and a croisant. We both had coffee. the breakfast was OK, nothing special by Paris/French standards. On checking out they attemted to charge us almost 40 Euros. We were offered some explanation of this appraoch being the best formaula for a 3* Paris Hotel and was researched by the owner and proprietor. I refused to paty the charge but agreed to pay the advertised 11 Euros each, although we were not offered the full 11 Euro menu. The hotel agreed to reduce the cost. I had to argue the point and I feel less confident guests will simply pay. It spoiled what had been a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service, charming hotel, just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: pragueemily
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. We could have gone anywhere in Europe but chose Paris as our destination specifically for this hotel. Once again the service was perfect - the staff was so friendly, the room was charming and very clean, the location can't be beat. It's just a first class place and we are quite picky so this is a real compliment. Our room...facing the back courtyard...was also very quiet which was key. I can't recommend this hotel more. It's a real find.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: 1anita
Reviews.Content: Small but perfect. A keeper. Rooms are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: ThreeInAPod
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel with authentic traditional French decor. The rooms are small but clean and provide all necessities. Even with one child the room worked well, though be sure to book a triple room. Internet worked well. The staff is friendly, gracious, and very accommodating. Breakfast in the cozy downstairs tavern is delicious. Across the street from the Pantheon and near the fascinating sights and quaint streets of old Roman Paris, the location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, fun, well located”
Reviews.Author: brazilwest12
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to billing. Small rooms - yes - this is Paris. Clean - yes. Convenient - yes, great. Friendly - yes, confounds stereotype - staff were lovely. Possible to have bad experience ? yes - so is earthquake. Recommended ? Yes - highly. Good restaurants, breakfast places, metro all nearby. Value for money - yes. 9 out of ten!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Brit-in-America
Reviews.Content: We found and booked this hotel online. We liked the location next to the Pantheon. It was a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame and the Seine, and there were numerous good restaurants within a 15 minute walk of the hotel. The hotel itself was clean and well appointed. We had a room with a sitting area which was very comfortable. It was also nice to have a bath in the bathroom. We had the classic buffet breakfast each morning, sometimes served in the vaulted ceilinged breakfast room on the lower level and sometimes served in our room. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we felt very welcome in the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: GillRichardson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in June 2011 and found the hotel to be every bit as good as the Tripadvisor reviews indicated. The rooms are beautiful, the hotel is conveniently situated, with fantastic views of the Pantheon, and the staff were wonderful, particularly Pierre!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Boutique Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: CozSydney
Reviews.Content: We arrived straight to this Hotel from our long 24 hour trip from Australia at 9am. The staff were SO helpful and managed to check us in early at 10am instead of 2pm which we were so so so appreciative of feeling exhausted from the trip! We were so excited to walk in to our gorgeous, ornate Parisian Hotel room with beautiful bathroom and view straight at the Pantheon. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, I have already recommended it to another friend going to Paris. I LOVED our stay here as it is also a great location! I will definitely stay here again next trip to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, staff and interior”
Reviews.Author: ZiadR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is opposite the pantheon  in a very nice building overlooking the Pantheon. The lobby is small but very nicely decorated as were the rooms. The rooms are small with just enough space to get around the bed but are very nicely decorated and very clean. Rooming cleaning is good but can be done very late. The continental  breakfast is10 euros and includes a basket of bread and a reasonable croissant. We preferred to go to breakfast around the corner which had excellent croissants. The staff are nice especially the gentleman in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonM78
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Paris and by far the best place I've stayed, not just the hotel but the fabulous location. We'd decided we wanted to be around the Latin Quarter and had never seen the Pantheon on previous trips, so decided on Hotel des Grands Hommes after a bit of research and reading some good reviews. I'm glad we did! The location right on Place du Pantheon has a real 'wow' factor and it's handy for some other great spots too - as well as the Pantheon itself (the roof tour is a must - fabulous views across Paris!), we visited the Institut du Monde Arabe, Natural History Museum (in Jardin des Plantes), the Sunday market on Rue Mouffetard and the Paris Mosque. All the hotel staff staff were excellent and although our room (24) was quite small, it was nicely done and the bathroom was huge! The spiral staircase up to the rooms was a nice feature too. I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone else visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ChuckGlobal99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel des Grands Hommes for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon trip to Europe. I think every room is unique but we stayed in room 01 and it was excellent. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and they always smiled at my weak attempts to speak French :) The room was spacious, very clean, but doesn't have a nice view of the Pantheon as it was at street level. We ate breakfast one morning and it was ok but much better options are at the small cafes in the surrounding neighboorhood. The location was a bit of a walk to Notre Dame and the nearest Metro stations but the area is very nice and I would reccomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bon”
Reviews.Author: lisa4040
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay, the staff are very friendly and helpful and our room was clean, quiet and beautifully decorated with fabric wallpaper and one off items of furniture. The double bed was comfortable and we liked having sheets, blankets and throw to regulate temperature. Room had air con but we preferred to leave our balcony window open at night as it was less noisy. The location is opposite the Pantheon and most places are downhill (you can burn some calories walking off your wonderful meal on the upward walk home). Latin quarter and fab specialist shops can be found behind the hotel so nice and close for those "lazy" nights and Luxembourg Gardens 5 mins walk and not to be missed. As Brits hubby was glad we packed travel kettle for his morning cup of tea and whilst there is a perfectly adequate hotel hairdyer wired into the bathroom I was glad to have my own travel one. For general info on housekeeping our room had a mini fridge, complimentary slippers but not bathrobes, no ironing facilities but think you can ask for them if required. Also shower gel and shampoo which is replenished daily and there's a safe. Few other bits and pieces such as laundry bag, shoe polish sponge, sewing kit, shower cap. We would defintely recommend this hotel for its quiet location and professional staff. We loved this hotel and we loved Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: MsTrellis
Reviews.Content: (We are catching up on our reviews, so please note that we stayed here almost a year ago) We stayed here twice last year, the most recently being in early summer. Visitors coming for the film-set 'classic' Paris look, will adore the design scheme. The rooms are comfortable, and the superior room we stayed in for our first visit (February) had masses of storage space and was a very good size, as well as having an amazing view from the balcony. The reception staff were very helpful, spoke excellent English but were patient with our attempts at French. For us, the hotel only represents good value if you can stay on a special rate, as guests are paying for things that we don't feel we need. (For instance, we saw that the concierge service offered was excellent, but we never use a concierge service, preferring to do our own research) Similarly, the (pricey) breakfast menus sounded really excellent, if you want to eat a high-class breakfast in your hotel. (We preferred to do as the locals do, and have coffee and croissants in local cafes for a fraction of the price). Noise at the front of the hotel (where the nicest rooms are) was a real issue. Place du Pantheon has a strong echo, which means that every group of revellers and every car sounds incredibly loud. We couldn't sleep with the windows open, which was not a problem in February, but would have been later in the year, hence our choice to have a smaller, standard, room at the back of the hotel on our return. The internet connection was poor. We both had problems getting a wifi connection in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RodP11
Reviews.Content: Recommended by our travel agent for our first time in Paris. We were looking for a reasonably priced room (as we were splurging on the cote d'zur). The staff was great and accommodating but the rooms were even smaller than I expected. We had two big suitcases which barely fit in the room but the decor was charming. We paid a comparable price for a room in Rome but it felt much more spacious. The location was lovely with the luxembourg gardens right down the street but we did feel like it was a minimum 15 to 20 minute walk everywhere. Metro was about 10 mins away and was a great way to get around town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmarie1022
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on May 29th. I arrived in the evening after a long train ride, and wanted something that was easy to get to from Gare Austerlitz and on the RER2 line for my trip to the airport the next day. This hotel exceeded my expectations. My room was beautiful and very comfortable, with a separate sitting area and balcony access from the bedroom and bathroom. The balcony overlooked the Pantheon and you could see Sacre Coeur in the distance. It was a very relaxing experience for one last night in Paris and I would definitely choose this hotel again. Great location in the city and great service (although with such a short stay I didn't interact with the staff too much).

Reviews.Title: “This is now the only place we will stay in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: RFB55
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes was just wonderful. This was my second visit to Paris and this is now the only place I will stay. The hotel is so charming, very convenient (walking distance) to many of the areas I wanted to visit. The hotel staff is what makes this hotel outstanding, professional, friendly, funny and charming. We had a disaster the day we were checking out when we found our flight home had been cancelled and we couldn't leave until the following day. We were offered the use of the hotel computer, phones and arrangements were made for rooms in the blink of an eye. As we were told, "How wonderful, you have another day in Paris", it put things in the right perspective! I can not recommend this hotel more highly and this will be the only place I will stay when I return to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PerthWATraveller23
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. My wife and I stayed 5 nights in April 2011. I found the positive reviews to be well justified. The location was ideal for our purposes, close to Metro (10 min walk) and the Latin Quarter as well as other places of interest. I have stayed at many hotels in Paris in the past and will definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff were friendly and most helpful. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location and welcome”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: Superbly convenient location, 5 mins from Luxembourg station which connects to CDG airport by fast train. Quaint but small, quiet rooms, extremely pleasant and helpful staff. A few pleasant minutes stroll to the well populated Latin Quarter restaurant area. Very pleasant breakfast area, with wholesome produce. A gem of a find!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ColinWGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great bit of town. Notre Dame and the latin quarter are an easy 10 minute walk away. The rooms are a little on the small side but they are stylish and have a wonderful view of the Pantheon and the surrounding square (for front facing rooms anyway). The staff are excellent; friendly yet respectful. Everything is clean and tidy, no problems there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: greckers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from May 9 - 14, 2011 for our 10th wedding anniversary. We had room 32 which overlooked the Pantheon, but has no balcony. The hotel was very helpful and quick to respond via email leading up to our stay and gave us a bottle of champagne upon arrival for our anniversary. They had sprinkled rose petals on our bed - which was a cute touch as well. The location could not be better. You are very close to the RER station which means taking public transit from CDG to the hotel, couldn't be easier. Tip --- if you are coming off the RER, go left out of the train it brings you closer to the more convenient corner to go in a straight-shot up to the hotel. From here you can to any of the major sites anywhere in Paris within 1 or 2 connections max. The hotel was very clean. There was a convenient mini-fridge in the room with good closet/drawer space. There is an amazing bakery if you hang a left out the front door and another immediate left. At the top of the street - across on the right - a little patisserie with fresh OJ and croissants, baguettes, etc. Banks very close as well as restaurants, gelato, creperie and Illy coffee bar. To address a couple of complaints that I often read about on the review for this hotel: 1) small rooms and 2) firm beds: 1) Our room (32) although not massive, was not that small; I've stayed in far smaller in NYC; it was the size I expected for an old, restored property in the center of Paris that isn't part of a major chain; 2) the beds are firm - but not grossly uncomfortable firm. There is no Eurotop, which may make it seem firmer to some, but I have slept on far firmer in other places in Europe. I would not let this be a prohibitive factor for you unless you have serious existing back problems, in which case finding the perfect hotel bed will always be a challenge - sometimes they are too soft too! My only two remarks (not complaints as there are far worse things that could happen in a hotel) but to be fully transparent in my observations: 1) the showerhead left something to be desired - it didn't spray evenly (even when we tried to change it) and with the Euro-style tubs, well it makes it hard to have a shower without getting the whole bathroom soaking - but this is not unique to this property based on my travel experience. 2) The wall behind the toilet paper holder was patched but not sanded/painted. That's it. Otherwise, wonderful stay, excellent location, good price. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Room and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Sheharav
Reviews.Content: I have used Trip Advisor for a long time to find good hotels but this is the first time I am writing a review - because I really wanted to share what a great hotel this is. The location is very good - overlooking the Pantheon, but also not too touristy as it is right near the Sorborne and full of students. The room was very clean and comfortable. But the best part was the service. We stayed for 5 days and everyone at the front desk was great and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “All hotels since have been compared to this one!”
Reviews.Author: dchristi77
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I took off to Paris and Amsterdam last summer, and she picked this place, and we could not have been happier! The location is phenomenal, and we upgraded to a balcony room with a view of the Pantheon. We spent several hours just people-watching. Lots of cute shops and bistros in the area, and the service was excellent. We have since been on several other trips, and this is now the standard hotel to which all others are compared. Yes, it's small, but it's Paris - all rooms are small! We were able to procure twin beds, which was a huge plus. We had a small fridge (where else to store the cheese?!) which was a nice bonus. There is also an elevator, or you can climb the dizzying stairs as we did most of the time. Overall, I'd stay again in a heartbeat, and have recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SharonEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel in a great position, excellent staff, very helpful and all spoke perfect english. Exceptionally clean and great beds. Book a room with a view of the Pantheon. Surrounding area has some great bistro restaurants that are very reasonable e.g Le Berthoud great 2 course dinner 16 euros. Try Bateau de Calife for a dinner cruise on the seine

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: ParisTravel36
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over Easter. The hotel is full of character and charm. We had a room with a balcony with an amasing view of the Pantheon. The room was not as small as I was expecting with a good size very comfortable bed and a nice sized bathroom with bath. The location is perfect for getting around Paris, a few minutes stroll from the Luxemburg gardens with cafes right on the doorstep with views of the Eiffel Tower. We didnt have breakfast included in our deal, but this didnt matter as there was so many cafes to choose from just a few metres from the hotel with breakfast (orange juice, coffee, baguette and croissant) for around 7 euros. The staff at the hotel were very friendly, helpful and welcoming. The only downside was that the area in front of the Pantheon seems to attract groups of people at night and could be quite noisey. But this didnt disturb us too much as we were on the 5th floor. Also the airconditioning in the room was not very good and as the temperature didnt get much below 25 degrees during the day this made the rooms quite warm. But that said we throughly enjoyed our stay and would definately recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...but very small!!”
Reviews.Author: Divasch44
