Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister April of 2011. The room was very tiny. In fact we had to ask for a desk chair to be taken out in order to have room to get around. I believe there are a few slightly larger rooms, but do your research to get it. Our view sucked. We faced another hotel/apartment. We paid 267 dollars per night. The entire hotel is small. However, I think this is common for hotels in this area. Good side...Good location. It is a mile from the the Notre Dame Cathedral and Latin Quarter areas. It is also close to a metro stop for subway travel. The staff was kind to American non-French speaking tourists. The hotel is clean. The hotel reflects French tastes so think old...but it does not have that old musty smell. I would stay here again, but only if I could get a bigger room that faced the main street (Pantheon).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rob091
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel and had a great time. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated and the location is perfect, directly opposite the Pantheon. The staff were always friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations and advice about Paris. The weather was warm during our stay and my only issue was that the airconditioner couldn't cool the room enough so we had to sleep with the windows open. Restaurant Perraudin is a few minutes away and is a good choice for well cooked traditional French food.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: CTtraveler2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights. The desk staff were all charming, helpful, spoke fluent English, and always made time to answer questions. We paid a bit more for a larger room with a view of the Pantheon(right outside our window), (remember hotel rooms in Europe are much smaller than in US, so don't expect a lot even if you pay more for 'larger'). But the room was spacious enough, beds very comfortable, plenty of hot water and great shower, immaculately clean. Mini fridge in the room, staff will get you ice if you ask. We loved the location, right in the Sorbonne area, metro stop about 5 minute walk away, Notre Dame about 15-20 min. stroll down Blvd San Michel. It seemed it might be noisy at night, as the main street around the Pantheon went just under our window, but it was quiet at night for sleeping. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, seemed pricey for what you got. Just down the street to the left on rue Souffelot there are several cafes serving breakfast for less. Wonderful pastry shop around the corner on the left as you exit, up on the next street. Nice safe area to walk at night too.

Reviews.Title: “Very quick refund”
Reviews.Author: alpenmicho
Reviews.Content: This is not a review of the hotel itself but regarding their reservations. We cancelled a reservation (note this was a refundable reservation booked on their website). I just wanted to say that my credit card was promptly credited within a week. This is good to know as sometimes you wonder how prompt a refund would be if you had to cancel. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: LucaBusiate
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel which is situated nicely right next to the Pantheon. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable, nicely decorated and had a small balcony with a great view towards the Pantheon. Overall, we can fully recommend the place and will come back next time we stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This 'hotel of great men' is unfortunately not staffed by them.”
Reviews.Author: dilemmilou
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had very high expectations for this hotel, particularly considering the price, and though it was, for the most part, lovely, it fell short. We arrived a little early, and so happily left our luggage with reception and went to lunch. We returned after the designated check-in time to find that our room still wasn't ready, which was disappointing, considering that staff were aware we had already arrived. The room itself was beautifully decorated, which was lucky, as my boyfriend fell very ill during our stay, and so we spent most of our time in Paris there. The staff had impeccable manners, but weren't quite what I would call 'friendly'. I do not speak French, and I was sorry to find that their interest in helping me find medical help was so indifferent. There is only one staff member at reception after 7pm, and so our request to have somebody attend to our malfunctioning safe was told it would have to wait until morning. When somebody finally did come, it literally only took thirty seconds. The hotel keys are attached to large, tasselled key rings, and guests are expected to leave these at reception each time they go out. We found this particularly irritating, as due to the few staff members, we almost always had to wait, and disliked the feeling of constantly checking in. In terms of location, this hotel can't be beaten - it's literally next door to the Pantheon, and within five minutes walk of Luxembourg RER. A lovely room with decent views, and more space than one usually expects in Paris, but unfortunately, we would not return.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 24delvecchio
Reviews.Content: rooms are very clean and cozy but quite small. staff very friendly and helpful, in the upper departments nice view to the pantheon (and montmartre). good location, in the middle of quartier latin, close to the luxembourg garden and metro station (direct connection to airport cdg).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: kennymac1966
Reviews.Content: High quality, comfortable room, spotlessly clean, friendly staff, would recommend it to anyone. If I was being negative, the continental breakfast is a bit minimal for €10. And a bit of advice for metro users, the literature said to go to Cardinal Lemoine but it was much more convenient to use Luxembourg, which is just as near and goes straight to CDG airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vagabonds60
Reviews.Content: We found this Hotel through Trip Advisor based primarily on individual reviews of past guests. We wanted a quintessential Parisian Hotel in the Sorbonne area for our 6th visit to this great city and we definitely hit a homerun with Hotel des Grands Hommes. Our room view was out over the Pantheon and parts of the university. Along with this was close proximity to the Latin Quarter(great food at reasonable prices) and the river with all that it has along it's banks. The Hotel itself was clean, well appointed and staffed with knowledgeable friendly people. The room was bigger than most(ours was for 3 people), warm and had very comfortable beds. We would like to thank Pierre and his staff for taking such good care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Hepburnsdress
Reviews.Content: I decided to travel to Paris alone for a holiday, and came on the Trip Advisor forums to ask about good hotels for lone female travellers - I wanted to book somewhere in a good location, where I thought I would feel safe at night etc. Somebody recommended the Paris Rive Gauche chain of hotels. I went for the Hotel des Grandes Hommes. I booked well in advance online and got a very good rate. The hotel was very easy to find - less than 5 minutes from the Luxembourg RER. The location is outstanding. Very central and within walking distance of nearly all the main attractions. The room was beautifully decorated, and, yes, that view of the Pantheon was staggering. Some may have found the room a small - it's all about your expectations. It was perfect for me. There was a little traffic noise, but nothing to stop you sleeping. The hotel itself was blissfully quiet. The staff were exceptionally helpful and polite. And as for being a lone traveller... I felt very safe in the hotel. No issues with security. The area around the Pantheon is busy. There are also plenty of students around because of the proximity to the Sorbonne - a great atmosphere. Walking around at night was no problem. All in all, an excellent stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly overrated, an overpriced disappointment”
Reviews.Author: artemisworks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night as we were passing through Paris en route home after a holiday in Brittany. I decided to splurge a little as we wanted to end our holiday on a bright note, having had rather negative experiences at other Paris hotels in the past, but this turned out to be an expensive disappointment despite all the other glowing reviews in TripAdvisor. The hotel has a good location, being right opposite the Pantheon, and I understand we were probably not given the best room as we were only staying one night, but the room was quite small, and the bathroom was almost two thirds the size of the bedroom - quite sizeable for a bathroom. The furnishings were really eccentric - when we decided to stay in a boutique hotel, we knew the furnishings weren't going to be sleek and modern, but what we got seemed like an ugly mix of mismatched furniture. The carpet had seen better days, and the lighting in the room was atrocious - (probably 20W) energy saver lightbulbs that made it absolutely impossible to read in the room at night!!! The wallpaper was also a hideous choice and the decor made the small room feel even smaller and quite oppressive. The safe had been locked by someone else and the TV wasn't working. To be fair, when we informed the reception, he offered some suggestions and it turned out that the aerial cable had been unplugged, so the TV worked after that. But worst of all, the small room had a bottle of perfume with 'perfume sticks' to scent the room, and the sickly sweet smell was so overpowering that it was the first thing I noticed when I entered the room. In fact, it was too much so I had to move the bottle to the bathroom, but still, I could not sleep much all night because of the suffocating smell and the heat.. I ended up having to open a window to let some air in. The hotel should really consider that some people do not like, or are sensitive to overpowering perfumes before inflicting such pervasive 'aromatherapy' on unsuspecting guests. The tiny lift was also very slow, but any attempt to use the spiral staircase to go downstairs/upstairs resulted in a unique, drunken experience - without the alcohol. The staircase sloped towards the middle, which had a rather disorientating effect on anyone trying to use them. We did not have breakfast at this hotel - at this price, we didn't want to pay any more for breakfast! We had a perfectly serviceable breakfast at a cafe behind the hotel. To be fair, the hotel has a good location and the staff at reception were friendly and professional. But the sickly overwhelming 'hotel perfume' and beguiling wallpaper have already become the stuff of nightmares for a while to come.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: flybyfly
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short weekend trip to Paris with my Partner and we stayed at the Hotel Des Grand Hommes. We booked the hotel after reading glowing reviews from Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. From the moment we checked in the service provided by the staff was faultless and we were made to feel very welcome. The little jar of sweets given to us upon check in was much appreciated. Our room was a good size for Paris, and had a small balcony with stunning views of the Pantheon. The room was spotlessly clean and this was maintained throughout the trip. We spoke to several members of the hotel reception staff who were a credit to the hotel, and went out of their way to provide a great service. The hotel is located in a great area of Paris around a 10-15 minute walk to Notre Dame and the Concierge. The nearest Metro stop is Cardinal Lemoine (line 10) and the RER at Luxembourg. The hotel is approximately a 10 mintue walk from both of these stops and provides great links to explore Paris if you use the metro. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends, and look forward to staying there again when we revisit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Parisian experience!”
Reviews.Author: fcparma19
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Paris with my mom where I stayed at the Hotel des Grandes Hommes. Both my mom and I have been to Paris before and are expert international travelers but this was our best experience yet. The hotel was in an excellent location in front of the Pantheon and was a 5 minute walk to Luxembourg Gardens and the RER which made sightseeing very easy. The hotel staff was incredibly helpful and willing to offer suggestions and recommendations. The room was very clean and was a typical Parisian room with 2 twin beds. I had a view of the Pantheon from my bedroom window and I did not find the street side of the hotel noisy. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others and hopefully will be back myself.

Reviews.Title: “very chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJ-NC
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights on a short break to Paris, Hotel in good location with easy access to Metro, Staff very friendly, english spoken & they are very willing to recommend and book local restaurants if required,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Olie_manchester
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the weekend in Paris and would like to highly recommend this hotel. I agree with most other posts that the staff were very helpful and even remembered my email I sent last October where I mentioned I planned to propose to my girlfriend. They recommended a nice French restaurant not 5 mins away, name escapes me. The room was big enough for the weekend I was there and the view along with the balcony upgrade was just brilliant overlooking the quiet square and panatheon. Definatley recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm - New World Services”
Reviews.Author: chipscar13
Reviews.Content: Great location and wonderful place to have a meeting with customers. Sleeping room was on the large size for Paris and a great view overlooking the Pantheon plaza. Hotel staff was VERY friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: browncoat07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying here for 3 nights earlier this month. Yes the rooms are quite small, but that's quite the norm in Paris. They are very comfortable rooms and beautifully decorated and kept. I understand some people had issues with sheets rather than duvets. We had no such issues and found the bed very comfortable. This was especially surprising considering my wife is pregnant and is rarely comfortable! Oh and there is free wifi. However it was the service that was particularly excellent. Right from booking, through to arrival, our stay and checking out, nothing was a hassle. The restaurant recommendations were very good. (I would particularly recommend a 'neo-bistro' by Le Gobelins called L'Ourcine. It's cosy but the food was magnificent). Location was perfect with a beautiful view of The Pantheon which meant it was just outside the tourist areas but within easy reach of the metro and RER. Only 15-20mins form Gare du Nord to RER Luxembourg, then a quick walk. All the tourist areas are within walking distance or a quick Metro trip. Check out the food market on Sunday's just around the corner. Without doubt when we return we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: drm
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel in a perfect location overlooking the Pantheo and near Mouffetard street. The hotel is steps away from the boutiques of the St Germain district and a few minutes walk from the Luxembourg RER station. The staff is always doing extra efforts to please you. This kind of service is rarely seen. I look forward to the next time I can visit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good for Paris”
Reviews.Author: DCMANYC
Reviews.Content: In the context of an expensive city and European standards for hotel rooms (i.e., small), this hotel met our need, albeit not quite as comfortably as I'd hoped. We had a courtyard room, so bear that in mind. The location was good for the money. That's 3/4 of the battle. The breakfast was good - the little lady downstairs really bustled about and was friendly. The desk staff was just okay. They spoke English but weren't so hot with metro directions or being helpful about providing extra pillows, for example. I have to agree w the other reviewer who mentioned how uncomfortable the beds were -- after one night I felt like I had a bruise on my hip and a crick in my neck. Just terrible. And, I've seen in other European hotels the one-third plastic door to the shower mechanism and it worked just as poorly here as in other hotels. The soundproofing b/w rooms was also not great. So, would I stay there again? I don't know - I may look for something slightly more upscale in the Saint Germain district.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Gideon34
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, convenient and pleasant hotel. I booked quite late on a discount rate, but was upgraded to an excellent room with views across to the Pantheon. This worked out as far better value for money than any of several other hotels I have used in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Another Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tyneside_Travellers
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit and we enjoyed it just as much as the first (in 2008). The hotel is in a great location right opposite the Pantheon and near to Jardin du Luxembourg and the cafe culture in Place de la Contrescarpe. We once again found it to be an ideal base for exploring Paris. The Metro is not too far away and the RER rail link is close by making it easy to get to/from CDG airport – a real plus for avoiding rush hour traffic. There's a real charm about the hotel , with the staff intent on helping the guests feel at home. We had a very comfortable and well-appointed room (#51), though we decided not to have breakfast out on our balcony (it was January). The relaxed and friendly atmosphere certainly makes it our favourite place to stay in Paris and it will be our first choice for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very helpful staff, comfortable room with stunning view”
Reviews.Author: emmajh45
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel - 5 minute walk from Luxembourg RER station which is only a couple of stops from Gare du Nord and Eurostar. We paid the extra for the deluxe room with view - very little wardrobe space and no drawers but thankfully we travelled light. Separate sitting area and nice bathroom. Lovely view of the Pantheon from both windows. Bottle of wine on arrival, very friendly staff with good English. Nice restaurants and St Michel within 5 minute walk with shops, bars, more restaurants. The only downside was the noise from the square as the bars chucked out in the early hours so not much sleep! Would stay here again but not in a room facing the square.

Reviews.Title: “fabulously decorated and situated with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: barschwar2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband. It was his first trip to Paris and I don't know how many times he said how terrifically situated this hotel is! We walked to all the sights without having to jump on the metro. The staff was friendly, spoke english fairly well and were kind about us trying to use our french. The room was wonderfully decorated with great attention to detail. The bed was firm and comfortable. It was wonderful to be across from the Pantheon with a view of the Eiffel Tower down the street as we walked each morning to our next adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Tight quarters...average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texasfly
Reviews.Content: I recognize that it is normal to have a room that is small in Paris...I get it. Unfortunately it still doesn't feel good. The hotel was an average, mid class hotel and we were looking for a little higher quality. The front desk attendant was helpful but usually they were the only staff available. We will look to stay in a higher quality hotel next time. This would be an excellent choice for budget conscience travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Accomodation with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: RoderickMatthew
Reviews.Content: Beautifil rooms, very helpful staff who go out of there way to ensure a great stay. This is our fourth visit here and whether we have stayed in the standard room or the suite the service and cleanliness has always been exceptional. The location is very convenient for Bercy station or Montparnassa. Will be back again later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, hassle-free hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: BenjLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, quiet and had a genuine Parisian character. Location is excellent - v close to Metro and only 20mins from Gard du Nord by RER. Easy to walk everywhere. The room we were given was superb - breathtaking view of the Pantheon (ask for this) although it meant it was a little noisy on our first evening (some French youths singing late into the night!). Staff helpful and polite. Did not take breakfast or use any other services so cannot comment on those.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, warm and welcoming and very comfortable. We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: mklm
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful and helpful, our room was beautiful with a fantastic view where we could see from the Pantheon to Sacre Coeur. Rooms are small by American standards but very well furnished and lovely. Breakfast was in a charming cave like room. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: mrcox79
Reviews.Content: Hadn't been to Paris for 20 years so decided to make a bit of an effort for this trip - a combined Wedding Anniversary/ Wife's Birthday affair. After some extensive TripAdvisor research and booking early (anyone out there remember Fred Pontin?), I settled on the HdGH. And was very happy with it! Not to repeat everyone else's reviews: - great location - worth paying for the side with the view - helpful staff - they even arranged snow to make my visit more romantic Now, if only AirFrance hadn't lost my luggage on the departure...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JacovW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel extensively and this was the best and friendliest service we have ever received. The room was very cozy and decorated to our taste - our own French boudoir. Location perfect, next to the Pantheon just off Saint Michael. With St Germain Boulevard, Latin Quarter and Luxembourg Gardens on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and cozy”
Reviews.Author: my_tourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and all was perfect. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: LCKwek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at an ideal location, next to the Pantheon, in the middle of Latin Quartier. The rooms are neat and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place near luxembourg gardens and the pantheon”
Reviews.Author: artsman
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with friendly helpful staff and a useful location. It serves a good breakfast menu. My only complaint would concern the bedding. I hate bolsters and they don't seem to have a stock of decent pillow if you ask for one. Also I like a duvet rather than blankets. Stay here by all means but check the opposition out if the price is similar.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: pglgs
Reviews.Content: Very good location, very friendly service. Rather small rooms but clean. Room was not ready upon arrival and received other room without any problems. One minor: pillows were not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel very good located”
Reviews.Author: MariJara
Reviews.Content: It´s a small hotel but very elegant and well deccorated. Our room had a very good size although it was a superior room with fantastic views tu the Pantheon. It is ver good located. You can go walking to Notre Dame and the RER is five minutes walkig to the direct line to the airport. Also the location is great because many Cafes and restaurants are around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not as good as all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: TimHel
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking this hotel was great. Great location - close to cafes, restaurants, shops & attractions yet in a nice quiet area. Staff were great - very pleasant & helpful. Room was small but clean & nicely decorated & the view was fab - walked out onto our balcony & we looked straight out onto The Pantheon. The only negative things I would say is that the bathroom was below average. I would class it as dated rather than traditional & the shower was pretty poor. Not ideal after long cold walks around Paris when all I wanted to do was to stand under a hot powerful shower! The other negative was the bed, Not the most comfortable & no quilts - just sheets & blankets! Because it was so cold when we stayed the blanket/sheet combo did not keep me warm during the night so we had to boost the central heating. I am someone that appreciates quality bed linen & this just wasn't up to standard for me. Because of this we didn't feel like we have the best nights sleep! Not ideal for a busy weekend! Generally speaking good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Enhanced .. Thanks to Hotel DES Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTripper
Reviews.Content: There aren't enough superlatives to describe our experiences at G.H. From our checkin to walking into the magnificently appointed rooms and breathtaking views of the Pantheon from the balcony.. This hotel delivers on every level. Staff that are diligent about making us comfortable .. Everything from the typical suggestions on restaurants and shopping areas .. To helpful reminders of Metro closures due to austerity strikes.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: florecitarockera_92
Reviews.Content: I would like to begin my review by saying that the staff at the hotel is extremely friendly and helpful. Before our arrival, the hotel sent an e-mail to me asking if I had any special requests for my future stay. I thought that was a very neat thing to do, since most hotel chains don't care whether you have special requests or not. Upon arrival we felt extremely welcomed and they even left a welcome letter in our room. They gave us a city map and answered all of our questions regarding tourist attractions etc, etc. The rooms are not tiny like in many Paris hotels. The rooms are also very cozy and neatly cleaned everyday. They even left us two coffee candies on top of our beds every day. The rooms are so French and your stay will make you feel like you went back in time. The continental breakfast was exquisite and the breakfast room is just charming. Overall I have to say the hotel surpassed by far my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay - large bathrooms- nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Gigi1036
Reviews.Content: We are a family with two adults and two boys ages 10 and 12 and stayed two nights at the Hotel Des Grands Hommes across from the Panethenon. The staff recommended the cafe right around the corner called Le Comptoir du Pantheon. Our boys liked the Penne with four cheeses so much that we ate three meals there over the course of our 2 and 1/2 day stay. The staff spook english at both the hotel and the cafe. The fish special at the cafe was amazing. We had two rooms on the first floor- rooms 10 and 12 looking out at the Panthenon. I thought that they would be noisy since they were so close to the lobby and the street but they were fine and I am a light sleeper. We had one each deluxe room and a superior double room. The deluxe room was very large by Paris standards with a little entry way,a closet and a sitting area with a small daybed. I would not consider it a suite by American standards but it was very comfortable. The superior room was small by American standards but worked out fine. Each room had a flat screen tv. No clocks so bring your own travel clock. Valarie at the front desk was very helpful and spoke English very well. This hotel made our short Paris visit very comfortable. It was a safe neighborhood within walking distance of some of the sights. We took the metro quite a lot and found it easy.

Reviews.Title: “A Paris gem: affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: MissAnd123
Reviews.Content: Take advantage while this hotel is rated 3 stars - it should be at least 4! The 18thC Hotel des Grands Hommes claims an artistic history (Andre Breton once lived and is reputed to have written his manifesto for Surrealism there) and our experience was that the hotel really does celebrate Paris' rich history with 21st century comfort. The room we stayed in was exquisite - gorgeous furnishings, and an eye for detail from the wall fabric to the cornicework, a decent amount of floor space, and well heated. It was a joy to stay in, especially on the rainy days. We had a magnificent view of the Pantheon which was to die for. The only letdown was the very ordinary showerhead, which sprayed water everywhere, soaking the bathroom floor - thankfully the toilet was in a separate room.. Make sure you have the breakfast at the hotel, it's excellent value; the food is very good, especially the rustic savoury breakfast with preserved meats and cheeses. The service is marvellous, and the setting (downstairs in what was likely the old wine cellar with domed brick ceilings) atmospheric. The promise of free wifi didn't disappoint - it was indeed free and without any of the conditions to access or hidden costs that we found over most of Europe. The staff were at all times courteous, efficient and charming. On arrival we were presented with a little 'gift' - two tiny jars of locally-made condiments. The hotel itself is walking distance to an excellent market and restaurant area, the Sorbonne, the Pantheon (of course) and Metro stations, as well as the more touristy areas towards the Seine. After nearly three months of travel in Europe, this is without doubt the hotel I enjoyed best - better than some 4-star places. Next time we're in Paris, we're staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel with fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: LondonChantalB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel opposite the Pantheon in September. The best thing about the hotel was the warmth and friendliness of the staff, nothing was too much bother for them. It is also centrally located near all the attractions of the Latin Quarter and St Germain de Pres. I had a room overlooking the Pantheon and found it wasn't noisy at all. However, the furnishings and room are a bit dated and probably need to be upgraded at some point. It was also a bit cold at night (even though it was still September). However, I would recommend this hotel, particularly for the business traveller, and although it's a little on the expensive side for what you get, the staff more than make up for any shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff but request upgrade”
Reviews.Author: jdunn57
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel des Grands Hommes but wished we had requested an upgrade to a larger room. Our room was so small we had no place to put our small, carry on suitcases or to sit other than on the bed. We were traveling with friends so had to sit in the very small lobby to enjoy a glass of wine and visit. We faced the courtyard and next time would request a room facing the Pantheon. The lighting in the room was insufficient although the bathroom lighting was good and our bathroom was a nice size. We were surprised that breakfast was not included in the rate. It was expensive. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Service”
Reviews.Author: Canberra_Traveller
Reviews.Content: What the rooms lack in size are made up with charm and service. We stayed twice in superior rooms (worth the extra in my opinion) during a recent visit to Paris and both had views to the square and the Pantheon. The staff (in particular Pierre and Valerie) were welcoming and helpful and very good at advising on and booking restaurants. They did everything within their power to make our stay enjoyable. Rooms were charmingly decorated, quiet, had comfortable beds and complimentary and fast wireless internet. Bathrooms were smallish but spotless. We really enjoyed the breakfasts, served in a small room downstairs. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mbtalbot
Reviews.Content: Right across the street to Pantheon! Located in the Latin Quarter. Very small hotel but bursting with charm. The staff was attentive as any 5 star I've ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: isheenthisheen
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel with my partner and it made for a wonderful stay. We stayed 2 nights. The 1st night we stayed in the the ground floor room that was done up beautifully. It had charm, charm and more charm. The room was very spacious and so very romantic. Problem being the street level - so the curtains had to be drawn all the time and this took some of the charm away. We asked to be given a room with a view for the 2nd night. This was perfect. With the view of Le Pantheon. The room was tiny but the balcony and the view more than made up for it. We ordered brekfast on the balcony and while the breakfast was not much to write home about it was just perfect otherwise. As for the location..while still in the heart of paris, we were cut off from the tourists quite a bit. There were not too many international tourists around - even more perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous hotel”
Reviews.Author: flob05
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed hotel; great location opposite the Pantheon; accommodating staff. Small rooms - just as all Paris hotel rooms seem to be. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyClaireHerts
Reviews.Content: A slighty delayed review but definitely worth taking a few minutes to share what a great hotel this is. We stayed for a long weekend in March 2010 and arrived on a sunny Friday afternoon and the reception staff were extremely welcoming and helped us store our luggage until we could check in. We explored the local area and found it was really central to not only the Metro (Luxembourg station is 5 minute walk away) and directly opposite the Pantheon. Once checked in we were delighted to have a room facing the Pantheon (fantastic views both day & night) The room was just perfect, we didn't try breakfast as preferred the pain au chocolat, croissants and coffee from the bakeries. There's lots to do in Paris so you won't be bored - if you need ideas or guidance the reception staff will be happy to help. They recommended a restaurant on our first evening (sorry can't remember the name now) and it was a quaint restaurant nearby with delicious food. Enjoy your time and don't hesitate booking this hotel - we tried their sister hotel last weekend when we returned to Paris for another long weekend and although it was great in other ways the service was exemplary here so we'll definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “It was everyting I hoped it would be for our first trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: susieq_bythesea
Reviews.Content: We found the gem of a hotel on line. We were never disappointed with our choice. Right from the beginning, before we got there they were on top of things and helpful. We had a beautiful, romantic room with a balcony as I had always wanted. Seeing the Pantheon turn gold in the late afternoon sunlight was amazing. Breakfast on our balcony was awesome! We were always greeted with a smile and a "what can I do for you" attitude. We highly recommend it. I would just suggest they get fluffy towels.

Reviews.Title: “It's fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: banana12London
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in dozens of Paris hotels and this is the best. Unbeatable Left Bank location, staff were extremely helpful and friendly, and the breakfast is top quality - and can be served in your room at no extra cost until 11 am on weekends! Room 21 has small balcony, beamed ceiling and view of the Pantheon. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel convenient to Metro and RER direct to airport and Gare du Nord for Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: PatmiddleEngland
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Rooms small though usual size for central Paris. No tea/coffee-making facilities in room. Comfortable bed, very clean and breakfast (look for inclusive deal on hotel's own website) very good. Air-con worked well. Plenty of good reasonably priced restaurants nearby and mini-mart selling bottled water for 75c a litre. Busy nightlife in adjacent pubs in term time. Reception staff speak good English and are very helpful and knowledgeable about Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: corriefan70
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a European vacation and this was my favourite hotel. I was a little sad to leave. The location is excellent - the area is beautiful, convenient, safe, with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. The hotel is very charming - beautifully decorated, clean, quiet and secure. Best of all, the staff are amazing. Souneth is really lovely and very helpful. Valerie is also a gem. (I didn't get a chance to interact as much with the others, but they were all very nice.) The only thing I'd recommend is to forgo breakfast at the hotel. I definitely recommend this hotel to others and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: olivergill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Grand Hommes the week of September 7, 2010. The hotel offers clean, well decorated Paris size rooms at good rate. The location was preferred by us due to it's proximity to Jardin du Luxembourg and the 6th and 5th arrondissement. Metro and RER train stops are nearby. What turned out to be such a pleasant surprise was the extraordinary customer service by the entire staff. In particular, the Assistant Manager, Pierre, seemed to make it his personal mission to give us a memorable stay in Paris. What a treat to be so well cared for during your stay. When we return to our beloved Paris, well definitely stay at Hotel Grands Hommes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cazmi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Paris and if we return would stay again. The staff at the Hotel are all very helpful and polite. A big thank you to Valerie and Souneth. The Hotel rooms are cute and clean and situated close to the RER, hop on hop off buses and Restaurants. Can not say thank you enough for a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great location”
Reviews.Author: CPtraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights here while working at the Ecole Normale, and really enjoyed the stay. The entire hotel has a cosy feel, which is enhanced by the personal attention of the front desk staff, who always seem to be busy helping a guest to solve some problem or other, and always in a most friendly fashion. My standard room directly overlooked the Pantheon, so I felt like I was enjoying Paris, even when holed up in my room working. Plenty of interesting places to explore within a few minutes' walk. Convenient access to the RER B train to CDG airport is just down the street. I also enjoyed running most mornings in the nearby Luxembourg Gardens, which always seems to be teeming with others doing the same. I never took breakfast in the hotel, as there were too many interesting alternatives nearby. My one disappointment was that the free wifi was rather spotty, with connections often dropping out. Since I needed to use it extensively for work during my stay, this became frustrating. But overall I was very glad that I had chosen to stay at HGH.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely LOVED hotel des grands hommes!”
Reviews.Author: asatwice
Reviews.Content: this hotel was, by far, one of the best hotels i have ever had the pleasure of staying in. never before have i felt so at ease, so welcomed, so at home in a hotel (especially in europe). the staff are some of the very nicest people you will ever meet--they genuinely take an interest in how your trip to paris is going. yes the rooms are a bit small by american standards, but they are above average for parisian. the view of the pantheon is outstanding; the level of cleanliness of the hotel is exceptional. do yourself a favor and stay here--it is as wonderful as all the reviews say.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but unexceptional”
Reviews.Author: JaneHScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptionally clean and our room was very pretty, bijoux and peaceful. I thought that a superior double room (quoted as having a view or balcony) would be higher up than the first floor or, indeed, have a balcony. I also thought it might be slightly more spacious. We stayed for three nights and our small tubes of shower gel, and our increasingly disappearing slither of soap, were not replenished. I think I was slightly disappointed as I had been impressed by the warmth of other customers' reviews but I did not find the staff particularly friendly apart from on checkout. I had organised the few days as a gift for my husband's birthday and I didn't particularly want to pick up on small things, which could easily be rectified by more proactive service. As a couple, we have recently moved house to Brussels - we do not have a printer at home and, as noted, I had booked and paid for the hotel as a gift. I emailed the hotel to ask if I needed to print out the booking reservation sheet or if i could just bring my payment card/reference number as I knew I would then have to forward it to my husband at work, if not, to print out for me- meaning he would know where we were going and at what cost. I didn't get any reply from the hotel which I found a bit disappointing. Another wonderful weekend in Paris, but probably wouldn't return to HDGH.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PEB928
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in the quiet Place du Pantheon, directly opposite the Pantheon itself, right in the middle of the Latin Quarter, adjacent to the Sorbonne and a ten minute stroll to the Isle de la Citie. Many buses leave from beside the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens, only four or five minutes away. There is also an RER train station next to the Luxembourg Gardens and several metro stations all within a five to minutes walk of the hotel. We were always greeted warmly by the hotel reception staff and assisted many times with helpful advice for trains, buses or shops. The staff went out of their way to make our stay as pleasant as possible. We had booked a standard double room. It was facing the inner courtyard and therefore very quiet until after 8 am when workers arrived for some nearby renovation work, but that was fine as we were leaving for our breakfast and excursions by then. The only downside of our stay was that the standard room is very small by Australian standards. The double bed and our luggage virtually filled the room. The room decor is pleasant enough, but a little tired and in need of brightening and better lighting. Thankfully the en suite bathroom was a reasonable size, with a bath and included shower. There was one other small irritation, but only for one day. The lift broke down and while it was being repaired we had to endure several ascents and descents of five floors via the narrow and steep staircase. Great for fitness fanatics. Thankfully it did not coincide with having to haul our almost 30 kg bags up or down. The hotel breakfast is Continental (croissants, bread, toast and jam, omelet with tea or coffee) and well prepared, but several Euros dearer than the nearby sidewalk cafes. If you want the true French experience, eat in a cafe with the locals, all outside and facing the street. I would stay here again, but in one of the larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris - very happy with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sharkleberry
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed in Paris before so don't have an actual point of comparison, but based on my stays at similar priced hotes in Rome/London/etc we were quite pleased with Hotel Des Hommes. Our room was small but very well appointed and attractive, and very comfortable. Great bed, good storage, very clean. The staff was helpful. The location was fabulous. Breakfasts are excellent and very convenient in a pleasant room on the lower level. You can walk everywhere from here, and there are some good restaurants close by. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to hang your hat while in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: rrindiar
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull and friendly staff. Good views overlooking the Pantheon. Great resturants nearby and easy walks to Notre Dame and Luxemburg Gardens. Would stay here in a heartbeat. You can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Just gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: ErmoBoy
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere "French" and centrally located, and Hotel des Grandes Hommes seemed to fit the bill based on the glowing TA reviews. After a wonderful, and all-to-brief, 2 day stay in late May 2010, I can say that our expectations were fully met. You can easily walk to just about every location from this hotel, and if that's not your preference, the superb Metro is in easy reach. Make sure you spend some time in the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg and just wandering the nearby streets. The rooms are just gorgeous - you know that you can only be staying in France. The staff, led by the ever-accommodating Pierre-Louis, are friendly & helpful, with lots of great recommendations on where to eat etc. We stayed in a superior apartment with balcony & view on the 5th floor - we got a great "Spring" deal and paid just over 340 euros for the two nights. We have no hesitation in recommending HGH and know where we will be staying next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravellerANC
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great. Just a few steps from the Pantheon. An easy ride from Charles de Galle airport (get off at Luxenbourg). The rooms were very small but decorated beautifully. Just enough room for the bed and two suitcases (one on each side of the bed). The bathroom was a great size. The hotel staff was always friendly and helpful. An easy walk to the Pantheon, Luxenborg Gardens or the Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic break”
Reviews.Author: hatts101
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in february (so well in advance!) as a weekend break for my boyfriend's 21st birthday, so got a special Summer rate, look on the webistes for early booking/seasonal discounts! I paid for a room with a view which was definately worth it, because the hotel is right next to the Pantheon and looks spectacular. Upon our arrival Valerie, the lady at reception took our bags and told us that she had put us in a room with a balcony. The recption area is very pretty, very boutique-hotel. Valerie gave us a few touristy maps and went through how to get to the main attractions. The hotel is right next to Luxembourg metro station and a ten minute walk to the Notre-Dame station, both of which are very well connected, so are useful for getting to the sights. The hotel also gave my boyfriend a little box of marzpian treats for his birthday! The room was lovely, like alot of the reviews say they are quite small; the little corridor where the wardrobes are is a bit of a squish for two people! But the bedroom was lovely, very clean and the windows are large so it was bright and airy. The bathroom is isn't huge but a perfectly good size for two people. It looked like one of our hand towels had pollen on it, but we didn't complain as it was so trivial. The little balcony that we had was lovely to stand out on and there was two little chairs and table to sit at. One morning we had breakfast in bed which was very tasty and no more expensive than it would have been in a cafe. All the staff were very helpful and patient as I tired to remember my A-level french. The check-out time was 12 o'clock as well which was very decent and we were able to leave our bags at the hotel until we had to go to the airport. There are lots of little restuarants in the area as well, The Crepe places is delicious (get the one with vanilla ice cream, apples and salted caramel!) We had dinner one night at the restaurant nearest the hotel, I think it had Pantheon in the name. We ate very late at 11pm as we'd been up the Eiffel tower, but the resturant sat us down and we had a lovely bottle of wine and steak with french potatoes and veggies. The portions were huge and it was only 50 euroes for both of us to have steak and a bottle of wine! Delicious, with free water and bread. Definately worth going to the Jardin du Luxembourg as well, which are two minutes walk from the hotel. Buy some bread, cheese and meat from the little shops in the area and have a picnic there, its stunning! Thank you very much for such a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location. Superb service.”
Reviews.Author: DarekHolda
Reviews.Content: My parents have recently stayed in this hotel. I've booked it for them for a week holiday trip to see Paris. They were extremly hapy with the whole hotel. First of all, the location, it's fantastic if you want to see most of the turist attractions in Paris. Hotel is situated just outside Pantheon and not far from Notre Dame and Louvre. It's pretty close to RER rail station as well. Second thing is the stuff. They are very nice and helpful and always there to answer your needs. I would definetly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: scottrn1
Reviews.Content: Just got back for our trip to Paris and a great stay at Hotel des Grands Hommes. Perfect place to stay. Lovely fabric covered walls with fine empire antiques. Nice and quiet and close to everything. Staff are friendly and speak english well and go out of there way to arrange anyting you may need from restaurant reservations to cars to airport. Location is ideal as the metro is close by and there are any great restaurants and bistro's on the small side streets. We had a very large deluxe room (#60) with a large private balcony with a couple of tables and plants. We would sit out there each day and look at the Paris rooftops and Monmartre in the distance while enjoying wonferful local cheese and bread from the shops we discovered aroud the corner. If you can get this room....go for the extre expense as I believe it to be the best in the house. Pantheon is right there in front of you with breathtaking views. We wouldn't stay anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: murmur74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, and was impressed with the quality, friendliness and welcoming nature of the staff here. My room was quiet, clean and comfortable, with close to baroque decor - fun and french. The staff was extremely helpful in assisting me with airport transportation and finding a restaurant for a superb dinner for my final night in Paris. The location is excellent - you walk out the front door and run smack into the Pantheon. My room didn't have a view but I also booked at the last minute. Overall an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc1960
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is very nicely kept and in a perfect position to visit Paris. The hotel is clean and the stuff friendly. The room we have was very small, just two feet around the bed, but we were in the room very little so it did not matter much. It is just few blocks from the Latin Quarters, but in a very quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, fabulous staff, lovely atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: siouxsun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in my favorite quartier of Paris, but in a quiet section. (yes it is possible). Additional plus-es: can always find your way back to the Pantheon; helpful staff, lovely room: a combination which makes this hotel an extremely good value. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: susielondon207
Reviews.Content: staff are wonderful and so helpful. the hotel is lovely and in a great location. you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty perfect”
Reviews.Author: Finoula
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Paris and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. I had booked a special summer price which included a room with a view or balcony - my room had both! It was big (by Paris standards) and the balcony looked out right onto the Pantheon, which was glorious. The staff were an absolute delight - friendly, smiley, helpful - nothing too much trouble. The location is also perfect - I love this area of Paris - most sights are in walking distaance (it's only down the hill to Notre Damme) and there are plenty of bars and restaurants of all types. I recommend L'AOC which is near the Arab centre, although not in August as it's shut! The Burgone (spelling may be dodgy there sorry) at the bottom of the Mouffetard is a good bistro and the cafes on the Contrescarp are great for people watching (the Delmas is the more expensive one). I don't recommend Les Fountaines on the rue Sufflot - well not as a woman eating alone anyway becuae the waiter treated me as if I was a pain in the neck rather than a paying customer and the food was luke warm and very ordinary. Back to the hotel - if you can afford it - go.

Reviews.Title: “the ultimate in Paris ambience”
Reviews.Author: RAB12
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and views. Hard to imagine a nicer atmosphere in Paris. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon with view on the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: ElkeFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: We had a breathtaking view on the Pantheon - from our bed! Make sure to choose a room on the upper floor with a view and a little balcony, and you will not regret the extra cost, it is quite an experience! The room was very nnicely decorated, very French, very cosy. The receptionists were very friendly. Only the breakfast room was a little dark in the cellar, ...and you can always choose to have breakfast around the corner outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic views, beautiful, large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: NG_2007
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - stayed one night in July. Its across the pantheon square, woke up to the view of the pantheon outside the window. The location is perfect, heart of the latin quarter but quiet nevertheless. The lobby and entrance is beautifully decorated. The room was also beautiful and large by paris standards. There was a large divan even for lounging and reading! Everything was perfect. Only, I would avoid drinking coffee in the hotel - they charged us 6 euros for 2 cups of coffee. We paid 177 Euros for the night. In contrast we paid 180 plus euros for a completely pathetic little hotel ranked number 2 in trip advisor (it's a complete scam, don't stay at the hotel des academie des arts).

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: hicksid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only two nights (should have stayed longer !) and were very impressed by this hotel and completely agree with the comments made on Trip Advisor. This hotel have excellent, helpful staff who speak brilliant English. They were genuinely interested in us and what we had done on that day and made an excellent restaurant recommendation. The room was small but clean and well presented. The shower wasn't the best we have used but hey, it generated enough hot water to wash the grim of Paris off ! We paid £150 per night for the room (b/fast not included) on the 5th floor, which was very quiet and only 5 mins walk to nearest metro station ( Central Lemoine). Also, very close to the Luxembourg Gardens which is a beautiful park and well worth lounging around in on a hot day.

Reviews.Title: “a parisian paradise”
Reviews.Author: dazturnip
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights and had a fantastic stay. the staff were very attentive. bedroom was small but knew this from previous comments. hotel in a great location. close to tourist sites and transport links for further afield. definitely would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “small and cosy”
Reviews.Author: thijsbakker
Reviews.Content: great hotel at a great location, the conference room is small though.

Reviews.Title: “Small But Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kamby
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights end of June. The location is good - 2 blocks to luxemborg gardens and close to a few metro stops, many cafes and restaurants nearby. Our 2nd floor room was ridiculously small - you couldn't even open your luggage except on the bed - but they do utilize the space they have by providing storage in 2 cupboards. The bed pretty much took up the whole room. The bathroom was fine - actually very large compared to the bedroom. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, room was clean and the a/c was strong as it was very hot when we were there, shower pressure was good and always had hot water. The employees were cordial - but that's about it. No one went above and beyond to make our stay special. Mostly there was one person on staff - so you waited if you had a question. Elevator was broken for 2 of the nights. There are probably nicer places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good location, pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: Advocate7
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, excellent location, very clean but small room (like most Paris hotel rooms) with small balcony. Pleasant, helpful staff. At € 208 per night, rather expensive. Ask for a room with a view on the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - Big rooms, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: ApolloMN
Reviews.Content: I'm usually not such a fussy person when it comes to hotels, especially in Paris, my expectations are pretty low. The Grands Hommes didn't work for me. You are paying for location and a big bathroom. If anything goes wrong, don't expect them to help. I got in to Paris on a very hot Monday evening (35C) and the a/c in the room didn't work. I went down to the desk to ask if there was anything they could do. They could have the maintenance man look at it tomorrow morning. I'm serious it was like a sauna in there. Well, you can sleep with the balcony door open? We do it all the time in Paris. Finally I asked him to come up and look and see if I did something wrong with the thermostat, but he said he could not in any circumstance leave the desk unattended, as he was the only employee of the hotel there at the moment. So finally he called the hotel next door to see if they had a room for me, and they did, but then, they called and said it was taken. So I went up and fiddled with it, but got nowhere, finally I went down to the desk and sat there for a half hour and he called the hotel next door and voila! the room that was taken is now open, so they sent me next door for the night, but I had to come back over for the next 2 nights. It was kind of a nightmare, So then the last night I'm there, there's a different guy on the night shift, and again, he is the only one in the hotel. The elevator is broken, which was not too bad, as I was on the 3rd floor, but I pity the poor folks on the 6th floor. Anyway, I called down for a wakeup call, and there's no answer. I let it ring for 5 minutes, and no answer, so I go down the stairs and he's outside having a smoke with the guy from the other hotel. I tell you, for 200 Euros a night, I expect the only guy on duty to answer my call, especially when the elevator is not working. So my take on this is I'm really not too impressed with the managemant of the Rive Gauche Hotel chains, and the Grands Hommes is way overrated on this survey. If you have no trouble mechanically, it's a pretty nice place. They are understaffed at night though, and the people they have hired as their night crew are not very good at customer service, and they have been given no authority to make customers happy at any cost.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisenne Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PinaPineapple
Reviews.Content: All perfect and I am very fussy. The bed and pillows were the best I have ever slept on even better than at home! Room was spotless and very tastfully decorated. Staff very helpful and efficient, spoke very good English.The area around the Hotel is very clean and smart. The view out of our window was magnificent. We had breakfast there and it was as good as any cafe and was actually worth the money compared to most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with comfort, great location”
Reviews.Author: dazzlingmel8888
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is very good. It's easy to walk around and metro and bus stations are very near. There are also many cafes nearby. It is a very comfortable and clean hotel that makes you feel at home. The staffs are all very efficient, hospitable and helpful. They will print out details of everything you enquire from the internet. However, the only thing is that the wifi is too slow so hotmail and facebooking is somewhat impossible. Other than that, everything is good and it is worth the stay. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sunshine075
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just what we were looking for. A quiet hotel that was easy access to the metro and everything Paris. We enjoyed the location as it felt like we were off the beaten tourist path. The staff was outstanding in helping make our stay the very best, everything from directions, to reservations to helping us plan a day trip outside of the city. The staff was most impressive! The room is simple, comfortable bed with a clean bathroom and plenty of hot water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: denross
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! There was so much charm & the people at the concierge were so friendly & helpful! We found the location to be perfect... we were close to a major metro station yet we were away from the busy & crowded parts of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a quiet but convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: dandreamy
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was very helpful and they speak excellent English. Our room overlooked the Pantheon. They offered breakfast on our balcony. The breakfast was excellent with outstanding butter from Normandy and perfect baguettes. Whoever decorated the room has a great eye. The room had exposed rafters, a tile bath, and flowers on the balcony. The square that this hotel is located on is busy during the day, but quiet at night. It was convenient to several metro stations and we could walk to many attractions as well. Overall, it was a very good experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Whether it is your first trip or your next trip to Paris, you will enjoy your stay here.”
Reviews.Author: ponderosapine
Reviews.Content: 5 happy nights. It is a great location, comfortable, quiet but made more special because the staff is friendly and helpful. Don't miss the Pantheon next door. It is the Arlington of France and is very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: tpagrl
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris for a week in mid-May with a girlfriend. We decided to stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and visiting the hotel website. What a great decision that turned out to be! We had an awesome view of the Pantheon from our room. The bathroom was bigger than I had anticipated considering everything I've heard about the size of hotel rooms in Paris! The location was great in terms of distance to a metro station and other central Paris attractions. The only small issue we had was with the lighting in the room, which left much to be desired after the sun went down. But considering the sun seemed to be up around 6 AM and didn't go down till about 10 PM, it wasn't a huge issue. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. One evening as we returned to the hotel from a day of sightseeing, we were a bit confused when we saw the name on the marque in front of our hotel had been changed. After realizing we were indeed at the right hotel and went inside, we asked at the front desk what was up with the hotel name change, and we were told that a film crew had hung a new banner over the old, as the exterior of the hotel was being shot for some type of history film. How cool is that?!?!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view, spacious rooms, great service, in sum, a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: wasn't expecting much, I had an old fashion room (normally prefer hotels like hotel le petit paris or hotel bellechasse) but my room's wonderful view of the Pantheon, the unexpected spaciousness ( the room even fit a day bed ), wonderful service before I even arrived ( especially Souneth- a wonderful staff that was super helpful), the location ( short walk to Notre Dame ) etc = this hotel was a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: holidayseekers
Reviews.Content: had a room facing the front. lovely decor and so relaxing and refreshing. enjoyed the breakfast which we had not intended to take every day!

Reviews.Title: “a solid choice”
Reviews.Author: Wolverine73
Reviews.Content: I stayed six days at the hotel with my daughter. The desk personnel were very helpful, the houskeeping was first rate, and the room was good if a bit small (which is not all that surprising in Paris). We arrived early in the morning, and hoped for an early check in, but they could not accommodate us; my one complaint is that they told us to return at noon, which we did, and the room was still not ready--and was not ready until 2:00. The location is a good one with many cafes and restaurants nearby; a pretty short walk to Ile de la Cite; and the liveliness that having the Sorbonne nearby brings to the area. Also very convenient to the subway system.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms all for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: baustin5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 14 days in April. I have never stayed at a hotel with as friendly and helpful a staff, from the manager down to the housekeepers. They let you practice your French if you want, but when you get stuck, they help you out in English. The location, adjacent to the Pantheon meant that there was not heavy traffic in the area. Metro and RER were convenient. St. Germain, Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gradens are all close by. Our room was terrific. When it became necessary that we stay four additional days due to the volcano, they not only accomodated us, but they also reduced our rate! When I go back to Paris, this is the only hotel that I will consider.

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely hotel with friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: TravelswithkidsNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Des Grands Hommes for a long spring weekend on a Mother-Daughter trip to Paris. Before I even left the US I had communicated with the hotel staff a few times via Email, who answered my questions with extremely prompt and friendly responses. Once we arrived, we were pleased to find the hotel is just as described by other TA reviewers. A convenient location, small but nicely furnished & immaculately clean rooms. Even on the 2nd floor we had a nice view of the Pantheon right across the street. The bathrooms are recently updated & lovely. The tub/French shower a treat after a long day sightseeing. The breakfast is fine. The small basement room is what it is, but makes use of its limited space (being from NYC I get that). Tip: note that many of the surrounding cafes don't open until 9AM, so if you are an early riser, the hotel breakfast is your best bet. I didn't have a problem with the 13Euro price, since just a tiny coffee on the street is 6E. Another plus: Free wi-fi throughout the hotel, including in your room.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: nickym63
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my 30th birthday for me and my family. It was better than I could have hoped for. The location was excellent and we had a fantastic view of the pantheon from our room (room 30). The hotel was very attractive and the room itself was beautiful. The staff were attentive, friendly and thoughtful. They left a bottle of wine and wine glasses with a birthday message in my room, which I was delighted about. My only criticism would be the room was quite cold, as Paris was having an unexpected spell of bad weather. I told reception and they offered me more blankets. I asked for a heater which they gave to me, but it didn't work properly. This was only a small problem and did not affect our enjoyment of the holiday. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the recommendations”
Reviews.Author: Alicia64ABZ
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about the hotel on TripAdvisor, we booked to stay here for 5 nights during April. We were affected by the first ash cloud which caused air flight disruption and arranged to stay on at HGH for a further 4 nights until we could get home by Eurostar. The staff were very helpful and understanding, deserving of previous reviews. We had a room on the second floor with a tiny balcony overlooking the Pantheon. The room was small but clean and very quaint and the bathroom was fine. We were out all day so we were only concerned that we had a very comfortable bed. The only area of disappointment to us was that there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. We had breakfast in the hotel once after which we ate out. The hotel is in a great location with Metro and RER within safe walking distance, it is very small, quaint and quite Parisien which we appreciated and would certainly go back

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms - great location!”
Reviews.Author: KirRob
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel des Grands Hommes - it was convenient to multiple metro stops (Luxemborg - direct to CDG airport, St. Michel, Cluny-Sorbonne). We were a 3 minute walk to Luxemborg Gardens and about 10 -15 minutes to Notre Dame, St. Germain, Ile de St. Louis. The rooms were beautiful and we had a great view of the Pantheon which we enjoyed looking at while we took a break in the afternoon before venturing out again. The bed was actually comfortable and a "true" double or queen size (not two singles pushed together like is common in Europe). One thing to note - the street noise is audible and on Friday and Saturday night fairly noisy so use ear plugs. The staff was more than helpful and responsive, as I had to work with them on rescheduling our stay because of the volcanic ash in April. They were timely in responding and made the switch an easy one, which made our vacation that much better!

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet location but easy to get to from central Paris.”
Reviews.Author: ADFWomblingFree
Reviews.Content: Loved the fact its just three stops on the RER from Gard du Nord, made it a quick trip from the Eurostar to the hotel. We had a lovely big room - by far the largest we've ever had in Paris. Slightly intense decor, but fantastically spacious. Our room was on the ground floor, but perfectly quiet. Breakfast was good, but not fabulous - and with access to all those wonderful bakeries, it really could've been fabulous! We've been to Paris countless times, and I think this was my favourite hotel just because of the size of the room, helpful staff and good accessible location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: herberq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at the hotel and were entirely satisfied. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the room, with a view of the dome of the Panetheon, was first rate. We have no complaints about any aspect of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: Melanocyte
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after reading mostly positive reviews on TripAdvisor. Before we booked, we ran its location by a native of Paris, who gave us a hearty thumbs-up. Indeed, the hotel was situated in a lovely area, with multiple options for eating and shopping nearby. We found it a safe, pleasant neighborhood to wander. Additionally, the hotel was within easy walking distance of several RER/Metro stations, which made it easy to navigate the city and a convenient base for our stay. Rooms such as ours in the front of the hotel had excellent views of the Pantheon, which is directly across the street, and the pleasant Jardin du Luxembourg was just several blocks away. The hotel itself was small but charming. Every aspect of the hotel-- from the hallways to the lobby to the rooms themselves-- seemed to have been decorated with great care and attention to detail. The spiraling staircase (of which there are several photos on this site) is striking, though an elevator is available, as well. Our room was quite functional, containing a television, small refrigerator, desk, and 2 closets, despite its small size. Cleanliness generally was excellent; we noticed only a bit of dirt on the walls and some worn carpet. Free wifi was available but a bit slow and spotty in our room. Our only mishap: no hot water was available one morning due to malfunctioning equipment; the hotel was quick to apologize, and the problem was remedied within several hours. We were especially impressed with the staff of the hotel. We were contacted before our trip regarding our time of arrival and were quite impressed that, though we showed up hours before the official check-in time, we were able to settle into our room immediately. The staff was similarly accommodating of other requests during our stay and was universally friendly and helpful. (Of note, all front desk staff we encountered readily spoke English, which was helpful since we spoke limited French.) Travelers seeking a large luxury hotel or a bland chain experience should look elsewhere. This is a small, quintessentially French hotel with comfortable rooms, superior customer service, and an excellent location. We would not hesitate to return on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Max0031
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel at a fantastic location right next to the Pantheon, close to Jardin Luxembourg and other highlights. Quiet area, nice staff, rooms could be bigger (but this is Paris). Good, simple breakfast for a decent price, free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very comfortable, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: SiJoNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room overlooking the Pantheon which was super. Room wasn't huge but pretty, and immaculate. No tea or coffee making facilities unfortunately - a kettle would have been nice! Bathrooms are very small but perfectly practical. We found the staff smiley, friendly and most helpful. A nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had the sweetest room with one of the best views in the city!”
Reviews.Author: JillfromKC
Reviews.Content: This was a Mother's Day trip with my 35 year old daughter, I am 60 and have problems with stairs...there is an elevator here which is something you need to check on if this is an issue for you. I checked many sites and asked many friends before making my reservations. We decided on Hotel des Grands Homme and requested room 61 from a recommendation on tripadvisor. We had a most beautiful view of the Pantheon from our balcony which had a table and two chairs...talk about a room with a view! We bought wine and cheese from a shop around the corner and sat out here whenever possible. It was delightful - we probably took more photos from that balcony than anywhere else. The staff could not have been more delightful and were very helpful. My daughter is gluten intolerant and we were nervous about restaurants in Paris understanding this problem. I e-mailed the hotel and they made reservations for us at the restaurants we had chosen and made sure they knew of the gluten problem. Souneth (I believe he is an Asst. Manager) took care of this for us and confirmed everything by e-mail before we arrived. He was wonderful to work with as well as the young woman at the front desk who took care of many things for us and never made us feel like it was a bother. It is a small hotel located across from the Pantheon which made it easy to find our way home! The room was smallish but beautiful with a nice tub and shower...lots of closet space. We had two twin beds which were just fine. I would definitely go to this hotel again...the location, the staff, the charming room! My only problem would be that I would like to try all of the hotels in this company, I would bet they are all lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, central, very french, very friendly people, good tip for a trip to paris”
Reviews.Author: norbert01052010
Reviews.Content: located near RER Station Luxembourg, easy to reach from CDG (RER B, appr EUR 9.-, 35 min), closed to station St. Michel, good connection in all directions(RER, METRO), appr 35 min to versailles, nice view to pantheon, lots of restaurants an bars within 5 min. only bad thing: weather was very cold (5 to 12 Celsius), no heating but lot of air circulation from outside so also cold in room

Reviews.Title: “C'est Bonne”
Reviews.Author: Sheppardsview
Reviews.Content: Good location being close to Notre Dame Cathedral and the Ille de Paris and located just off the Latin Quarter and its vibrant nightlife. The staffs were extremely helpful and courteous. There was a choice of breakfast but at 10 Euros we preferred to walk about 30 metres down the road towards the city centre and eat at a café for 7 Euros, not much difference except the coffee was far better! Rooms were comfortable and well decorated although rather small for the price deal at circa £200/night for room with view of the Pantheon – however, rack rate circa £270/night, quite expensive for a smallish room without breakfast! Entrance to the Louvre and D’Orsay was free on the first Sunday of each month, but unless you are there at opening time the queues are just horrendous, better off paying and going when you want to go. A trip on the Seine is a must and seen best at night in the dark and by booking online before you go through ‘Vedettes de Paris’ you can save 4 Euros per person (12 Euros to 8Euros) - most people seem to take their own drink on board as there is no Bar. Keep you eyes open for happy hour the hours vary from 17 to 19 hrs and from 19 to 21 hours depending on the bar, but a prices of up to 8Euros for a beer down to 5Euros during happy hour its worth looking around. Overall a fantastic city worth walking rather than using the Metro/Bus/Train to take in the atmosphere and architecture. Incidentally 340 steps to stage 1 of the Eifel tower and 341 to the second stage total 671 steps, but fairly easily walked. Lift takes you from the second stage to the top.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: CAtraveller12
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdue review, but I simply have to share with people how great this hotel was. We selected it based on TA reviews and it did not disappoint. The location was great, the staff was friendly and the room was fabulous. I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in great location with welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Byser
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris with my wife and this hotel was excellent for our purpose. A very nice place to rest our tired bodies after busy days exploring Paris.
