The staff were very professional and attentive. This was the first visit to Paris for us and we found that the location of the hotel was perfect for getting around the 'must visit' locations. Plenty of good restaurants in the area when we returned to 'base camp' each evening. Getting to the hotel from CDG airport was really easy as Luxembourg RER is round the corner from Rue Soufflot which is round the corner from the hotel. Our room was smallish but well appointed and very clean with absolutely no street noise. It can be difficult choosing the right hotel in Paris but 'all in all' this was a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “We spent the second part of a week's...”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaPruitt
Reviews.Content: We spent the second part of a week's visit to Paris at this hotel, which provided us an interesting opportunity to compare the two hotels. We did not especially like staying near the Pantheon. The square, although dramatic, is lacking charm and there were very few interesting shops or cafes nearby. It caters to tourists and students primarily. We did like the proximity to the Luxembourg gardens. The staff at the hotel were very nice and helpful and the hotel was well rum. The breakfast which we ordered in-room dI'd not compare to the one at the other hotel we stayed at. It was somewhat miserly and did not merit all the fuss and fancy description. There was also no table in our room on which to place the tray, and the girl who delivered it left it on the bed which made for quite an awkward dining experience. We found the decor to be fresh and tastefully done. The towels were soft and the sheets fine. The bed though was very, very hard and the pillows far too small to be comfortable. Although it was quite warm out, there was no air conditioning available yet. We did not sleep very well there as a result. We would recommend this hotel to our friends but we really did prefer the other hotel we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location in the heart of the Latin Quartier”
Reviews.Author: TMB1980
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned form a short 4 day stay in Paris as part of our honeymoon. The staff were lovely, the setting fantastic and the hotel was charming. Our room overlooked the Panthenon and everything else was pretty much in walking distance. The staff gave us some great local restaurant recommendations and were always helpful and friendly. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel for a family holiday”
Reviews.Author: FourKisses
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Hotel des Grands Hommes - and it sure was a good choice. Not exactly cheap, but worth the money: Located in a quiet, but very central area, very friendly and multi-lingual staff, nice room for a family of four (including a baby bassinet and additional bed for our 3-year old). Our parents were located in the room directly next to ours. We can really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful birthday in Paris - and this hotel topped the cake!”
Reviews.Author: Parker_Janssen
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at this hotel just last week during my birthday - and I truly could not have asked for a better birthday! My fiancé tells me that the day before my birthday he had informed reception in order to arrange for a surprise, and it was almost a success except that the note left with the request didn't make much sense to the replacement staff in the morning - but it was not for a lack of trying! Just the act of writing down his request with the plan to truly follow through was something I never expected from the staff at ANY hotel. I find that although it didn't pan out the way he had planned (eventually it did in its own way), this thoughtful act was truly heart-warming and greatly appreciated. Also, if you are the sort of person who must have their morning coffee, the continental breakfast can be brought to your room and it's quite delicious, a classic petit-déjeuner with café au lait, freshly baked croissant, brioche, and baguette with fine jams or honey, even dried fruits! We took breakfast here every morning! And to this day I miss that little pick-me-up whenever I have a look at my measly Dutch breakfast of a cheese sandwich and cup of coffee! Lastly, if you are looking for a nice view in a top location, look no further! The Panthéon was right outside our windows, and the area around the Jardins du Luxembourg has many shops and places to get a bite to eat or just sit at the outside terraces for a drink, not to mention you are in easy walking distance to many of the great places found in the nearby arrondissments. The only negative comment I have about this hotel (and this I believe is more of a personal taste opinion) is that I often had difficulty sleeping a refreshing night as my pillows were not supportive enough....but as I have TMJ, it's probably just me! I'm pretty much used to sleeping on a slab of hard foam. hehe. Still, in the end when we were asked (as a joke) to stay another night by reception, I swear I would have agreed without a second-thought if we didn't already have our train tickets! I was truly rather sad to leave. So, if you are looking to stay at a place with a fantastic view in a fun location, where the staff is outgoing, cordial, friendly and thoughtful, and the rooms and reception are immaculately clean, this is the place for you! We will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a revelation. Super...”
Reviews.Author: Recklessgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a revelation. Super position great views particularly from out 6th floor balcony. Comfy stylish room...sorry we only stayed for one night. Friendly helpful staff. Didn't try breakfast so can't comment. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: emilieanne30
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely place to stay! The rooms might be small by American standards, but I think they're roomy by Parisian standards. We were very comfortable. The staff was friendly & helpful. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Merlindy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location with incredible views of the city. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful and efficient. I plan on returning to this hotel with other friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and buckets of charm”
Reviews.Author: CorkTouristOne
Reviews.Content: Location is great - just a few minutes from the Luxembourg RER stop, which brings you from the airport in about 35 mins if you get on one of the trains that skips the suburban stops. The hotel is cute and romantic. We upgraded to a room with a view, at a small cost. The room was comfortable, with lovely views of the Pantheon - but be warned it was as small as it looks in the pics! However, most hotel rooms in Paris are snug, so this didn't come as a huge surprise. We're neat people so we were able to cope. The balcony was lovely, and we had great weather so we were able to sit there for coffee and even drinks in the evening. Notre Dame is about ten minutes walk away, so everything is within easy reach here. Lots of restaurants if you head in the direction of St Germain, and don't forget to have a stroll in the Jardin du Luxembourg. All in all, don't hesitate to stay here - it's comfortable, well located and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but little room”
Reviews.Author: glpitaly
Reviews.Content: close to the city center, charming hotel, small and cute, but rooms are too small too!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and delightful”
Reviews.Author: Dirk_and_Jess
Reviews.Content: Our room was ready for us when we arrived (3 pm). It was attractive and comfortable (very good bed & shower), as were the public rooms. The staff were friendly and helpful. All spoke English and were patient with our French. In house "Energy breakfast" (yogurt, juice, granola, apple) was healthy, economical, and very good, and was the traditional petit dejeuner with fresh orange juice. On two of our four days, the hotel staff was facing challenges with the elevator being out of service and worked hard to accommodate guests during this inconvenience. There is free wireless internet service but it is incredibly slow. Hotel is located direct across from the Pantheon and near La Sorbonne, in an area with very good restaurants (try Le Cosi for fine dining) and cafes nearby and the Pantheon across the street. It is 2+ blocks from the RER Luxembourg and 4+ blocks to the nearest Metro station. This was our 6th visit to Paris, and we would stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and friendly elegance”
Reviews.Author: BusterWestCountry
Reviews.Content: We spent just three nights at the HGH to celebrate our golden wedding. If you're looking for a ritzy hotel with busy bars and flashy service, then look elsewhere. If you want a quiet , elegant and friendly place, look no further. The service was friendly but impeccable – nothing was too much trouble. Our rooms were delightful, overlooking the Panthéon and with views to Montmartre. It was not cheap, but it was worth every penny. Thank you to all the staff for making this special occasion even more special.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is "WOW!"”
Reviews.Author: Aboagirl
Reviews.Content: I simply fell in love with this hotel. Super location, spotless, nice room, very friendly staff. Nice neighbourhood. Lots of cafe's and bars close by where you can have breakfast/brunch, at least that's what I did. It's easy to get to and from the hotel by the RER B train, and the metro isn't far away either for daily excursions. I will return to Paris-and to Hotel Des Grands Hommes!

Reviews.Title: “A welcome find - old fashioned quality & service”
Reviews.Author: rh1312
Reviews.Content: This hotel next to the Pantheon is spotlessly clean, well maintained, beautifully decorated and excels for its 3 star rating. It feels more like a 4 star, but the rating must be to do with facilities. Heartily recommended and will re-visit. Surrounded by brasseries and coffee bars, which offer better value for breakfast. Very handy for Luxembourg station on RER B (straight from CDG airport and on the same line as Stade de France). Slow lift, which broke down while we were there, but really did enjoy the stay. The staff are most helpful and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience ever and I've been to...”
Reviews.Author: mochitwee
Reviews.Content: The best experience ever and I've been to Paris 3 times. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kimthechub_88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior room which had a little balcony which overlooked the Pantheon which was pretty amazing. Room small but lovely. Within 10mins walking distance of Notre Dame. Hotel staff were really helpful and we were able to check in early.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff...fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SingleGirlTraveler
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Paris (the week before Christmas) I chose to stay at this lovely little hotel. The location is fabulous - right beside the Pantheon, close to transit (less than a 5 minute walk to the direct train to CDG airport), and within walking distance of everything worth seeing in Paris. The staff was very friendly and helpful...each morning they would help me map out my walking route for the day and each evening they made reservations for me. Their restaurant recommendations were right on...good food, comfortable environment for a single, female traveller. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! No need to search any further - this is the one!”
Reviews.Author: rtbabb4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a magical week at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. I had always dreamed of spending my 50th birthday in Paris (we both had never been), and this trip made my dream come true! We are so pleased that we chose the HGH, due to all the excellent reviews here on tripadvisor - thank you, everyone! The HGH's service is the absolute best we've ever encountered - we truly were treated like family. Every request we'd made ahead of time was granted, such as having a room with a balcony. As soon as we walked in the door, the staff knew exactly who we were, immediately wishing me a happy birthday! Collette, Souneth and Valerie were always interested in where we were going in the morning, and then curious about everything we'd done when we arrived "home" in the evening. Guests leave their room key at the desk when you leave, so they know when to ask the maid to make up your room, and also, so they know that you've returned safe and sound. My husband and I would actually say, "We're tired - let's go "home" - that's how comfortable we felt there. When we arrived back to our room on the actual day of my birthday, we were surprised with a complimentary bottle of wine, as a gift from the staff! Our maid, whom we never met and I apologize for not knowing her name, whom took excellent care of our spotless room, also left a "Happy Birthday" note for me on our bed! If we're ever lucky enough to come to Paris again, we wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else. There's no need for you to search any further for your own Paris accomodations - THIS IS IT!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: 9-diamond-hotel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 61. I have had many nice views from hotel bedrooms but this is surely one of the most memorable. Fabulous service. Very helpful and friendly staff. Excellent. I will never look elsewhere in Paris. Well done. You should all be very proud.

Reviews.Title: “Paris romance.”
Reviews.Author: katten02
Reviews.Content: I hade a lovely stay w/ my nine yr old twins. Quiet, clean and a very "Paris" ambience right at the foot of the Pantheon. The staff was genuinly friendly (although kids isnt a very common view in Paris day to day life). No extra luxury but very charming and clean rooms and good value for money. We did get a true feeling of Paris right at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Coming back to "Mon Quartier" I really enjoid Paris at it's best”
Reviews.Author: LeftBankFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Having lived around (Rue Gay Lussac) for some time I was really happy to review le quartier and to find an admirable hotel with a very engaged staff. The restaurant suggested also provided value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Charming of Hotels EVER !”
Reviews.Author: casalepre
Reviews.Content: As an International fashion photographer for over 25 years I feel reasonably qualified to be able to compare this hotel with the many I have stayed in worldwide over the years. The Hotel quite simply is the most charming, romantic, elegant, establishment I have ever stayed in. Perfectly sized for a romantic getaway, where you can disappear into the beautifully, unpretentiously interiorly decorated rooms. With walls covered in classic Parisian fabric, while rose petals littered the bed. It's location could not be more perfect with Notre Dame a 10 minute stroll away. Finally the staffs professional, exceptionally helpful and friendly attitude has surpassed anything I have ever experienced before. The managers eye site is either extreamly bad, mistaking me for George Clooney or he's just naturally charming & friendly....... a rare quality in todays "service Industry". Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Charming Hotel with Very Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: Prof046
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights in this very nice hotel for a long Valentine's weekend visit. Our room on the 3rd floor was very comfortable, overlooked the Pantheon, and was not as small as some reviewers suggest. Beautiful hotel, excellent location. But what sets it apart is the very professional, knowledgeable--and nice--staff. This is easily our favorite hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: abbie76
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a good location, few minutes walk from St Germain and all the lovely shops and restaurants. 5 mins walk from the metro. Stunning views of the Pantheon from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Paris next to the Pantheon.”
Reviews.Author: Rj-spark
Reviews.Content: A very nice stay in HdGH, close enough to the Pantheon to look at day and night. And close enough to the Latin Qtr, without the bustle and noise. Mostly will recommend for the excellent service...

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely small hotel in fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: FermanaghKeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and the found the hotel quiet, comfortable and welcoming, The receptionist was always friendly and helpful and it really felt homely - we never even met another guest!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Laceytom
Reviews.Content: Very nice if small hotel. Nice location for both walking and the train. The employees of the hotel are very nice and seem to want to help. The rooms that face the Pantheon have a great view but can be a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “luxury with friendliness”
Reviews.Author: CrouchEndTilly
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much indeed. The room on the top floor was splendid, with a fabulous view, and we much appreciated the upgrade. Very comfortable, stylish, warm, and with the best bed I've ever had in a hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were good, though seemed expensive for British visitors, as did the minibar. But all in all a great choice for a luxurious trip in the heart of the left bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: patmcg3
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, at a very affordable rate. Right next to the Pantheon, 5 minute walk to the Sorbonne, 5 minutes to Luxembourg Gardens and 10 minutes walk to St Germain des Pres. A perfect place to stay on the Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: DickandDoc
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a very central location. Service was brilliant, the staff were all very friendly and helpful. We both really enjoyed our stay and would thoroughly reccommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: herraghty
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location. Easy to walk from nearby stations. Close to Luxembourg park. The rooms were very comfortable and nicely decorated. We didn't take breakfast because the immediate area is good for breakfast. The service was very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugs2409
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel having endlessly searched the internet for a hotel in the Latin Quarter. I booked it based on the good reviews that it received and it did not disappoint. I took my boyfriend to Paris for a few days for his birthday and the hotel was exactly what I wanted. It was very clean and the room smelt lovely everytime we stepped through the door. We had a standard room which was ample in size for the two of us (we were there for 3 nights). The hotel staff were helpful and friendly when we needed them which wasn't often. The location was perfect for exploring Paris - we hardly needed to use the metro/RER as we walked most places from the hotel but if need be there was an RER station a few minutes walk away. We didn't have the breakfast in the hotel so I can't commment on that as we tended to buy coffee/croissants from the boulangerie round the corner. There is a lovely market street nearby called Rue Mouffetard and also a few bars and restaurants in the quaint square. I would definitely recommend this hotel - I booked directly with the hotel which gave me the best rate.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JohnPaul77
Reviews.Content: After looking at what felt like every hotel in Paris we came across the Hotel des Grands Hommes at a very reasonable rate. We were then pleasantly surprised to read all the great reviews on trip advisor and decided to book. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to stay here again for future visits to Paris. The hotel is in an excellent location within the Latin Quarter, just an easy 10 minute walk to Notre Dame. The hotel also sits beside the Pantheon, one of Paris' finest buildings (which makes the hotel even easier to find!). Our room had a balcony looking onto the Pantheon which was an amazing site day or night. We had requested this previously and the hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful in doing their best to provide this. The hotel has a real boutique feel and the room itself was perfect with high ceilings with exposed beams which made it seem larger. Both the room, and especially the bathroom, were spotlessly clean and had everything we required. Every staff member at reception we met were extremely helpful and courteous. This is an absolute gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SophieGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: In Paris we expect small rooms but our room was so tiny that one person needed to lie on the bed while the other moves around. We are not big people and we travel light with average sized suitcases (combined weight of 32KG) which we could not fit in tiny wardrobe so they took up a third of the floor space in the room. I actually looked at the rooms across the hall which were advertised as being larger but they appeared only marginally bigger and the added space of an impractical use. Free wifi was so slow it was of limited value. Each day we were at the hotel, we returned to our room at 5pm to find it had not been cleaned so we would have to leave the hotel and sit in a bar until room cleaned as impossible for us to be in the room with the cleaner. At that time of night we prefer to be resting before going out for dinner. We are regular visitors to Paris, we always stay in the same hotel but thought we would try something different. This hotel is not good value and we are returning in May but will go back to our old hotel as we now appreciate how good it is. That aside, the nice things I can say are the staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean and cute and in a good location. It is just too small for comfort and not worth the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing find -- wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: mjsjava
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for one night as we were in Paris for a trade show. The rooms were average size for Paris and everything was very clean. My colleague had a great night's sleep but unfortunately my room had obviously just been painted as the fumes were very bad and I didn't sleep well. I should have complained but it was very late and by the time I realized how bad it was it was hardly worth it. I am sure that if I had said anything that the staff would have done everything in their power to rectify it. I have never stayed anywhere where they have been so accommodating. The show we were going to was in four different areas in Paris and we had mislaid the maps and information. They went above and beyond anything I would have expected when they accessed the website and printed all the information off for us. I would certainly stay here again and would recommend it unreservedly -- paint fumes and all!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: bentfords
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel des Grands Hommes after checking out the trip advisor web site. We were not disappointed. The hotel is ideally situation in the latin quarter or Paris, on the quiet square of the Pantheon. 5 minute walk to the Metro station. The room was a good size, well decorated with a nice bathroom. You can choose to have breakfast in the dining area or in the luxury of your room. The breakfast was adequate but nothing special. Friendly and helpful staff and a great location make this a good 3 star hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Isaboston
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quiet and in a great location of Paris near very good restaurants. It was a great refuge to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. Around the bend was a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower that was especially stunning at night when it was lit up. Our room was small but comfortable and we had a lovely balcony overlooking the Pantheon with a great view of Sacre Coeur in the distance. We also enjoyed having the free wi-fi to catch up on email and last minute research. The staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions on the best ways to get to our various destinations. The only minor thing that was a bit disconcerting was the elevator that we nicknamed "the little elevator that could" as it was very slow and seemed to struggle up to the higher floors. I preferred to take their picturesque winding stairs. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for having the best days in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: dlemtugova
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel des Grands Hommes in tripadvisor.com, and now we are glad to write the review. It was our first time in France, and the hotel des Grands Hommes did this time unforgettable. Good location, magnificent view from the window on Pantheon. There are a lot of good restaurants, interesting museums around the hotel, it takes you 5 mints to go on foot to Luxembourg Gardens. We think that the hotel des Grands Hommes has the best location for tourist’s staying. The room’s design is beautiful and authentic, it’s very cozy and delightfully. We also liked the big bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Thanks for Alexander from the reception desk, he speaks in Russian, and he kindly helped us with different problems. Amusedly we recommend the hotel des Grands Hommes!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value EVER”
Reviews.Author: entjohns51
Reviews.Content: Cosy, Romantic, Welcoming. It is as everyone says the ideal place to stop in Paris. Luxemburgh Gardens are a five minute walk, metro a four minute walk and around the corner is a tiny supermarket, four restaurants and one of the BEST pastry shops ever. The staff were fantastic and their English great. Example, we'd bought some pastries and I asked the woman at the desk if I could have a couple of forks/spoons and she bustled around and got us napkins, spoons and wee plates. WONDERFUL HEY? I loved the small welcome gift I received too. The rooms are romantic. We had a cheapie room (AUD about 180 and FREE wi-fi and that's gotta be worth about EU20 per day?) which was a little small but suited our needs. The shower was HOT and strong. Don't forget to check the closet for the shoe cleaner...I love those. If you want to organise an airport shuttle -- email beforehand and they will organise one for you--EUR17. He will meet you at the airport. Breakfast downstairs or up in your room for same price EU13.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for sight seeing - beautiful Parisian bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: Nik-Noi
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a romantic long weekend away to Paris for my 30th birthday which was a fantastic surprise in itself, but on arrival at the Hotel des Grands Hommes we were greeted by a very helpful and friendly receptionist and although we tried our hardest with the French language (which is not very good at all) she spoke to us and gave us advise in English. On check in, she advised us that she had given us a complimentary upgrade to a room with a balcony view which was lovely. On entrance into our room, I was overwhelmed by the decor of the bedroom which was a lovely blue and white Parisian style, and although the room was very small, the decor very much outweighed this small down point. Our balcony view was fantastic as we looked directly out onto the Pantheon! Location was absolutley fantastic! Just a five minute walk down the main road directly in front of the Pantheon (place du Pantheon) stood the Notre-Dame and all other main attractions such as the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre were only a short Metro trip which is very easy to use and similar costs to the London Underground. There are lots of cafes, bars, creperies, boulangeries and restaurants where ever you look, but I would definitely recommend walking a little further back off the main streets to find the quaint restaurants which offer much better value for money and also far better quality of food! I will definitely be returning to the Hotel des Grands Hommes on my next trip to Paris which hopefully won't be too far away as it is the most beautiful city to spend time in.

Reviews.Title: “True boutique”
Reviews.Author: ZozoLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel distills the essential difference between a boutique hotel and a "design(ed)" hotel: A boutique hotel has character, personality and warmth that transpire through every detail of the place. l'Hotel des Grands Hommes is a true boutique hotel, where everyone -from receptionist to manager through night and cleaning staff - conveye a feeling that they really care and that you belong: that more than anything you are a guest at their residence and that they are proud and pleased to share their "home" with you. It's a nuance that goes beyond service and professionalism and take your experience to a different level. (visited with my wife and 16 months old daughter to celebrate my wifes birthday)

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: KH11
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel and could not fault it. The location in particular was fantastic, perfect for exploring Paris with plenty of authentic restaurants, bars and cafes as short walk away. The view from our window was something I will never forget, and the room itself was charming (loved the cherubs!!) and well appointed. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: JMM0226
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel des Grands Hommes on my first trip to Paris, and I was extremely happy with that choice! The room was small as expected, but beautifully decorated - they absolutely made the most of the space and attended to every detail in design and decor. The windows opened up to a great view of the Pantheon and surrounding area. The location was very convenient, walking distance to a lot of the typical tourist attractions, but also in the midst of a couple cool neighborhoods with interesting local shops. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating. It was a pleasure staying there - I'd recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gloucs
Reviews.Content: Courteous, friendly staff and charming rooms. We love this area of Paris and the hotel is close to metro and RER for travel within the city and to aiport or Gard du Nord. Breakfasts were good with fresh food; croissants, various breads and a selection of meats and cheeses. The cellar where the small restaurant is has been well decorated and has comfortable seating. Service was very good and friendly. We could not return on Eurostar on our scheduled day due to the closed tunnel but hotel put us up and even upgraded us to a most beautiful room overlooking the Pantheon - thanks Veronique! After spending many hours that evening on a train trying to get home but being forced to return to Paris, it was the comfort and warmth of the hotel and its welcome which made up for the innumerable inconveniences we had endured that day. This is a hotel that gives genuine service and hospitality and we hope to visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, friendly staff, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chezzehc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view out of our window - waking up to see the Pantheon covered in snow!! Would definitely recommend this hotel. Couldn't have asked for more! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were filling, varied and delicious. Despite the room being small (as European hotel rooms are) it was warm, clean and tidy with a comfortable bed and a gorgeous decoration. The bathroom was very clean with a bath/shower and a massive mirror. Overall, the location was the winner for chosing this hotel - walking distance to most of Paris' major attractions and near transport for all others. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely delightful once again...”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelwoman
Reviews.Content: Our college-aged daughter was studying in Florence for the fall semester and we picked her up and then went on to Paris. We stayed with our daughter at this hotel on her last trip to Paris...15 years ago! Although my husband and I have been back, this was her first time as a young adult. The hotel was charming - we loved our view of the Pantheon. Although small (it IS Paris), our room was lovely and well-appointed. The dark-haired woman that runs the quaint breakfast room downstairs is quintessentially-French - just a joy every morning. The staff was extrememly helpful in making reservations at some of the restaurants we visited before and also provided 2 recommendations that were not to be believed. A TINY place around the corner called L'estrapade and a short walk to Le Maree' Verte. We are foodies from Chicago and these restaurants were outstanding. We reminisced about our last trip here together and made wonderful new memories to take home this time. Merci' Hotel des Grands Hommes!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, as expected”
Reviews.Author: Paris0
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic, staff was friendly and we were upgraded to a room with an amazing view of the Pantheon. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decadent and delightful”
Reviews.Author: Sugarcrackers
Reviews.Content: Our suite was huge and beautifully appointed. This hotel has the style and service of a large hotel but the personal touch that can only come from a smaller one. A brilliant location opposite the magnificent Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: aabraha
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. My wife and I were there for 5 nights. They were very friendly and easy to work with. We had a superior room with a balcony view of the Pantheon. It was a spectacular view but the room itself was quite small, but I guess that wasn't a huge surprise for us as most european hotels rooms are. The staff was very outgoing and they made our stay pleasant. But the location is what really stood out to us. We were minutes away from everything. We actually walked to the Louve and the Notre Dame from our hotel. There were several nice restaurants/cafes just minutes from the hotel. You could find almost anything you needed close by. They spoke english and gave us tips and suggestions for our trip. We would definitely stay here again for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable and amazing journey”
Reviews.Author: intrepida_ets
Reviews.Content: It really has been an unforgettable trip. It was our anniversary and wanted to surprise my partner with something special and very romantic ... and I got it! The hotel is small and care to the finest detail. The staff are very friendly and always willing to provide information about the city, restaurants, etc.. During the booking process they were incredibly friendly and helpful, and during our stay they were more so. Breakfast ok. The rooms ... incredible. Very romantic, clean, and room 61 with balcony overlooking the Pantheon is simply amazing. The views are stunning at night it seems that the dome of the Pantheon is to get behind the room. Very small but clean something normal in a city like Paris. It was an unforgettable trip and undoubtedly be repeated in future occasions.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mclime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five lovely nights at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. The staff was very helpful from our arrival to our departure - finding us a room on a higher floor, making restaurant reservations, giving us information on transportaion options both within Paris and for our departure. We had a very pleasant room at the front of the hotel facing the Pantheon. It was comfortably sized and well-appointed. The location is very convenient. We've made several trips to Paris, staying in a differnt hotel each time. The Hotel des Grands Hommes will be at the top of our list on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location and wonderfully helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JanineDNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Had a great room overlooking the Pantheon with a balcony and a small sitting room. The bed was comfortable. We took breakfast in our room one morning and the food was excellent. The bathroom was roomy and had a shower (I believe this is not always so in Paris). This was our first stay in Paris so cannot compare but if we return, would not bother looking any further than this hotel. It is very good. The staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful. Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THE HOTEL AUX GRANDS HOMMES”
Reviews.Author: HenryTerry
Reviews.Content: The location of this wonderful and charming 3-star hotel is excellent - near the Pantheon, the Sorbonne and the Jardins de Luxembourg, and on a direct RER line to the CDG airport and the Stade de France. Very comfortable, with very friendly and helpful staff - the basement breakfast is very good and served with a special smile.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned bijou hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathy98
Reviews.Content: Friendly, welcoming service , handsomely decorated rooms - although small when there is a view overlooking the Pantheon lit up in the evenings, it is very special

Reviews.Title: “Parisian style”
Reviews.Author: Markoff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel des Grands Hommes two weeks ago where I stayed with my mother as part of her birthday celebration. The hotel is absolutely fantastic. It is located in the most wonderful part of Paris, near the Sorbone and walking distance from Notre Dame. The area is packed with restaurants and caffees but is very saved from tourists. It is very Parisian and authentic. We had a room with a balcony (which costs slightly more) and it was incredible to wake up and see the cupola of the Pantheon from your bed! The room was not huge but very stylish and clean. The service was emaculate and the people at the reception were very friendly and helpful. Although it is not very cheap, in comparisson with the average price of rooms in Paris it offers a great value for money. I higly recommend this hotel and look forward to stay there again. The website of the hotel is wonderful too and it also offers some of its fellow hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel--Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyTravelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days and had a standard room facing the courtyard. It was quiet and spotlessly clean but quite small. The bathroom was fairly large, but as other reviewers have mentioned, the shower soaks the floor...not a huge problem, though, as housekeeping does a terrific job every day. The woman who checked us in and with whom we had the most contact (Farrah?) was wonderfully accommodating and very upbeat. She sent us to Rue Mouffetard our first afternoon...a street with one cafe and restaurant after another, so we had plenty of eating and drinking options within a couple of blocks to the hotel. We didn't try their breakfast, as my husband would walk down to St. Michel (about 2 blocks) and pick up coffee, croissants. and baguettes and bring it back to the hotel. He loved that a baguette with butter was only a euro. I used the free WiFi, but the TV was pretty much useless for us...I think all the channels were in French. The safe in our room was in an awkward spot, as you had to get on the floor to use it. We didn't use the minibar. While this is a great location for restaurants and cafes, I'd probably choose to stay a few blocks closer to the river next time...that is if all other things were equal. After a full day of sightseeing, those extra blocks can make a difference. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was well kept and comfortable on a safe street. Just don't expect our large, luxury, American standards.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL ATTENTION”
Reviews.Author: NSTMadrid
Reviews.Content: I was greatly surprise by the hotel's staff helpful and convenient attitude. The only "complaint" that I might have about the hotel is the size of the room; however, the location and the availability of free WiFi made me quickly forget about the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate room, in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Wallsendlad27
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in good location. There were some areas in the room and bathroom that could do with repair but nothing that spoilt the trip. Not that it was a great disapointment but the TV was one of the oldest i have seen in a hotel and the reception was quite poor. Breakfast could possably have been included in the price but again it was of no great importance, there were plently of places to eat arround the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HorrisScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights recenty and enjoyed the stay. Hotel is easy to get to on the RER from CDG airport, and about a 10 minute walk from the nearest Metro. Hotel is situated in a nice area with lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. It was probably about a 10-15 minute walk to the banks of the Seine/Notre-Dame. As previous reviewers have said, the room was small, and the king-bed was two singles put together, so was effectively same size as a super-king. Bathroom was fine although the shower tended to soak the floor as the screen wasn't big enough. The staff were all very helpful, and provided suggestions of places to eat or travel directions. We never had breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on the quality, but for 6.50E most local cafes did a breakfast which was very nice. One tip for visiting Paris - go to the Tour Montparnasse. We went in the evening, and there was no queue to get up to the top. Views are just as good as the Eiffel Tower, maybe even better since the Eifel Tower is in your pictures. We were there for the light show which happens on the hour, and the views were spectacular. Also a good area to get some dinner before or after.

Reviews.Title: “It was all that we had hoped for in a Paris hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGypsygal
Reviews.Content: The best staff ever...clean...nice location. You name it. We are fans!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel close to RER and within walking distance of all major sights.”
Reviews.Author: cherub28
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - room was spotless with all of the amenities. Staff was very helpful. Lots of great places for dinner. Best oysters ever at cafe a block away. You will love this one!

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel in great location, but rooms are small and Internet tenuous”
Reviews.Author: Reuel_Tidhar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Pantheon - an excellent location for traveling by Metro or on foot. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The rooms are clean. On the other hand, the rooms are very small; the Internet connection is tenuous (very low WiFi signal in my room, and many outages). The breakfast (which I thought wrongly was included in the price) was offered in a small unattractive basement room and was disorganized and unappetizing. Overall - the hotel is "kind of OK" but far from exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: greenmonstah
Reviews.Content: So glad we stayed here. Took the RER B from gare du nord and walked a few blocks to the hotel. It is directly across the street from the Pantheon and the area felt safe day and night. First person we met upon check in was Pierre and he made us feel welcome, and yes he speaks perfect English, as did everyone at the hotel. We rode the very small elevator to the 6th floor and found our room to be cozy and spotless. Great shower! We always took the winding staircase down on our way out to get our exercise. And speaking of that...we walked all the way down to Notre Dame and from there we either walked or took the Metro to everywhere we wanted to go in Paris. Buy the carnet of 10 tickets when you arrive in Paris to get you back and forth with the most ease on the metro. We had breakfast in the basement which is like being in a little cave. It was 13 euro but the only charged us 10, which was a nice gesture. We are missing the baguettes and croissants already! This hotel is excellent...would definitely stay here again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: TCA
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel - well located, spotlessly clean, fantastic service, fabulous view. I couldn't recommend it more highly and it will certainly be my hotel of choice for Paris for now on. Head and shoulders above anywhere else I've stayed in Paris. Staff also recommended a fantastic little bistro just behind the hotel - L'estrapade. Always a nice touch when they really know the area well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great service...”
Reviews.Author: Frankie066
Reviews.Content: As we walked in the receptionist greeted us. She was friendly and helpful. Checking-in was relatively painless. The lift was very tiny and the room was a bit small. But then we reminded ourselves that we were in Paris. By European standard, the lift and the room were actually very good. And by European standard, the bathroom was definitely huge! The room were charmingly decorated. The hotel is located right next to the Pantheon in the Latin quarter; perfect location. The hotel is only a few minutes walk to Boulevard St Michel and Boulevard St Germain. We even walked as far as Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower from our hotel. The hotel is very close to the eateries in the Latin quarter; very convenient. There are cafes and pubs and banks around the hotel. The breakfast in the hotel was quite good, not the usual buffet style but the portions were big. Pierre (the assistant manager there; i think) has been particularly helpful in arranging transport to the airport for us. Always updating us and keeping us in the loop. He speaks good English and has a pleasant sense of humour. He is also knowledgeable and has given us good tips and advice. As we were checking out, Pierre asked if there are anything they could improve on. My wife gave him a few suggestions and he gracefully accepted the suggestions. Sometimes people asked for suggestions but they get defensive when you start making negative comments; not Pierre. We will definitely stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel But..”
Reviews.Author: Mesopotamia
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely room, friendly staff but...the elevator is very, very small and there is no help with luggage. Only one person at a time with luggage can use the elevator. We were a party of three and it took several trips to get everything to the second floor and several trips to bring it all back down. Our room overlooked the Pantheon and was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great decor ... Great view.”
Reviews.Author: Carotvine
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room and was upgraded to a superior room overlooking the Pantheon. Simply marvellous. Loved the room, loved the feel of the hotel and the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: JohnLabut
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel des Grande Hommes was one of the highlights of our trip. The staff happily accomodated all of our requests (power adapter, ironing board/iron, reservations for dinner, directions). Also important to us was that they spoke English and were happy to take time to explain to us where we were, how we could get around, and some tips for navigating in the city in English. We could not have been happier. While in Paris, returning to the hotel was like returning "home" and it was a relaxing and beautiful room. We some reviews before booking concerning the size of the room. We stayed in room 22 overlooking the Pantheon, a Superior booked through their site directly (which was a great idea pricewise). The room was much bigger than we expected after reading reviews. If you want a big screen tv and need to do jumping jacks and cartwheels in the room you should think about a city other than Paris for your visit. We have to thank Pierre-Louis personally for his dinner reccommendation, Les Marie Verte, which was cozy, delicious, and the proprieter was warm and inviting. It was like dining in the French countryside at the house of a friend. Fantastic! In my opinion, it's no surpirse they have so many positive reviews on Trip Advisor and other online ratings agencies. We will absolutely return to the hotel the next time we make it to Paris, and we will be recommending friends and family do the same. Thank you so much for making our trip great

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Bobmiester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel des Grans Hommes for 2 nights for my wife's 30th birthday and had a fantastic time. We had booked a superior room but were upgraded to a delux penthouse room with view over the Pantheon. The hotel was beautifully decorated and the staff could not be more helpful. The location was bob on. All in all we had an amazing time...and didn't want to leave! 3 cheers for Hotel des Grand Hommes!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, friendly, and pretty. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Artistissimo
Reviews.Content: The Patheon reigns in all its glory across the plaza, the Jardin de Luxembourge blooms a couple of blocks away and the Sorbonne students slouch about the area, exuding youth. This hotel's is really nice in a great part of Paris. The staff is smart and helpful. We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, a good choice overall”
Reviews.Author: billinsugarloaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid September. Do try to talk your way into one of the top floor rooms with balcony overlooking the Pantheon. Be careful about arranging a shuttle service to meet your plane- ours never showed up and it was the fault of one of the front desk folks at the hotel. Tough way to start a to week trip in France. That said, this is a very good choice, especially for location, which is critical in Paris. Rooms are smallish, but typical of Paris. There is an elevator. Breakfast is so so. After all that, we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, clean hotel, in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ApolloCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and it's location. My only complaint is that the room was extremely small, and it was difficult to find places for our luggage, and still move around the room. It was clean, well located, and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They had a great breakfast, and they would bring it to your room if you wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, fair price, room very nice but a trifle small.”
Reviews.Author: lockhigh
Reviews.Content: We liked the Hotel des Grands Hommes very much. The location is excellent and the staff could not be nicer or more helpful. The common areas are very pretty and the room very nicely decorated, but a little small. Everything was spotless and in excellent condition. The continental breakfast was reasonably priced (10 euros), but unremarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: jobucci
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and comfortable. Located adjacent to the Pantheon, it's in a great spot! Great restaurants and bars within walking distance. Spacious bathroom - small room but typical for european hotels. Would highly recommend for a comfortable, nice, quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: upthebees
Reviews.Content: Having three children, getting the right accommodation is not always easy. From the original inquiry, we found the hotel very easy to deal with. On arrival, the staff were very helpful and friendly and were pleased that the rooms were exactly what we had asked for. The location is stunning as it faces the Pantheon. The immediate area is full of character with a wide variety of shops, cafes and restaurants. There are two Metro stations within an easy 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, quiet hotel, authentically "French" but American-friendly”
Reviews.Author: theyoungestsnowbird
Reviews.Content: My mother and I traveled to Paris for 4 days and stayed at Hotel des Grande Hommes. We LOVED it! I have been to Paris 4 times, all at different hotels, and this was my favorite. The location (across from the Pantheon) was quiet at night but only 1/2 block away from a lively Latin Quarter neighborhood. Rooms are small (to be expected in all European hotels if you are used to American hotels) but immaculately maintained. Staff was friendly and had great recommendations for restaurants, shopping, etc that made you feel like you were around locals.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DublinKevin
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel des Grands Hommes, in a fantastic location. The room was very nicely decorated and top quality facilities. Breakfast was very nice and hotel staff very friendly. There are also some great restaurants around the Pantheon square, in some case better than those around the St Michel and Latin Quarter, and less touristy. Only issue is that on some occasions, a large number of young people congregate in front of the Pantheon building and it can be noisey, but most nights the area is quiet

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: fallinandfilmin
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights. We were very pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and the bathroom having read so many comments about small hotel rooms and other comments here. We only had a basic room and it was great. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Great Location and Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: lincrownsville
Reviews.Content: My sister and I met up at this hotel from opposite coasts of the United States, and we could not have asked for a better experience. The room was lovely, and the staff went out of their way to make everything about our stay absolutely perfect. The location is great - literally across the street from the Pantheon. It's close enough to the fun of the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, several museums and several different Metro stops to be convenient to everything, but far enough away from "the action" to feel like you're "heading home" to a nice quiet place at the end of the day (or night!). We're already trying to plan another meet-up in Paris, and we'll definitely go back to the Grands Hommes when we go.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: angieos
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in this lovely hotel right in the Middle of the Latin Quarter. The rooms are not that big but I am told that in Paris bedrooms tend to be quite small. However the room was so cosy with a really comfortable bed and great pillows! The bathroom while small had everything we required. The hair dryer was actually one of the most powerful I have come across in hotels in a while. The balcony is very small but fits a small table and two chairs and looks right out onto the Pantheon Square. Very relaxing. We had breakfast the first morning. Very good but if you wanted hot food like eggs or omelette you paid 4 euro extra. The hotel does not have a proper bar but if you want you can sit in the small lobby and drinks will be served from a little bar tucked away in a cabinet! We went to a restaurant recommended by the hotel on our first night and it was excellent. Maree Verte and was only a short walk from the hotel. The hotel is walking distance to the Louvre and Notre Dame and if you are feeling energetic it is approx one hour walk to the Eiffel Tower! A lovely spot - pricey but if you want to treat yourself its worth it. I would defintely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very nice location, good value”
Reviews.Author: entrad
Reviews.Content: Very charming hotel. While you are a few blocks from nearest metro, the location in the Place du Pantheon is near ideal in that you are in full view of an impressive monument (great landmark for finding your way home on foot or in taxi!), yet it is remarkably quiet and away from the hordes. Close to Luxembourg Gardens and Latin Quarter/St. Germain restaurants and sites. The hotel staff are warm, friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that I booked a deluxe room with view of the Pantheon, and was given a ground level room. Because this trip was a gift, I did not want to make a big deal about it and upset my partner. The room was large and lovely, but it felt like an attempt to "pawn" a less than ideal room on someone who might accept it. Having to keep the curtains drawn at all times did not really allow a view to the Pantheon, nor even the ability to keep a window open. I would prefer they had been more up front and asked us if the ground floor room was OK. I would certainly recommend a room facing the Pantheon on one of the two upper floors where there is a terrace, even if the room is considerably smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way - location, accomodations, staff - it was all great!”
Reviews.Author: mikeandjen2002
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and it was very important to us that we find the best accomodations possible. Purpose of our trip was for a much needed husband-wife romantic getaway without the kids! Our requirements were to find a hotel in a great location, with a cozy room, and with staff that was helpful. We did extensive research and determined ahead of time that we wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter. We settled on Hotel des Grands Hommes based on our research and other reviews, and we are very glad that we stayed here. For starters, you cannot beat this location. You are across the street from the Pantheon and you can literally walk just about anywhere in Paris from this location. From our hotel we walked to Eiffel, Notre Dame, Arc, Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens, and every major attraction, monument, etc. Additionally, you are off Rue Sufflot which is full of bistros, shops, and great coffee shops. There are great restaurants in the area and you are literally steps away from great monuments and history. We were torn between staying here and at other more "trendy" locations and we are just so glad we chose this area. You cannot beat the location. Second, the staff at the hotel was beyond wonderful. They were friendly throughout the booking process and even more personable and helpful when we were there. They really went out of their way to be helpfula dn truly made it a wonderful stay. Finally, the room itself was terrific. We stayed in room 34 which faced in toward the courtyard. We were initally torn between the courtyard facing rooms and the ones that face the Pantheon. The rooms are essentially the same size, only difference is the view. My advice is this - save yourself a few Euros and get the courtyard rooms. They are quiter and quite honestly, when in Paris you will spend your time outside, so the view is not that important. We found our room to be romantic and perfect for our needs. They were clean, nicely appointed, and more than enough. If you are from the States, be warned - like all rooms in Paris, they are small. That said, as a husband and wife looking for a romantic getaway without the kids, the size of the room didn't matter - we had lots of fun :-) You really can't go wrong with this hotel. We fell in love with Paris and can't wait to go back. When we do, we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful little jewelbox”
Reviews.Author: JoanR1950
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Grands Hommes is small but beautifully decorated. Our room was done in wedgewood blue with white plaster work and I felt like I was sleeping in a wedgewood bowl. Great location, great staff, impeccably clean and a truly beautiful and very Parisienne hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: spunge411
Reviews.Content: The Location of this hotel is really amazing! within 5 mins of the lively areas of the Sorbonne, Saint Michel,Saint Germain, and the Latin Qtr...you are in a very local, romantic location, steps from the enormous Pantheon. We had a Room with a Balcony, which was a great place to see Parisian life begin early every morning. We had negotiated the price with Pierre and Farah... Both were very accommodating. The Room was on the small side, maybe even a bit smaller than we had expected. The room was very nicely decorated. €225-250 per nite seemed a little steep for the size of the room, but what you pay for, is the location, views, and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pied-à-terre for seeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: souxieqLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location, spotlessly clean, friendly staff, beautiful decor. Small room but very well designed. We stayed on the first night of our honeymoon and it started the week perfectly - a romatically bijou & cosy hotel, stumbling distance from the beautiful Luxumberg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good location helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: gefanjan
Reviews.Content: Booked for 3 nights 7-10September We got a very nice room on the 4th floor which was reasonably spacious for a Parisian Hotel.The room/bathroom was very clean with a comfy bed. The public areas were extremely nice ,looked as if it had all "just been done up" Great location right opposite the pantheon and only a few minutes walk to Bvd St Germain and the metro

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room with a wonderful view of the city, a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: salmonboo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, had requested a room with balcony and thats exactly what we received. we arrived early and room was not ready but no hassle to leave our bag to go exploring Paris. Staff were very helpful, everything was clean and room exceeded our expectations - the view was outstanding, bathrobes a nice touch and a wonderfully comfy bed!!! The only very minor problem was they had no tonic in the bar so we couldnt have our nightcap we were hoping for on our balcony!!! Also would of liked to have seen more toiletries in the bathroom but its not a complaint just a personal preference. Would recommend to all, thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel , not very cheap but ... great service , very nice and helpfull staff . great location .”
Reviews.Author: zagamama
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel , not very cheap but ... great service , very nice and helpfull staff . great location .

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location”
Reviews.Author: SJBee
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite part of Paris but my first time staying in Hotel des Grands Hommes. The location is superb, given that my room like many others, had a great view of the Pantheon itself. It's a very quiet place to sleep, even if you're on the street side of the hotel. However you're a hundred metres from the heart of the Latin quarter. The RER Luxembourg is the closest public transport link, which makes it ideal for trains in from Charles de Gaulle airport. Airport to hotel takes around 45 minutes. Staff at Hotel des Grands Hommes are very friendly, I ate out so I can't comment on the food. The superior room was spotless, wonderfully decorated, romantic, and very good value - I booked a month in advance and got one of their cut price website deals for late summer. 357 Euro for two nights. The room was average Paris size, small to medium. Wholeheartedly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay for Seeing the Highlights of Paris”
Reviews.Author: WatermelonMan
Reviews.Content: After a long day on the road we were pleasantly surprised to find our hotel so attractive and comfortable and it couldn't have been more convenient. From there we walked to Notre Dame and caught the red bus (with a 2-day pass) to take us to all the sights we wanted to see. We walked to Luxembourg Gardens and the Latin Quarter, and had our pick of many little sidewalk cafes for crepes, cappacino or a glass of wine with lunch. Our room had a little sitting area overlooking the Pantheon, so there were times we took a break from sight-seeing and enjoyed spending time relaxing in our room. The staff were all so pleasant and upbeat. We loved Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: welovetotravel123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. (Look on their website for the best deal.) The hotel has beautiful, classic decorations, and the staff were always extremely professional and helpful. It is right next to the Pantheon & Luxembourg Gardens, but still feels like it's in a quaint neighborhood, especially down the side streets. You can see the top of the Eiffel Tower if you stand at the Pantheon and look down the street. Also the hotel has free wi-fi, which was very useful for us because our phones can access the internet. (We brought our iPhone dock and listed to online radio in our room.) Of course, the rooms are on the smaller side because you are in Paris, but they are still very comfortable and clean. The hotels have A/C, but you can also leave the windows open at night and it is very nice. There is a private bathroom, and the shower had decent water pressure. There is an elevator you can use, although it is on the smaller side. There is always someone at the front desk, and you leave your hotel key with them so that you don't have to worry about keeping track of it. They are also happy to hold your luggage if you arrive before the check-in time. For breakfast, we enjoyed the place nearby called "Deli's Cafe" or something similar. They had a crepe station out front, and made a delicious "complete crepe", which has ham, egg, and cheese, at a competitive price. Overall, we loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely classy hotel, perfectly positioned for Paris romance.”
Reviews.Author: slesski
Reviews.Content: A Honeymoon gift bought by close friends which was an absolute treat, with a Terrace room on the top floor overlooking the delights and views of Paris - perfect. The staff were polite at all times, extremeley helpful and offering wonderful suggestions. Also respecting our privacy at all times. Close enough to the City to walk and enjoy all the delights that Paris offers.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: lostinspaceIreland
Reviews.Content: When we arrived by taxi to Hotel des Grands Hommes first impressions were everything. Across from the Pantheon and only a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame with lots of cafes/restaurants en route, the location could not have been better. We were met at reception by one of the most friendly, courteous & helpful people you could wish to meet. This applies to all of the staff we met - without exception. It is a small hotel but beautifully decorated and even though our room was small, it was so gorgeous that size wasn't an issue and it had a terrific view over the Pantheon & Square. After a very long day sightseeing, it was back to sleep & in spite of it's central location, it was so peaceful & quiet. We didn't get to sample the breakfast as time was against us but I honestly can't imagine it being anything but good. If I had one complaint about our visit to Hotel des Grands Hommes, it would be that we didn't have longer to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, lovely location!”
Reviews.Author: ailsa1955
Reviews.Content: Hotel lovely, staff very helpful and the breakfast was lovely and well presented. Room and facilities were just excellent. The staff could not have been more helpful. Booked meals when asked and helped to find places and gave directions.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely The Best!”
Reviews.Author: kfitz84
Reviews.Content: Pierre, Colette, Farrah and the rest of the staff make this a Five Star experience at a great price. Immaculate rooms, service that is incomparable, and location. Who could ask for more. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: BerlyCt
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff was very helpful and made you feel very welcomed. When I plan my next Paris trip, I'll be staying at the Hotel des Grans Hommes. The hotel is very close to the rail system and many cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Bastille Day Celebrations”
Reviews.Author: TOMTOMCARIBOU
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in great area next to the Pantheon and very close to the Sorbonne and the Luxembourg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean rooms with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysontheroad1010
Reviews.Content: I've been several times in Paris and stayed from 2 to 4 stars hotel in different districts, but unitl now this is the top. Great location, parking just other side of the street, 2 bike parkings in the surrounding streets. All famous sites are in walking distance and several nice restaurants around the hotel. Room was nicely decorated, with a view to the Pantheon...what would you want more. Furnitures and decorations are new, bathroom as well which are very important for us. Clean room, clean hotel, helpful english speaking staff. Room size was o.k.. So no negative but only positive points, I can only recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “this is a lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sharonaPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: It was easy to get to. the staff were very helpful and very friendly. It was quite reasonable. It was very quaint.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LAworld
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel des Grandes Hommes. The room was lovely, spotless, and well appointed with a small balcony and a view of the Pantheon. The room is small, but space was used wisely and the bathroom was large by Paris standards. There was limited closet/storage space if you plan an extended stay. It was a short walk to the Cluny Museum and the lovely Luxembourg Park, as well as a reasonable stroll to Notre Dame and Sainte Chapelle. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel especially at the great rate I received through the hotel website..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location, big rooms for Paris standards”
Reviews.Author: katiederik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just traveled to Europe for several weeks and this hotel was the highlight of our trip. The staff was so nice and helpful. We arrived very early in the morning and the concierge genuinely tried to get us a room even though we were 6 hours early for check in. They held our bags while we got breakfast and when we returned they had the room ready for us. Its amazing how a friendly and helpful staff can really brighten up your day and start your sightseeing off on a great note. The bathroom was very nice. The rooms were unique and a little older (i.e. not modern furniture and accessories) but they had a lot of character and they were larger than any of our rooms throughout Europe. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, good value and very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: MKRBethesda
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. The rooms were lovely and comfortable - not large, but not cramped at all, and very very pretty and very clean. The elegant bathrooms were very fresh and sparkling clean and well-appointed with spacious baths and sinks. The staff in the front was always friendly and very helpful, as were the staff in the breakfast room. The air-conditioning was a welcome feature, too. The location was very nice - just at the imposing Pantheon. The breakfast was not the best, but it was fine and a very nice amenity. This hotel would be nice for couples, or families or single travelers. The internet worked well too. My only complaints were the lack of washclothes in bathroom, and bath robes would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “overall a very pleasant experience. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: tiger8484
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant experience. Pleasant staff. Excellent location. Very clean. Rooms were small but consistent with older European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “all we hoped”
Reviews.Author: francesbernadette
Reviews.Content: good points 1.location - love area great bars and restaurants 2. service- very friendly and helpful 3. room - size was good/very clean/ furniture in keeping/bed comfortable/loved walls 4. good value breakfast bad points 1. being picky- breakfast room too small however can have room service breakfast at no extra cost 2.NOTHING ELSE

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: RRson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights here in June and can highly recommend it. It is well located with a great view of the Pantheon, though we found the surrounding plaza to be fairly active, therefore somewhat noisy, at night. Our room was lovely and the bathroom excellent, even though the tub was small for two. C'est le vie. It is air conditioned which was needed as Paris got quite warm this mid June. There were many nearby restaurants of various sorts and the Luxembourg Gardens were nearby. They had some ongoing problems with the lift but they seemed to stay on top of that, which is good as the staircase is winding and narrow. Though relatively expensive I can give this hotel a favorable recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: HeatherWilson
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. It has excellent views of the Pantheon. The upper rooms, some with a small balcony also view the Sacre Cor and have a "tip toe view" of the tip of the Eiffel tower (terace off room 60). The rooms are very very small but are clean well decorated and comfortable. The staff was always pleasant and helpfull. The breakfast is small and a bit pricey. Consider a picnic in the near by Luxenberg Gardens but be aware that you are not allowed on the grass in much of this stunningly beautiful park.

Reviews.Title: “GReat Hotel - ALways a pleasure to stay there”
Reviews.Author: voyageher
Reviews.Content: This was my third or fourth stay @ HGH. I have been very pleased with the whole experience :great rooms (good size for a Parisian Hotel), professional and convivial staff, great location and affordable price. It is pretty quiet too event if you have a room facing the place du Pantheon. I will definetely stay there again for my next visit in PAris. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lumem
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for just over 2 weeks in the middle of July and had an absolutely fantastic time. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We booked it as a result of the TripAdvisor reviews and we weren't disappointed! The room was great with an amazing view of the Pantheon, a very nice bathroom and a good size for Europe. Even better than that, the staff were exceptionally helpful. They were more than happy to make restaurant recommendations and reservations for us. If they couldn't get through at the time they'd call back later and let us know. At the end of the trip they printed out our eTickets and saved us a lot of hassle. The Latin Quarter is a great location with plenty of restaurants and shops just around the corner. If you want to go futher, the Luxembourg metro stop is just a short walk away. This hotel definitely deserves its reputation and we'll be staying here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel....made our trip to Paris manifique!”
Reviews.Author: ddpeacock
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, clean, and luxurious. The staff was extremely helpful, knowledgable and friendly. (Their english was excellent, and they didnt laugh at our french.) We had a lovely time in Paris largely because of this special hotel. The location was wonderful...great restaurants, bars, Luxemborg Garden, Notre Dame, Batobus nearby. Our room had french doors that opened to The Pantheon, the beds were very comfortable, the decor gorgeous, the facilities very spacious and comfortable. We recommend it highly and cant wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonMary
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just come back from at three night stay at Des Grand Hommes hotel in Paris and can't fault it. The lobby area is very cool and the staff couldn't be more helpful. We had room #33 which was charming and though it didn't have views of the Pantheon was quiet and perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the charming Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: Parker44122
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 17 year old daughter at this beautiful hotel after reading many reviews on TripAdvisor, and we were absolutely thrilled. The hotel has a wonderful Parisian charm and the staff are so friendly and helpful. Our room was a triple (#32) and even though it was on the smaller side (which is to be expected in Paris), it was so comfortable and beautiful and so well - maintained. We were excited to come back to our room after a long day of walking, and especially loved the location, which is removed from the busier streets of Paris, but still close to everything. A few blocks behind the hotel is Rue Mouffetard, which is filled with restaurants and cafes and so lively at night. We enjoyed a perfect Parisian breakfast (cafe au lait, croissant, baguette with jam and ham and cheese baguette) at Le Soufflot, right down the street from the Pantheon, and our waiter, Gelda, was so funny and friendly (a fun experience for our daughter on our first morning in Paris). The two block walk to The Luxembourg Gardens also makes this hotel the perfect location and the ten minute walk to Notre Dame takes you through wonderfully, charming neighborhoods. We wouldn't stay anywhere else when we next visit Paris (which can't be soon enough).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer experience!”
Reviews.Author: ErnestTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have to say this was the best hotel stay in Paris we have ever had! This hotel, along with a few others, is owned by the same owner and we have now stayed at 3 of them based on the great experience at each one but this location was outstanding! First, we were upgraded to a junior suite with full balcony overlooking the Pantheon. The decor was somewhat overdone but very PARISIEN decorated in Empire style in very beautiful shades of browns and plums. The room was very clean and comfortable and we had the option of having breakfast sent up to the exterior balcony or eating downstairs in the historic cavern beneath the hotel. We had already stayed at the sister hotel next door and found Hotels Des Grands Hommes to be much quieter. This is the only hotel I have ever stayed in that I can remember where the Manager greeted each guest by their name. I found this to be a very personal service and one that truly made the customer experience an exceptional one. Of this group of boutique hotels, Hotel des Grandes Hommes was truly our best choice so far. All are quite lovely but this one is conveniently located near an excellent bakery, fantastic Thai restaurant, wonderful wine boutique and several excellent restaurant choices. It is also very close to Les Jardins du Luxembourg if you are a walker or running or just like to take in some beautiful scenery. The Pantheon is across the street so there are some tourists in the area, however, still quite an historical site.
