Otherwise, it is not quite as close to the main center of action as, perhaps another sister hotel, Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon, but this is still my favorite so far! I recommend booking in advance online to secure a reduced rate reservation (no cancellation option though). You can save a LOT of money using advance booking and still get a very beautiful & comfortable room along with very convenient location in Paris! This hotel is quite close to bus and metro stops so easy to get around from here and very safe. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Formidable!”
Reviews.Author: jea17
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful 4 night stay at this hotel. After reading previous comments on Tripadvisor, we decided it would fit the bill for us.....and were not disappointed. Having contacted the hotel to check rooms, we booked Room 61 for the beautiful view of the impressive Pantheon right up to Montmartre. We had breakfast just one morning on our terrace - great start to the 14th July! Reception staff were all extremely courteous, helpful and friendly. The hotel is in an excellent area - close to the Luxembourg Gardens/RER station and just off the Boulevard St Germain leading down to the Latin Quarter, then Seine. The Jardin des Plantes and rue Mouffetard are to the other side. This is not an economy hotel but neither is it expensive for an excellent city centre base. We would certainly have no hesitation at all in returning to Les Grands Hommes on a future visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Latin Quarter location”
Reviews.Author: walkaboutman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Grand Hommes is tucked away beside the imposing Pantheon. Many of the rooms overlook, or rather, are overlooked by this massive Paris landmark. Rooms with full balconies can be had on the 5th and 6th floors for a wonderful baguette and cheese breakfast. My woefully out of practice French was no issue, the staff were only to happy to converse in English when I stumbled about trying speak. The hotel is spotless and very French, no faceless hotel chain here. The hospitality is genuine. Access is easy to the hotel, as is access to the rest of Paris from the hotel. 2 quick blocks away is a major RER/Metro link giving you access to all of Paris within 30-40 minutes. The Tour de Eiffel is 5 RER stops and 15 minutes away! The sheer volume of gastronomical delights in close walking distance is mind-boggling. You would need months to eat in all the nearby establishments! As for shopping the Rue De Rivoli is a 10 minute walk just past the jaw dropping Notre Dame Cathedral which of course is right on the left bank. Perfect place for your first or fifty first visit to Paris. Tres Bien

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceecee100
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel in Paris. The Pantheon is a great area. There are many restaurants, cafes, the metro, etc. in all directions. The rooms, while small, were very nice, well-furnished, and spotless. We really enjoyed our time here. Only negatives were a slow elevator/lift and the breakfast is too expensive (so don't eat there; go out). Overall very happy with this hotel and would go back. Location was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central”
Reviews.Author: OzChards
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms and nicely decorative and Parisian! Good location directly opposite the Pantheon with access to St Germain and the latin quarter. Rooms were a little small but completely manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ketel_always
Reviews.Content: You never know what you're going to get in Paris with smaller hotels but this hotel exceeded my expectations. I've been to Paris many times for business and always stay the weekend in town. I've tried many hotels on various lists and they were OK but none really met the expectation until this one. It was the perfect combination of location, charm, and value. Let's face it, many travelers are clueless to what the hotel experience is in Paris, you're just not gonna find a Courtyard Inn or anything remotely like it. It's Paris, not Jackson. Believe me this hotel is exactly what you want; clean comfortable, quiet, really it's perfect. I'll never stay anywhere else. I'll be back next June. P.S. their direct website has better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel staffed by courteous, helpful, knowledgable Parisians”
Reviews.Author: Jim_and_Tony
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Grand Hommes is great boutique hotel located in the Latin area on the left bank of inner-city Paris. Across the street from the Pantheon, and three blocks from Luxemburg Gardens, the location is superb for exploring the city. A Metro Station is conveniently placed next to the Gardens' entrance, and provided excellent transportation to all the attractions of the inner city. The room was a tad small, but spotless, well appointed with self controlled a/c, internet, small fridge, cute antique furniture, super clean bath, closet w/safe, desk/dressing table, and an interesting exposed beam ceiling. Maid service was excellent (they even tastefully arranged the toiletries!) The elevator is very small, but serviceable. The view looking down the staircase is a vertigo inducing thrill. The breakfasts in the cozy dining area in the cellar were tasty euro-style (croissants, coffee, dried fruit, cheeses, breads (from the corner bakery), O.J., cereals, and assorted cold cuts. Honey and assorted jams were also at your disposal. This is not a five star all inclusive luxury hotel and spa, but the service was superb, the value excellent, it's tucked away in a quiet clean neighborhood, and the friendly staff made the experience a joy! There are a number of decent restuarants close by, and a great little neighborhood of small shops (corner style grocery, bakery (yum), meat market, fruit stand, etc.... just a block away. There is shopping on Rue St. Michel, Rue St George (three blocks from the Luxemburg Garden entrance), There is even a McDonald's and a Subway closeby for those Americans who can't do without fast food. The hotel did not have a spa, restaurant, pool, fitness center, or room service. However, we were not looking for that. We just needed a comfortable place to relax after a hard day of sightseeing. The staff was so friendly that we soon felt as if the place was home. We speak almost No French, and they were understanding, and had a good grasp of English. They put up with our clumsiness in French etiquette with a smile and understanding. Directions were given cheerfully when asked, recommedations were always spot on, and a friendly smile was welcome when we dragged ourselves in at any hour. As first time visitors of Europe, we were pleasantly surprised by the congeniality of the Hotel staff. During our stay, out of 100 interactions with Parisians, we only had two bad experiences with locals who do not care for Americans (perhaps our neophyte looks?) One was with a street vendor near Notre Dame Cathedral that sent us on an 8 block search for a Metro entrance that was 20 yards from his booth (in a pouring rain). The second was on I'Ile St. Louis when a group of waiters at the La Brasserie de l'Ile St Louis made it a point to be rude and discourteous to us. Rick Steves recommends this eatery, but I beleive that you must speak at least passable French in order to enjoy any kind of meal there (we were charged 9.4 Euros for two Cokes, and it was made plain to us that we were not welcome there.) However, the Isle St Louis is very charming, and has the very best ice cream shop on the planet, bar none! (Rick is right about that!) Paris was as beautiful as everone said, the weather was great 80 % of the time, and the people were not condescending towards us at all. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Beauchamp
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms, one superior and the other de luxe so was upset on arriving at the hotel to find the superior room had a "view" of an expanse of side wall of the Pantheon and to see the full splendour of the dome involved leaning right out of the window. The room was disappointingly small. My friend's de luxe room had a fabulous view but not the seating area as implied on the website. After expressing our disappointment I was, somewhat reluctantly, given my friend's room and she a room on the floor below which at least had a sofa but it could scarcely be described as a separate seating area. The bathrooms were small; we expected better and in her de luxe room the toilet was in a cupboard. Beds were comfortable and the air conditioning worked well but the decor, traditionally French, was rather too exuberant for my taste. The staff were, on the whole, courteous and efficient but it was a surprise to find that my room had not been cleaned when I returned at 4.00 pm. Much worse was the difficulty in attracting the attention of the night porter. We had to wait for 15 minutes to be given our keys when we returned to the hotel at about 10.00 pm and then, an hour or so later, there was absolutely no response when phoning down to reception to ask for a taxi. Looking out of the window we saw the porter joshing about with friends in the square and smoking a "fat" cigarette. We wanted a taxi and it could wait but if a guest was endeavouring to summonse emergency medical help it would be completely unacceptable. The hotel website speaks of the square being tranquil in the evenings. Our experience, admittedly on a very hot night, contradicts this as until well into the small hours there were groups of loud youngsters fooling around, playing music etc. Intermittently there was also, and I simply could not explain it, a curious high pitched whine in the square at night. If it was one of those devices meant to be audible only by young people and to disperse them, it failed on both counts. Overall, and based on the very favourable Tripadvisor reviews, I was expecting better. I am sorry to be in disagreement with other travellers who have stayed here but I really do not feel it lives up to its billing and think the hotel website - as they so often do - overstates the case.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: JRD_YFC
Reviews.Content: the hotel is pleasant and clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. the rooms are on the small side and the TVs are old (tube style) but overal the location and area are a good combination.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: wally1
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights after all reading reviews in TA. thanks everyone as it was exactly as you all described it and we had chosen well. Great staff, excellent room, good bathroom and awesome location ...lots of places to eat nearby...

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful boutique hotel in a superb, surprisingly quiet, central location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Doctordj
Reviews.Content: The stay in this boutique hotel was delightful from start to finish. The front desk staff were extremely welcoming on arrival and were thereon consistently polite, friendly and helpful. The location, immediately adjacent to the Pantheon, is superb with a distinct lack of traffic. The rooms are delightfully decorated. The bedroom was a little cramped although the queen-size double bed was superlative and one of the comfiest mattresses I have slept on in some time - wish my bed at home was as comfy! The bathroom was large, by European standards, and this is very important when traveling as a couple!! The shower was above average with lovely towels and the usual complimentary soaps etc. Paris was very hot when we were there but the rooms remained cool without obvious aircon. Gripes are minor and include lack of a business centre/computer (we travelled without a laptop), a slightly cramped bedroom and perhaps a rather expensive breakfast (but then most of Paris seems expensive nowadays for us Brits!). We forewent the hotel breakfast on 3 days (out of 4) and went to a superb brasserie just around the corner enjoying superb croissants, tartines, chocolat chaud, cafes etc. All in all a superb hotel and one that we will definitely consider for future trips here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest stays we have had in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Littlevenicelondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed between June 20th to June 23rd to celebrate our fifth anniversary and our stay could not have been better. The staff at the Hotel des Grandes Hommes are wonderfully efficient as well as friendly - we looked forward to seeing them each evening! Our room - on the top floor - had a large balcony with a view of the Pantheon where we could sit and read and have a drink in between cultural excursions. When we wanted champagne (the mini bar is very reasonably priced) champagne glasses were produced from the bar downstairs, likewise with the wine glasses. The rooms are wonderfully quirky as well as comfortable but with hotels, the ultimate comfort is the service one experiences - and the staff were superb. Despite the central location, the hotel is very quiet - we slept with the window open and were not disturbed at all by any traffic noise. Local places to eat and drink are numerous but we can recommend Delas on the Place de Contrescarpe for coffee and drinks. For our anniversary dinner we were lucky enough to get a reservation for the famed Yves Camdebordes Le Comptoir: http://www.hotels-paris-rive-gauche.com/Le-Comptoir-Yves-Camdeborde.html. Dinner reservations can be booked up six months in advance, but we asked on the day and they gave us a table outside. It's also wonderful for lunch (no booking required). We left on Tuesday, trying to work out how soon we could return - Marie Jose and Pierre-Louis, you can expect us in the not so distant future!

Reviews.Title: “lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: hhmAtlanta
Reviews.Content: All of my dealings with the hotel staff - from reservation inquiry to returning the key upon departure- were pleasant and professional. Much better experience than other Paris hotels of the same price point and star rating (i've been to Paris many many times). There are a few triple rooms that are particularly handy if travelling with a child. Yes, all Paris hotel rooms are small, but at least it was nice to be in a well-decorated one. If I had to comment on one area for improvement, the housekeeper did not come one day until 4:30 pm, which was awkward because we were already back from sightseeing and had to leave the room again for her to clean. Overall, I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have picked a better located place.”
Reviews.Author: EKU1
Reviews.Content: As an educator and historian, I could have not been more pleased with the location beside the Pantheon where so many great French women and men are entombed. Plus, the hotel is virtually surrounded by buildings of the University de Paris (The Sorbonne). The courtyard around the Pantheon enhances the location. The staff is extremely helpful and their English is excellent. You may rely on them for excellent restaurant tips as well. There are many delightful places just around one corner or the other. If you are into the hop on hop off bus tours you are a short walk from a stop in front of Notre Dame or by the Palais De Luxembourg. The Louvre is also an easy walk. Our room (31) had a beautiful view of the Pantheon. It was smallish by US hotel standards, but beautifully appointed and comfortable. Listening to others talk about the size of their room, maybe it was spacious by Paris standards.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernBoyCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel June 7-11, 2009 as the second part of a trip to London and Paris to celebrate my partner's 60th birthday. We wanted this hotel to fit the occassion and it did. As its address would indicate, it is located right at the Pantheon and the left bank is literally at your feet. The hotel itself is a small but beautifully maintained. Our room on the fifth floor (their fifth) had a small balcony and a pretty view over the rooftops. An excellent king sized bed, a comfortable sitting area and fully modern bath made the room very comforable. We took advantage of the breakfast room each day and were well fortified for our typically day long adventures. The staff at the desk (there is no concierge) were very helpful, spoke English and offered recommendations on places to eat, directions to sites and made arrangements for our transportation to CDG airport when we were leaving. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: JayB4
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grands Hommes is a boutique hotel that faces le Pantheon in Saint Germain des Pres which is centrally located in the old Paris and in walking distance of many tourist attractions. We stayed there for 3 nights on our return to Paris we also stayed in l'Hotel du Pantheon a sister hotel next door. Both hotels are nicely decorated and comfortable. Les Grands Hommes is done in the Empire style because the owner loves the Napoleonic era. The staff was extremely helpful, the manager remembering each visitor by name! The edifice dates from the 1700s and in the gym, located in the basement, there are vestiges of roman arches! There is a very nice breakfast available in the basement as well and the service is impeccable. My wife and I highly recommend the hotel and will definitely stay there on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tony K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, and was pleased to say it met expectations. The highlights: 1. Friendly, courteous and efficient reception staff. 2. Location in the Latin Quarter - easy walk to Jardin de Luxembourg. 2. Close to restaurants & cafés, with bakery and grocery stores within easy walking distance. 3.Close to RER line B for connections to the airports. I chose to use the recommended shuttle service instead of RER due to my luggage. 4. Lovely view of Pantheon from my bright, clean and cosy room. I was travelling solo so booked a smaller room - it was more than adequate for my requirements. Did not get to see the inside of other rooms. 5. Free wi-fi for my laptop and iphone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belfast_traveller_8
Reviews.Content: We booked room 50 - balcony room with a view of the Parthenon - for 3 nights and had a wonderful stay. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had breakfast delivered to the room each morning, which was a real treat. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect. Highly recommended. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute delight”
Reviews.Author: Carro78
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had a wonderful 4 night stay at this lovely hotel! The location is great, close to the Luxembourg Parc (excellent for enjoying your breakfast croissant) and sights like Notre Dame and the Louvre. The neighbourhood offers great restaurants, cafés etc. I love the decor of the hotel and the staff were all so very nice and helpful. Everything was just brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tchristinestt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my newly college graduate daughter, another friend and her daughter. The hotel, is across the Pantheon, 1 block from Jardins du Luxembourg, 2 blocks from La Sorbonne, 3 blocks from La Seine and Notre Dame/Chatelet. Musee d'Orsay, the Louvre within walking distance. The Metro and RER station is nearby as well and takes you EVERYWHERE in Paris. We loved this hotel because of its location and the staff was just the nicest and most accommodating. Everyone spoke english is french was a challenge. The Classic rooms are smaller than American standards but plenty adequate unless you plan to stay in all day. I will stay there on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very helpful in guiding us through Paris.”
Reviews.Author: mpc1013
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grandes Hommes was our first stop on our honeymoon. After a long trip to get to Paris, staff was very accommodating in getting us checked in early. Staff continued to provide us a lot of help in getting around Paris, and making reservations for activities and meals. Our room was small, which we expected, but did have a great view of Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “very paris, very clean , very nice”
Reviews.Author: dino27
Reviews.Content: just back from two nights at DGH , everything on trip advisor is true , hotel very nice, clean , excellent location and very very french. Rooms ok but on small side but i expected that for Paris. Having read some reviews and forum entries i was quite worried about price of food and drink , this proved unfound as most of the local pubs nearby were on a par with Dublin/London at 5.5 euro a pint and 7 euro for g and t . if you wanted the happy hour was even cheaper. Food , for two mains two sweets and bottle of wine we spent no more than 60 euro and all meals were superb. A word of warning as everyone probably knows the closer you go to main attractions prices do get crazy and seen a pint quoted at between 15 and 30 euro in city centre, but i will return to Paris and this hotel , au revoir

Reviews.Title: “Really fun and enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: Flora1844
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated on the Place du Pantheon: lively during the day and very quiet at night. Charming decor. Helpful and friendly staff. Very clean. LIked best: the big windows with the view of the Pantheon. Like the least: no drawers in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - romantic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wordhome
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at this faboulous hotel next to the Pantheon and close to the Luxembourg Gardens; it was an unforgettable stay. From our room on the 2nd floor, we had a stunning view to the Patheon, and from the charming plaza outside the hotel we could see the Eiffel Tower. Just 10 minutes walking from Notre-dame.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for a perfect Paris vacation!”
Reviews.Author: TravGeekU2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awesome!! We enjoyed our stay so much. I honestly have never seen a cleaner hotel room. You can tell they obviously take a lot of pride in the upkeep of the hotel. We had a beautiful view in room 52 with a balcony overlooking the Place du Pantheon. The morning coffee was also wonderful. The front desk staff were very accommodating and even helped us with train reservations to Reims. I sincerely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “New Fave in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CarrieT023
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Paris for a weekend and stayed at Hotel des Grands Hommes and couldn't be more pleased with our stay. The rooms are decorated with little French touches and were very clean. The location is amazing - wake up to a view of the Pantheon, and it is situated in the Literary Left Bank of Paris, there are great walks to be taken right outside the front door. You are nearest the Jardins du Luxembourg, the Latin Quarter and a ten minute walk to Notre Dame and the Siene. But the thing that really puts this hotel over the top was the staff. They were so incredibly helpful and nice. I requested tea in the room on arrival and no more than five minutes later it was brought up. We asked the concierge, Pierre, for some advice for traveling to the southern parts of France and he not only gave us valuable info but looked into hotels for us in the Avignon region. I was blown away. He was incredible along with the rest of the staff. Whenever I head to Paris, that beautiful city, I'm going to stay at Hotel des Grands Hommes. Simply lovely. Thank you for excellent memories!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms with a View”
Reviews.Author: NGHC
Reviews.Content: Autum in Paris was great. We stayed twice at this hotel on this trip. The first stay on April 13, we got room with view at the 2nd fl. The room was petit but beautiful Parisian style. The breakfast was great, sufficient continental breakfast, but outstanding services. Second visit, on April 18, we get an upgrade to the balcony upper floor. The room was petit but beautiful. We got great view of the Phanteon. Overall, we were happy with this hotel for its location, great view and superb responsive services.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem, Next to Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: marteaudor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in the heart of the Latin Quarter, next to the Pantheon, near the Ecole Normale Superieure and the College de France. The staff are remarkably courteous. The rooms are small but elegant, and the bathrooms are superb. WiFi is free, a real plus. I got the reduced Internet rate, which was half the normal rate of 270 euros per night. At the reduced price it's a steal. Breakfast is on the expensive side, but a cafe next door gives much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: howhoo
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located 4 blocks from RER train station near Luxoumberg park, plenty of bistros and shops etc, try the little gelato place on Rue Souflott, the best. Rooms were petite, but bed was comfortable enough which is important to me, and view from balcony is scenic and great for enjoying some wine and cheese. Outer street side could be a little noisy at times for sensitive sleepers, it's more quiet on the inner courtyard side. Staff was extremely courteous and helpful, place was clean, immaculate, and beautifully decorated. Place is a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Real French hotel - cute and exquisite”
Reviews.Author: DreadPirateRoger
Reviews.Content: It's really nice hotel. Very good location and friendly stuff. Room was also ok, rather small but cute. View to the Panteon is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not great”
Reviews.Author: santokkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Des Grands Hommes for six nights in a balcony room for about $250-300 (I don't remember exactly)/night. Some general thoughts: THE GOOD: --As many have stated, the location is excellent. It is an easy and enjoyable walk to many sights, resturants and transportation options. The location alone could justify its price (which, while not ridiculous, is still a bit expensive for the hotel itself). --The rooms feel rustically Parisian with charming details like beamed ceiings, toile wall paper, and fanciful headboards. This was very important to us in our search for a hotel.. we did not want to be in a cookie cutter chain hotel. --The front desk was friendly and helpful in their services. --The maid service was solid and it was great to come to a consistently clean and set bedroom and bathroom each day. --Beautiful lobby. --Great WiFi access in the rooms. THE NOT AS GOOD: --While the rooms are certainly rustic in its Parisian charm, it still could use a little bit of an update, in my opinion. The carpet is clearly old and could use updating. I generally don't walk barefoot in the rooms of any hotel rooms but this was especially the case at Grande Hommes. --Our room was also MUCH smaller than we had anticipated (and we're from NYC and very familiar with small spaces). While it was comfortable and suitable for our needs, it was a bit of a disappointment at first to see how small the room actually turned out to be, considering we paid for the second nicest option for a room, thinking that this would provide more space. I can't imagine what the most affordable room options must be like! --The television is really old and has maybe two functioning channels on it (French language speaking). But then again, I suppose one isn't in Paris to watch television. RANDOM: --Overall, we did not really see our room as a place to really revel and be delighted in as soon as we walked in each day. But it was a suitable, charming enough room for us to relax in that happened to have an EXCELLENT location. --If you are into really good food and are wary at eating at the tourist traps that line the sights, I hiiiiighly recommend that you purchase a pocket-sized book called "Clotilde's Edible Adventures in Paris" by food blogger and cook Clotilde Dusoulier. We ate at 8-9 different recommendations from her and were blown away by EVERY one of those meals. Simply outstanding. A stone's throw from Grandes Hommes is a restaurant called Les Papilles. We ate there twice. Delicious. Be sure to make reservations though!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all ways - location, design, cleanliness - plus great staff”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaToast
Reviews.Content: As this was our first trip to Paris, we wanted to create an experience that would make us want to return - thanks to Hotel Des Grands Hommes, we were successful. I picked the hotel from a 'hotels with a view' category in a travel book, plus verifed via TripAdvisor what others thought. I am happy to add our positive experience as well. I have never seen such a clean room and bathroom, coupled with exquisite design that was not too over the top, but definitely matched the ample size of the room and the fact that this is Paris. Fabric walls, detailed hinges, and a comfortable bed. There are six rooms per floor and a wonderous winding staircase if one needs exercise, but as the elevator was efficient, I only walked up once to burn off some calories. The staff was very helpful, check-in was a breeze, plus cabs arrived punctually. There are restaurants nearby, and it is about a five minute walk to Blvd Ste Germain and less to St. Michel. A quiet setting that was always welcoming. Other than breakfast, there are no meals available, plus my only negative room comment would be that a flat screen tv would have been nice - but then - who needs to watch tv while in Paris. We expect to return to this hotel in 2010. We were in room 52 which had a small balcony with a table and chairs overlooking the Parthenon. A great value in addition to the accolades above.

Reviews.Title: “It was good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: SimonsScreenName
Reviews.Content: I think the location was excellent if you like being near the restaurant district or Latin Quarter, and we found the walk to Notre Dame easy and enjoyable. The Pantheon makes a great landmark for finding your hotel! We booked the Deluxe room with either a view of the Pantheon or a balcony. We ended up with a balcony and to be honest it was not worth the extra money because the balcony was not great and only overlooked the tiny courtyard, so you felt on display to all the other rooms. I suppose I had in mind that a balcony might provide a view of something external, if not the Pantheon. The hardest part was that the room was very hot and stuffy with the only option to get air was to open the balcony doors during the night (not really a smart thing to do in a hotel where the balcony joins other balconies and appears to be easily accessible). So we suffered the slightly suffocating feeling in an already tiny room. This is definitely a problem that the hotel needs to address. Otherwise it certainly was clean and quiet. Breakfast was nice because the lady running it was very friendly and helpful, but I'm not convinced that the buffet breakfast is really worth the 10 euros each. I could be wrong, but I have a feeling you could do better by getting breakfast out, and at the very least explore breakfast possibilities in Paris to enhance the experience. Finally, the staff were okay, but I didn't really get to experience the 'wonderfulness' that appears in the reviews here concerning staff. They were mostly good, but to be honest I didn't take to the girl who served me initially. Maybe I was tired, but she came across as a bit 'snooty' and slightly arrogant. Not a good start because the first impression is usually the one that lasts. At another time they tried to charge me for a Perrier from the mini bar, which I have no idea how they arrived at that because I always avoid the mini bars for obvious reasons. I'm sure it was a simple mistake, but it didn't help the experience. It was good, but I consider it to be abit over-priced for what it was, and our room was actually a Spring special! If you choose it, I think you will enjoy your stay, but don't expect it to be wondeful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: hunts32
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with wonderful service. Located very close to RER lines, great restaurants, and minutes walk from sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, friendly reception but warning on security”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireUKtraveller
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a group of friends for a weekend. Reception on arrival was very friendly and efficient and we were all pleased with our rooms, although I think we paid at the top end for this range. Having researched the hotel we did not expect rooms to be large, but they were well decorated, spotlessly clean and our room (61) had a beautiful view of Montmartre from the balcony. I cannot agree with the previous poster about location - OK it is a long way from the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe, but who can complain about walking distance (10 mins) to the islands and Notre Dame and opposite the Pantheon. All the sites in Paris are not on top of one another. There is a good choice of bars and restaurants nearby. There was some noise one evening outside the Pantheon that disturbed some of our party, but nothing too problematical. Our real problem however was that one of our party made the mistake of leaving her purse out in her room whilst we went out to dinner instead of locking it away in the safe, which she obviously should have done. However on our return someone had entered the room and taken 300 euros, despite reception being staffed 24 hours a day. This was a surprise given our experience thus far with the quality of the staff and marred our stay. Initially the staff on duty at the time were quite unhelpful, but later the manager of the hotel was very helpful in assisting our friends in reporting the theft to the police etc and providing complementary breakfasts. Overall I would say by all means stay at the hotel, but make sure you use the safe and do not leave valuables accessible in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, nice decor but not a gd locaion to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: FKY
Reviews.Content: It takes 4 mins to the nearest RER station and 20 mins to Notre Dame,I don't see why there're so many Trip Advisor reviews recommended this hotel for its great location... Despite the long walk from tourist sights, I think that the wonderful staff, nice decor and quiet surrounding still made my stay there a pleasant one!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jdclarke50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March. Overall the hotel was a great little boutique that my girlfriend and I enjoyed staying in. Hotel was quiet and very close to tourist sights, bars and restaurants. Hotel staff was very helpful. Room wasn't very large, but it is Paris. Bathroom was nicely sized. The place was very clean and comfortable. We would definitely go back and stay at it again when we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: travellorworls
Reviews.Content: Most helpful and courteous staff. Great view. Great location. Spacious and comfortable bathroom. Intend to include this hotel as base for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, Friendly, Good value, EX-cellent staff. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Baldhubris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really liked the HGH and its partner next door the Hotel du Pantheon. (We stayed at both on the same visit due to our own mistake in scheduling) We found the staff very accommodating and pleasant. The location is great for the Latin Quarter, with easy walks and access to the rest of the city nearby.

Reviews.Title: “ok but could be better”
Reviews.Author: aer28
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location, the decoration of the rooms is very nice too, but the room was too small. The terrace was not keep in good order, the table was dirty and the walls need a paint! We saw some ants on the bathroom. The t.v was so old and the quality of the vision was poor. We booked the most expensive room, in the booking said that was a bigger bedroom with living area, but wasn't true at all, in our room (nº61) was no living area and was so small that is impossible to think in something smaller! The breakfast buffet was quite poor also, and the service was always busy because only was one person attending customers. The lift was not working to the 6th floor, where was located our room, so the firsts days was kind of unconfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent View and Extremely Courteous Service”
Reviews.Author: loidajen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days at the HDGH for my hubby's b-day trip and requested our room based on recommendations. We could not have been happier. It had the fantastic view of the Pantheon and a nice sized balcony where we sat several times and enjoyed the beautiful weather. The staff could not have been more helpful and considerate. In fact, they were calling us by name within the first day. Walking distance from everything but still quiet at nights since the Pantheon closed at 6pm most days. Best of all was the staff. Each one went out of their way to accommodate our request. We cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: pauljoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first week of our honeymoon here and were delighted! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful; the room was quite attractive. clean and cosy; and the location was perfect: easy to get anywhere with restaurants down every side street but quiet and peaceful at night. We are both older (early fifties) and travel regularly: this was my best accommodation experience in Paris to date.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: aschaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2008, and because we booked through their website far in advance we got a really good deal and ended up paying 90 euros per night. So I would suggest checking their website for deals before booking. Because of the cheap rate we didn't get a room with a view (except of a courtyard) but that was fine with us. The room was a bit small (not much room around the bed), but the bathroom was spacious. The location was great too, and reception was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trig_and_Yuko
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here, and our room had a fantastic view of the Pantheon (as most rooms there do.) The staff was great, and it was a good place to be to get around the Latin Quarter. I highly recommend walking down the nearby Rue Mouffetard, where you can find many examples of the incredible breads, meats, cheeses, crêpes and chocolates that Paris has to offer. I have to be honest, I did have a problem at the hotel with noise from the traffic around the Pantheon, but I am a very light sleeper so I doubt it would be a problem for most. My wife slept just fine. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonNewcastle
Reviews.Content: The weekend was a gift to my partner for his 60th birthday, and I wanted it to be special, but also within budget. I chose this hotel on a friend's recommendation - the location seemed good from the description - and proved really splendid - walking distance to parks, river, and to the busier parts of the Latin Quarter. Paris hotels are very expensive but I didn't think this one sounded too unreasonable, despite the exchange rate at the moment (we got a book-ahead deal via the Internet). We had a lovely ('superior') room with balcony overlooking the Pantheon. The room was fairly small but very nicely furnished and the balcony made it feel big enough. Very nice bathroom too. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast very good too. We would certainly go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Unique.”
Reviews.Author: campseat
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms at this lovely, boutique style hotel. I made the booking over the internet for, what I considered a bargain price, especially when you consider the remarkable location. Delighted that the hotel exceeded all our expectations and that we were even upgraded. It seems churlish to mention that the rooms are of modest proportions but they were very clean and the staff delightful. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming rooms, EXCELLENT LOCATION, beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: CPTDanny
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my wife and everyone at the hotel was so helpful, especially Farah at the front desk. The room was beautiful and a little small but that's to be expected in Europe. It is located literally across the street from the Pantheon and offers a magnificent view. Truly in the heart of Paris as we walked to The Louvre, Notre Dame and could have walked around much more. Loved my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience on our 1st trip to Paris! Thank you, HGH!”
Reviews.Author: Lee4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March, 2009 for 3 nights. The hotel is small and charming and gave us just the experience for our first trip to Paris that we were looking for. The staff is very friendly, helpful, and nice and they will gladly speak English if you need them too. Pierre made us feel like we were the most important guests in the world! Our room was the “deluxe” on the 6th floor (this is the top floor of the hotel), and we had a balcony. It was too cold to use, but we stepped out a few times just for the lovely views. We were directly across from the Pantheon and in the distance, we could see the Sacre’-Coeur—beautiful, especially at night! The rooms are small but extremely comfortable and well organized. There was a closet next to the bathroom with hanging space on one side and built in shelves on another, along with a safe. There was also another small closet full of shelves when you entered the room. The TV was high up on the wall and easily viewed from the bed. Speaking of which, the bed was extremely comfortable! The bathroom is small and can really only hold one person at a time. The shower did have a partial glass door to block some of the water, but we usually ended up with water on the sink and floor anyway. Toiletries are provided, fresh towels, etc. There is a hair dryer that comes with the room as well and works very well. The rooms are extremely quiet; we cannot recall hearing other guests, not even in the halls. I believe there are only 4 or 5 rooms on each floor. The elevator is tiny so it will hold 2 people with luggage and 3 without. It was somewhat slow, but this never was a problem—we never found ourselves waiting for other guests to get on or off. One thing I did not know about beforehand (but which was not a problem either) was that guests give their key back to the front desk anytime you leave the hotel and pick it from them when you re-enter. Again, this was never an issue, no matter the time. Someone is always at the front desk. They also have a small ice machine in the lobby and will happily send you off with a bucket for your room. We never went down into the dining area so I can’t comment on the hotel breakfast. Internet access was included with the room and was fast. Comments on earlier posts indicated that the Internet speed was a concern. Hardly. The Internet was faster than we had expected. In fact, it averaged around 6Mbps per second, that's about three times as fast as standard DSL. It was more than sufficient for all of our needs, which including a nightly video chat with our son. No hiccups, no glitching. It was awesome. There is a wonderfully delicious little bakery (boulangerie) close to the hotel—kind of on the street behind it—so we had ate pain au chocolate every morning, along with assorted other bakery items. Croissants in Paris are amazing! We loved this hotel, found it so relaxing and comfortable, and it was in a great location. We used the RER train to get to and from the airport and had no problem walking to and from the hotel with our luggage. The metro was also close by, as were several places to eat that were very good as well. I can’t say enough good things about this hotel and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DJSB3
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Grands Hommes is an excellent hotel! Looking forward to styaing again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: girlreporter_9
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I stayed at HDGH in March for three days. We woke up every morning marveling at what a lovely view and room we had (a balcony overlooking the Pantheon) and what a great deal we got. Book ahead on the Internet - and during low season - for lower rates. Totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, central location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: cham16
Reviews.Content: We booked two twin rooms, which even though they where at the back of the hotel (not the best view) where lovely and clean. The service was brilliant, the lady on reception bent over backwards for us to ensure our trip was a pleasant one, with recommendations, directions and advice. The location is great as it's central to many tourist attractions yet so quiet at night. The only thing I would say is that the continental breakfast was quite expensive and you had to take it downstairs in a sort of dungeon, we found local cafes offered cheaper breakfasts with a view of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location & romance”
Reviews.Author: MichelleGDurham
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a truly wonderful location, within walking distance of everywhere and a great range of shops and facilities. Located opposite the Pantheon it was an amazing experience just walking out the door, with a great view of the lights at the Eiffle Tower in an evening. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. The room wasn't huge but that added to the French experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: NorthernIrelandRosie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights commencing 15th March 2009 and found it lived up to all the good reviews posted to date. It is a charming hotel with very obliging staff. Everything was clean and comfortable and the rooms very quaint. The breakfast buffet was good and the lady in charge did not mind that we always left our attendance to the very last minute. The only downside for those who prefer to be more in the centre of things is the 5-10 minute walk uphill from the Luxembourg RER station. It didn't bother us but the more elderly and infirm may prefer to have a closer stop. We would definitely recommend the hotel to other people and go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, pleasant, peaceful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: boglex
Reviews.Content: We had a great, short stay at the hotel. Everything went well, the room was nice, the people working there were friendly, the location was a little removed from the major activity of the Latin Quarter, but that was fine, since it meant that it was relatively quiet, and we needed it primarily as a place to sleep. We would stay there again. Don't bother with the breakfast, go somewhere nearby instead.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Package”
Reviews.Author: paul8888
Reviews.Content: Found this great little hotel after searching online and looking at reviews on Trip Advisor. We where very impressed with all aspects of the service and presentation of the hotel. We have stayed in Paris 5 times now and this was by far the best hotel. Right outside the Pantheon and in a beautiful district close to the Metro, RER and within walking distance of many other great attractions. Nothing was a problem for the accommodating staff and we will definitely stay here again next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Truly magnifique”
Reviews.Author: RosieTravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grands Hommes is a gem in the midst of the Sorbonne, Latin Quarter - with the Parthenon outside the door and Notre Dame 5 minutes away! Exceptionally clean lovely room. Staff superbly friendly and helpful. Throughout February email exchanges with them helped us a great deal with our planning. We used the hotel's website to book and then later to alter our travel dates. Were impressed when we received a phone call from Pierre-Louis offering assistance. During our stay, he along with Denis and Farah made us feel so welcome. Many Parisians speak very good English. But they very much appreciated and encouraged us when we tried out our rusty highschool French. Do take one of the free English guided tours of Notre Dame. Our docent kept us both entertained and enthralled with her wonderful stories. Also attend a free organ concert there. Our favourite restaurant was Flagrant Delice for atmosphere, good prices, very cheery friendly staff and fantastic food. Most dishes are their own special creations served proudly. Try the lamb dish - tender morsels layered with slices of eggplant - mmmm! It's located amidst the sea of restaurants in the Latin Quarter at 16 rue Saint-Severin - right behind St. Severin church. Our 8 days in Paris flew by quickly - so much we did not see. On our next visit will undoubtedly return to Hotel des Grands Hommes and Flagrant Delice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel des grandes hommes”
Reviews.Author: Inger_7
Reviews.Content: We just want to agree with the good rewiews of this hotel. Lovely interior, proffesionell staff and in every way a very nice hotel . The location is also very good . The left bank is in our view the best part of Paris to been in during a vacation , many ´restaurangs , cafes and lively night life.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stippie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last December and I failed to write a review before, but this hotel certainly deserves a review, so here it is. When we arrived, Place du Pantheon took our breath away. The Pantheon is very impressive and since it was Christmas time, there were decorated trees in front of it. The hotel was right across the street (and tastefully decorated as well). Upon arrival we were given a free upgrade to a deluxe room with Pantheon view. The room and the bathroom were very, very clean, and the view was spectacular. We enjoyed having breakfast at the hotel, in a small, but lovely space, with a very friendly 'breakfast lady'. Breakfast is European style, so no pancakes or eggs and bacon, but we enjoyed the croissants and pain au chocolat. The staff was very friendly and when we left, they called us to say I had left my journal in the room and they would send it to me, which they did. Great hotel, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: tomwall
Reviews.Content: easy access walking to restaurants, laundry if needed, parks and the metro. having a landmark monument (pantheon) in your front yard meant you would never get lost. the staff were very pleasant and helpful - no kidding. not fake at all. we were upgraded without asking. pretty good value breakfast but the coffee could be hotter. of course you dont have to eat there. plenty of room, in room safe, wifi, all the good stuff and a reasonable price. i would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at a great hotel, great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: WilliamcAustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and 5 days at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. We had a room that looked out directly to the Pantheon. The hotel is very well appointed, and I scored major points from my wife, who loved it. Room was classic cool. The decor was lovely, room was clean, and quiet. It's within the Latin Quarter and walking distance to Notre Dame, etc. Great location. Major plus was the staff. Very helpful and very friendly. Denis was especially great in giving us guidance on where to go visit, and making sure we were well taken care of. On the whole, I strongly recommend this hotel, and the price is great for the location. We walked past other hotels listed on TripAdvisor, but none looked as nice as this. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Central location , great price”
Reviews.Author: satch_9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on two occasions and both times have been very pleased with the location of the hotel (5 min walk from Luxembourg Gardens), and the friendliness of the staff, who were happy to book taxis for us, etc. The hotel was also very clean. The only downside would be the size of the rooms but this didn't bother us too much as long as the room was clean - after all it was really only somewhere to put our head down. Small hotel rooms appear to be quite standard in France. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for its great location and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “A Must for a Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DeeAthCliath
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews but I had to about this hotel. Having read the Tripadvisor reviews on this hotel I decided to book for a 5 day stay in Paris. The hotel definately lived up to all the reviews. Getting from the airport to the hotel couldn't have been easier, particularly with the Pantheon as the local landmark. We literally had to get 1 train from the airport and were in the lobby of the hotel within 30 minutes. As we were early, our room wasn't ready but the hotel were more that happy to take our bags and store them for us. The staff couldn't have been nicer....they were sooo polite and were always more than willing to help. The room was amazing! We had a balcony and a view out to the Pantheon. It was extremely spacious and there was plenty of storage. The room had a safe, tv and a mini bar. The lobby in the hotel acted as the bar, very quaint but really nice. The area around the hotel wasn't overrun with touristy restaurants and a 15 minute walk brought you to a myriad of local winebars and trattorias where French was the primary language spoken. The Parisians were so friendly and polite, especially when you made an attempt to speak a little bit of French (and believe you me....I have very little!). The Perraudin restaurant was a gem for dinner and just around the corner from the hotel. I cannot reccommend this hotel highly enough. In three words I would say that it is friendly, clean and romantic. See the pics I have attached! Go on....just book it! P.S. If you contact the hotel direct you might get a better rate than that on all the different websites.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, friendly staff, marvellous location”
Reviews.Author: UtrechtMarianne
Reviews.Content: Me and my family (husband and two kids of 18 and 15) had a very nice time in Paris. Also due to the Hotel des Grands Hommes. We never discovered the Pantheon before, it's really worth a visit and so is the hotel. Friendly staff to welcome you, nice spotlessly clean rooms, where it is really dark at night, thanks to the thick curtains and in a quiet area. It's true that the rooms are small, but big enough to sit and talk and have a drink on the bed. But most of the time you're out in wonderful Paris. There are three metrostops in the neighbourhood: Luxembourg (RER), Odeon and St. Michel. At the Odeon-stop there are two cinema's with movies in original versions. Breakfast in the hotel is nice, good choice with fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereals, bread, coffee, tea, hot chocolat as much as you like and well feeding to start a long day in the city. It's certainly worth the money. Behind the hotel is a nice cafe (Cafe de Nouvelle Maire, where you can also have dinner) and a very nice Boulanger in front of the cafe where you can buy delicious rolls, sandwiches and pastryies for lunch. In the same street is also a small supermarket to buy drinks (water!). It's also very nice that there is a car parking (Vinci parks, Rue Soufflot) in the street, only a few minutes walking away. We would certainly go back to hotel des Grands Hommes next time!

Reviews.Title: “A1 Location - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: crworldwide
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and had a very good experience. Room (30) had a sensational view of the Pantheon. Nice clean bathroom also. Great location in a nice part of town. 5 minute walk from Luxembourg RER. Great pub (Bombardier) on opposite corner of Place Du Pantheon. Heartily recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tjb42
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location! Across the street from the Pantheon and only a couple of blocks from the RER stop. Easy walk to Notre Dame. Elegant lobby with very friendly reception, very accomadating and helpful. The room was gorgeous, but tiny (standard for Paris). The bathroom however was about the same size as the bedroom making ti very spacious and well appointed. The renaisance style decor makes it very unique and a far cry from cookie cutter chain hotels. Our view was into the courtyard in the back, so nothing special, but was fine. A cozy, romantic spot to act as a great launching point for exploring what Paris has to offer. Also very close (4 or 5 blocks) to a great area of bars and restaurants frequented by local students and offering great bargains.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: tigerduck
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes was a real pleasure. The rooms facing the Panthéon have a beautiful view and are spacious enough to accommodate two people easily. The rooms are beautifully decorated and well-appointed. Service was absolutely outstanding. After receiving a very warm welcome upon check-in we were always greeted in a way that made you feel at home. Especially Ms. Malika, who is responsible for the breakfast, was a true jewel. One of the things I appreciated most was the perfect location. Everything can be reached easily either by bus or metro. Even late ar night we were always able to walk back to the hotel and never felt scared in the least way. Overall, a perfect place to stay for a memorable (and this in a good way...) stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: hophiphop
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay in the hotel was excellent. The physical location opposite the Parthenon is stunning but even better was the abundance of cafes and restaurants nearby. We were spoilt for choice. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. My only negative comment relates to the size of our room which was pretty small and seemed more suited to a short stay. I felt there was not enough room to store clothes or suitcases. Apart from the above I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should be 4 star”
Reviews.Author: vhild
Reviews.Content: This hotel should definitely be a 4-star establishment, at least the rooms (although small, no. 62) and the lobby are very nice. Situation is perfect facing the Pantheon and the inner courtyard rooms (cheaper) are ultra-quiet. Friendly staff too, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim18
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. The staff were extremely professional and friendly. The room was large by Parisian standards and we really liked the clean large washroom. We liked the view and balcony. The flowers ordered were beautiful and nicely arranged. We liked the location - the RER and Metro were within walking distance. And it's close to la rue Mouffetard with all its great market shops. The neighbourhood was charming with shops and restaurants all around. The only thing we didn't like was the fact that the television made a humming noise when it was on. We fixed it by turning it off.... we weren't in Paris to watch TV anyways. Next time we're in Paris, we'll definitely book here first.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service”
Reviews.Author: azmikey
Reviews.Content: The last time I was in Paris was in the fall of 1999 for business. I stayed in a boutique hotel somewhere in the Latin Quarter. The hotel was serviceable, but nothing remarkable. Since I would be taking my wife on a romantic getaway to Paris this winter, I decided to do some research on Tripadvisor, where I found the Hotel Des Grandes Hommes. Boy am I glad I did! I booked the hotel through the American Express website several months in advance. The rates for the winter were a substantial savings over the summer or holiday periods. A couple weeks before the trip I sent an e-mail to the hotel confirming my reservation and asking for directions from the RER. The response from Valerie was fast and professional. I even coordinated flowers to be delivered to the room prior to our arrival. Valerie arranged for everything. Our flight was an hour early arriving and we got to the hotel a little early. No problem said Farrah, she was able to get us checked in a little early so we could freshen up and begin the day. Since we were early, the flowers had not yet arrived. She took me aside and she had them placed while we were out sightseeing. The hotel is easy to find, when you exit the RER, find the McDonalds on Rue St Michel. From this McDonalds on the corner, you will see the Pantheon and head up the hill and in three short blocks you are at the hotel. The lobby is well lit, the rooms were incredibly clean and the bathroom was very spacious with a large soaking tub and shower. We had a king size bed, and there was still room for two pieces of luggage. The room had two sitting chairs and a desk. The heater worked great and at night, we even turned it off and let the cool air come in from the plaza. The entire staff was most accommodating, ensuring that we had appropriate information for trains, subways and the night before the transit strike, they gave us a headsup so we wouldn't be stranded. We had breakfast a couple days in the basement. If you don't want the breakfast, at least take the time to go downstairs. It is a pretty neat little area. I would recommend the Comptoir de Pantheon restaurant that is on the main street coming up from Luxombourg Gardens. The food was always hot, fast and tasty. There is also a place around the corner, Vin Danses which is more traditional French food. Overall, we would go back in a heartbeat to this hotel. Great service. Fair price. Clean rooms. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian Dream Come True Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiddlingSort
Reviews.Content: We've been to Paris many times and always dreamed of staying in a hotel like Hotel des Grands Hommes. 18th century building with decorations that mirrored the period, not to mention an amazing view of the Pantheon out our window. Not only is this hotel meticulously maintained, but as a former historian I noted the decorations were true to the period. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating from where to eat, to assisting with transportation questions for travel outside Paris (and even did the research on the internet for us), as well as providing some French lessons for my husband. Don't forget to eat the petite dejeuner either (remember, no free refills in a French restaurant but yes in this Hotel!). The only bad thing about our stay was that it was so perfect it went by too fast. A birthday celebration I will always remember! We will most definitely stay here again. P.S. We read about this hotel on TripAdvisor and the reality of our stay mirrored the great reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: MHolst
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights from 24th of January to 27th of January 2009 at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. It is a wonderful hotel with a great location. The service was fantastic. The breakfast buffet was good, but there should be more variants of bread than just white bread and müsli bread. There was a little noise from the street, but it did not keep us awake. Overall a great 3 star hotel in the top of the 3 star category. We stronly recommend this hotel to travellers who seek comfort and great service. M.Holst

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: steof1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from the 8th to the 11th Jan with my girlfriend and must say it is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. I got a great deal trough their website booked the superior double room which worked out at 200 per night a lot cheaper than booking trough a 3rd party. I sent an email requesting a room with a view and balcony the hotel emailed me back saying they will try their best to accommodate. We arrived a little early 12.30 and were told our room was not ready. We left our bags in the luggage room and walked around the local area for some lunch. We returned at 2.30 and our room was ready. We were in room 50 on the 5th floor of the hotel. The lift is a little small. The room was large by Parisian standards and decorated very well we had a view looking straight onto the Pantheon which was amazing. We also had a balcony, which added a lot to the experience even if it was too cold to have breakfast on. The staff at reception were very friendly and spoke excellent English and helped us with any queries we had such as places close by to eat what’s the best way to get to the attractions. We forgot a travel adaptor but could get one from reception for just a 10 euro deposit which we received back when we checked out For anyone coming via Port Mallot Shuttle bus you can take the Metro line C at Porte Malliot to St Michel which is only about a 10 min walk to the hotel. This is better than spending 40+ euros on a taxi, which is what happened to us at the beginning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris not alone is it a lovely clean spacious hotel with great views but the streets around it are littered with lovely cafes and bars to enjoy a nice quiet drink.

Reviews.Title: “Well above average”
Reviews.Author: Merati
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grands Hommes lives up or even outperforms the expectations one has of a three star hotel. - Friendly, English speaking staff - Although the room is small but sufficient as expected (approx. 2,5 x 2,5 meters) the bathroom is relatively roomy (2,5 x 1,5 m) - The bathroom was very clean - A pleasant location, near Parc de Luxembourg, Blvd St. Michel and Quartier Latin. There were just two things that could have made our stay even better: - Initially, we were assigned a room on the second floor, which smelled of paint due to maintainance in the next room. A room on another floor was available when we asked for it. We wonder, however, if rooms on other floors were available, why we were assigned one on a hall covered with plastic foil and paint fumes. - The shower was very uncomfortable, since it coped with two common problems: a chalk clogged shower head and a too small shower screen, which caused water to flow over the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snowflos
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grandes Hommes is a lovely little hotel in a great location. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. I also loved the room decoration - everything was finished perfectly and to a high standard. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean, and location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MarkCoreNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights during the week to do a bit of tourism. My French friend recommended staying in the Latin Quarter area, and this hotel was in that area. It was close to the Luxembourg metro stop, so i knew it'd be easy to get to from Gare du Nord since we came in on the Eurostar. The hotel has a very tasteful reception area and VERY friendly and helpful staff. Each person we dealt with was courteous and went out of their way to help with questions or requests. I had requested a balcony if it were possible and was given a balcony room with a beautiful view. The room was small but from what I understand that is typical of Paris and besides, we weren't going to spend days in Paris in a room. Everything was clean, convenient, and easy. I have zero complaints about this place and its location made it all the better. There are restaurants close by, as well as places to pick up liquor, cigarettes, or have a nice meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greensparkle
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, spotlessly clean, very comfortable rooms with tasteful decor, wi fi and wonderful views of the Pantheon. Extremely courteous and charming staff. Great location. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at HGH”
Reviews.Author: CanucksInTrucks
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations from the Tripadvisor ratings and the HGH didn't disappoint. We booked a superior room but they upgraded us to the top floor suite (room 60) with views over the Pantheon and the rest of Paris! The hotel is well located, cosy, and nicely appointed. The front desk staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and all speak good english. Very handy central location. Le Pantheon is across the street, of course, but it's only a few blocks west to Jandin du Luxembourg, a few blocks north to St Germain Blvd (and a few more to the Seine), and a few blocks east to Rue Monge and the very interesting Rue Mouffetard. Take the RER B from CDG Airport to the Luxembourg stop and take the five minute walk to the hotel if you don't mind rolling your suitcase a few blocks. They offer a continental breakfast and I agree with other reviewers that for 12 euros it's just OK ... why not stroll over to Rue Monge and pick up your breakfast at any of the excellent boulangeries there which are always open early, or pick up whatever you want at the Champion grocery store (open 0830-2200 daily except Sunday) on Rue Monge near the Cardinal Lemoine Metro stop. The HGH is a very well run little hotel. On another visit we stayed at another hotel run by this ownership, the Jardin de l'Odeon, and had a similar positive experience so I think you will do well with any of this group's hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Balwyn
Reviews.Content: The fabric of the hotel and its staff were excellent. Its location is excellent as well. My only quibble was the breakfast. We had stale pastries and felt that the selection was meagre and did not represent value for money. We took our breakfast elsewhere on the second day. Other than this an excellent hotel. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room, spectacular view!!”
Reviews.Author: Sam&Colin
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel after reading all the wonderful reviews on this website. The trip was a surprise for my boyfriend's 50th birthday and I wanted somewhere typically French rather than a large hotel with no character. The Hotel des Grands Hommes was everything we could have wished for and more. I booked a superior room (60) and it was beautifully decorated with a balcony overlooking the Pantheon - wow, what a view! and on a clear day and at night you could see right across the city to the Sacre Coeur, fantastic. We got a taxi from the Gare du Nord when we arrived and it cost 11 Euros but we took the RER B from Luxembourg Gardens on the way back as the stop is only a five minute walk away from the hotel. We will definitely return to this hotel when we next visit Paris, we found it very welcoming and got a great deal by booking direct on their website. It is in a fantastic location, we could easily walk to lots of attractions, the metro/RER was close by and we also used the batobus on the River Seine which is a great service and stops at lots of major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Views of the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: Rosiesydney
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very small rooms but very clean. Breakfast was great and the view out of our window was spectacular. The location of the hotel was the best part, close to so many restaurants, i never wanted to stray far far dinner. Great value for money and i would definitely recommend it or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return...”
Reviews.Author: MichellesTravels
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a three night stay at the Hotel des Grande Hommes and had a fantastic time. At check in I was upgraded to a room with a fabulous view of the Pantheon! The room itself was beautifully decorated, comfortable, clean and warm (December in Paris is freezing). It was also spotlessly clean. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. The hotel breakfast, although a little pricey, was very good quality with a great range (the chocolate croissants are fantastic). It was very easy to fill up and not be hungry again until well after lunch. I had a great stay at the Hotel des Grande Hommes and would definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find.!!!”
Reviews.Author: rph213
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Friendly staff. Trip Advisor recommendation was perfect. Would recommend this hotel to everybody for business, leisure or a romantic break and look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: scalpha
Reviews.Content: Charming, nice hotel with a fantastic view in a great area. Lovely (but not very large) rooms, friendly staff, perfect location. I am thinking to make it "my" hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityGirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grands Hommes for 3 nights in November and truly enjoyed our stay. Roman checked us in when we arrived. He was very welcoming, which was such a treat after the long red-eye trip from New York. Our room was very cute and very french, even though it was on the small side. We had a nice view of the Pantheon and the city. The location of the hotel was great for walking to various neighborhoods in Paris, given its central location. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jadePhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: For our recent trip to Paris, we were extremely pleased with our experience at Hotel Des Grandes Hommes. From reservation to check-out, our experience with the front desk was easy, efficient, and pleasant. They were helpful with making and confirming reservations, and also with recommendations for local restaurants, bakeries, and useful french phrases. We took the RER B from CDG airport, walked just a few short blocks to the hotel, and found a small but elegant lobby (with plenty of seating). We were told that our room wouldn't be ready until 2pm. We anticipated this, so we used the spotless bathroom in the lobby to freshen up, stored our luggage in the lobby, and explored the city until around dinner time. We were upgraded to a Pantheon view-room (still standard room, though) and were impressed with the quality and cleanliness of the room (which had all of the basics- safe, tv, minibar, etc). And of course, there was the wonderful view of the Pantheon. Yes, the room was small, but there was enough room for all of our luggage. My only complaint about the room is that there wasn't enough light. It was fine for getting around, but it was almost impossible to read in bed unless you were right next to the little lights at near the headboard. Some additional ambient light would have been very useful. The bathrooms, however, were sparkling clean (and very bright, I might add). As someone who is pretty OCD-ish about things like that, I couldn't have been happier. The first night seemed very cold, until we realized that the thermostat was set to about 50 degrees F (we fixed that quickly). We took advantage of the free Wi-Fi in the rooms to confirm locations, restaurant hours, etc. We stored our daily goods from the markets in the small mini-fridge. I cannot comment on the breakfast, as it was not included in our package (we reserved a non-breakfast package off the website for a great deal), but there are plenty of boulangeries and cafes within a stone's throw of the hotel. Our favorite restaurant was very close to the hotel- Les Papilles on r. Gay-Lussac (reservations required)- a small restaurant with only one option for dinner, a daily changing 4 course menu for 31 euros. Our meal was sublime. I also recommend Marche Biologique on Sunday mornings (on Blvd Raspail near r. Sevres) for lots of eating goodies. Location was great- we walked as far as the Tuileries gardens/Louvre, but used the subway for when we were pressed for time or for when our legs were tired (to the Eiffel Tower- although on a nice day, this is also walkable [discosure- we are in our low 30s]). All in all, we had very high hopes for this hotel, based on the numerous positive reviews on this website, and it exceeded our expectations. For our next trip to Paris, we will definitely try and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: easyrider007
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here, and had a wonderful time. The hotel overlooks the Pantheon, so is easy to find - about five minutes walk from Luxembourg RER station - 3 stops and 10 minutes from Gare du Nord. We had booked a superior room, which overlooked the square, and were upgraded to a delux room on the top floor (60). This was a small suite, with 4 french(!) windows onto a balcony whch had a view of Montmatre. It was beautifully furnished, with a proper bathroom. A downside was it was very cold during our stay, and the bathroom was colder than one would have liked. A curtain on this window would have helped. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast room in the basement was very characterful, and the breakfast perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and refined!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller613
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel des Grands Hommes for our last night in Paris, and enjoyed the hotel. Everything is well-appointed and very clean. Our room had a wonderful view of the Pantheon, though it was pretty small. Front desk staff were very welcoming and friendly, which was appreciated. Location is a short walk from RER-B line (the one to Charles de Gaulle), which was nice. We would definitely consider returning and would recommend it. They are doing everything right!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at the Hotel des Grandes Hommes”
Reviews.Author: Jodipepperpike
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel des Grands Hommes and were very pleased with the overall service, cleanliness and hospitality. The hotel staff was extremely welcoming and anxious to please. The hotel has an excellent location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: vmags
Reviews.Content: Nice and quiet small hotel in a very convenient and elegant part of Paris. Rooms and hall are very nice and cute. Only not positive remark is the breakfast, not in line with the quality of the other hotel features. I was expecting something more in terms of quality and variety of food. MV

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel and extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vaneegh
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grands Hommes is a small hotel (about 30 rooms) at the Place du Pantheon. Walking distance from Jardin du Luxembourg, Notre Dame, etc. The staff is very friendly and speaks -if you like- fluently English. The rooms are clean and spacious (of course, remember that you are in Paris). The bathroom is not very 'grand', but sufficient. Breakfast can be served on the room without additional charge. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “lives up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: matthew.cronin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay and can echo the positive reviews - the hotel is definitely a gem and lives up to the descriptions here. We paid more than the price listed on this tripadvisor page and as a result it is was the most I've paid for a hotel of this class, but considering the cost of hotels in Paris it wasn't unreasonable. As others have commented, the rooms are spotlessly clean and the staff are very nice and helpful.
