But the best part is the location - we were able to walk everywhere - as a result we were hardly ever in the hotel. It's incredibly easy to get to/from the airports on the RER - we came in from ORY (flew OpenSkies from NYC, a great airline!) and it took less than 30 minutes. I'll definitely call the HGH first the next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo for the Grands Hommes !”
Reviews.Author: WendsPaisley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a couple of days at the Grands Hommes and it was truly lovely. If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Paris which is in a great location, beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean with friendly and professional staff, then you really can't go wrong here. Thanks to TGH for making our 3rd visit to this wonderful city so fabulous !!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique”
Reviews.Author: shimmykim
Reviews.Content: The hotel was charming and the service was exceptional. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was right next to the Pantheon and Paris University. So it might not be the best location for a first time visitor to Paris since it not actually that central, but if it is your second visit, you get to see another lovely side of Paris. It is lovely walk through the Luxemberg Gardens nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!!!”
Reviews.Author: pucas15
Reviews.Content: We just have just arrived back from Paris yesterday and I wanted to immediately write a review about the Hotel des Grandes Hommes! The hotel's location is perfect, it is within walking distance of most of the major museums and tourist sights! Also it is just three blocks away from a Metro/RER station. The hotel is beautifully located directly across the street from the Pantheon and is surrounded by a safe area with great local restaurants. Most importantly the staff is amazing, in the months prior to my stay, they made all of my reservations for restaurants, set up my shuttle to and from the airport, and set up and recommended excellent tours. In particular, Romain, was an great help. They are friendly, knowledgeable and professional. In addition, they make you feel at home. The hotel is spotless clean and the breakfast in the morning was just perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Paris! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its good rating”
Reviews.Author: JS9962
Reviews.Content: We’ve been at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for a weekend recently and enjoyed it from beginning to the end. Location is, as many others have pointed out, excellent. Right at the Pantheon, a short walk from the RER Louxembourg station (make sure you don’t get off the station at the exit “Rue de l’Abbé de l’Epée”, it might be a bit confusing). The Staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was very good and served in the small cellar (cozy). The standard room was small but absolutely sufficient and nicely decorated; very nice bathroom, well equipped. There was also a balcony to the rear. Because the Sorbonne is nearby, there are many students around at that time of the year which makes the area very lively, also at night. Noise was no problem, though you could hear from the distance some people having a good time. The HGH is a definitive recommendation and a place to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: trekking4fun
Reviews.Content: Wow - per all reviewers, the location is fantastic with a view of the impressive Pantheon. We were upgraded to a superior room with a view and while I can't comment on comparisons for other Paris hotels, we were very comfortable (2 big pieces of luggage) with a good size bathroom and shower. Even though the Pantheon square sometimes was busy with traffic, the room was insulated well enough where we hardly noticed any noise, so we slept very well. The wireless internet connection in our room came in very handy. We were greeted by a very friendly receptionist (merci beaucoup Farrah - you are wonderful) who spoke good English and helped us with directions around Paris. All the people who worked at the hotel around the clock were friendly and courteous and our room was nicely cleaned and sheets changed every day. We did try their breakfast the first morning and there was a great selection of fruit, cheeses, croissants, jellies, and some cured meats. Coffee was great, though I dont think you will find bad coffee anywhere in Paris! Some observations on the neighbourhood: Plenty of cafes selling great sandwiches to go (handy for a quick lunch), a BNP Paribas with ATMs, & pharmacy all on Rue Soufflot. There are also small supermarkets in the area where we bought fruit & juice for our on-the-go exploration of Paris. We ate a couple of times at the Comptoir restaurant and the food was decent - good portions for the price (watchout, the salads are humungous and will easily feed two). We were dissappointed with the crepes at Crepes A-Go-Go which were way too sweet for our taste for breakfast. Having the Luxembourg RER station located at a convenient walking distance was a plus and that's how we travelled to/from CDG as well as to/from Versailles. Of course, don't miss a visit to the Pantheon; the tour to the upper levels of the Pantheon is well worth it. And close by, Rue Mouffetard is also a fun street to explore. There was also a small church on a street north of the Pantheon square that was holding classical music concerts which we discovered by accident - it was a delightful treat. Not to be missed sights like Notre Dame, Saint Chapelle and the Seine are all within comfortable, enjoyable walking distance. Paris is an awesome city to explore and we ran into very friendly, nice Parisians. This was our first trip and definitely wont be the last and yes, we would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: symphonysid
Reviews.Content: we had a long weekend at the hotel des grands hommes to celebrate our wedding anniversary. the hotel is in a wonderful location, surrounded by a wide variety of bars and restaurants. the staff were always polite and willing to help. don't bother with the hotel breakfast - there's plenty of choice outside the front door! rooms are small but very well presented - ours was overlooking the pantheon and beautifully decorated. the seine is in walking distance, as are many of the main attractions - we got lucky with the weather and actually walked from the sacre coeur back to the hotel on a sunny sunday afternoon (via the louvre). access is easy from the airport - just a short walk from the RER, which is 45 minutes from CDG. all in all, i wouldn't hesitate to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlasGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Just returned after staying for 3 nights at the Hotel Des Grands Homme. Hotel is excellent, clean, nicely decorated and staff are very helpful. Location is great 10 mins walk from Notre Dame and loads of cafes, bistros and restaurants a short walk from the hotel. Rooms were bigger than we expected (deluxe for wife and I, superior for our daughters), bathroom in deluxe rooms is good size and views of Pantheon were spectacular. Overall very impressed and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: CSN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights at the start of a french holiday and taking the opportunity to visit friends in Paris. I had originally booked it as it was near where the friends lived, although they moved the weekend before I got there! However the location is quiet, parisien, just the right level of touristy, a stones throw from the lovelt luxembourg gardens and on the direct metro line from gare du nord for the eurostar. The picture 'room' by aj1809 is identical to my room, and all the pictures were very indicative of the hotel overall. The staff were helpful and understood my rusty french. The lift is slow particularly when the cleaners use it in the morning but the stairs down are fine not massive. The room was clean, the TV had a small mixture of channels including BBC world. I can't remember if I specifically booked a bath but there was and it was good to rest my aching feet. I would definetly stay here again except for the fact that my mantra is try somewhere different but I think I will struggle for the price. I may try to look at the other hotels in the rive gauche hotel group

Reviews.Title: “Good option!”
Reviews.Author: juanjogari
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there for 1 night. The room was small but very nice and comfortable. It was very clean and tidy and so was the bathroom, which was of a decent size as well. The only problem we had was that upon arrival, our room was not ready, even though we arrived at 2pm and the check in time was scheduled at 1pm. Maybe the fact that we are young gave the lady in the reception reason to believe she could make us wait forever. She kept chatting with another lady but didn't look keen in sorting our room out. However, a guy came to the reception about 10min afterwards and he organized our room within 5min of us asking him. Other than that, the location is pretty good. Walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: ld99
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this hotel. Very traditional parisien style and staff extremely helpful (had reserved a table for dinner for us at a local restautant before we'd even arrived !). Room beautifully decorated, clean and well equiped, and location ideal, looking directly onto the Pantheon. We were able to walk to most attractions (Lourve, Musee D'Orsee, Notre Dame). Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for accomodation with some real Paris style !

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could afford to go back.”
Reviews.Author: 2Babyboomes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes almost 2 years ago now, and investigated the possibility of returning when we visit Paris again next year, however, the prices have gone up quite a lot and given the Aussie dollar against the Euro, it's now out of our price range. However, when we stayed there, we were thrilled with the hotel. The room (standard double) was minute, but as it was so beautifully decorated, the size didn't bother us at all. The bathroom was fabulous. Breakfast was included in the price and it was simple but delicious although it was served in a room so small that one could easily feel claustrophobic. Location was great, rooms were very clean and it was pretty quiet at night. Fabulous hotel. If the Aussie dollar ever improves, we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Marincsak
Reviews.Content: An exceptionally lovely place to stay in Paris. Helpful, kind staff, clean, charming rooms at a superb location. We stayed for 4 nights, it was a great experience for the whole lenght of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaBrussels
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay in the Hotel des Grands Hommes (2 nights), but it was enough to know that finally we have found in Paris a good, clean, quiet hotel, situated in an ideal location. The area itself is not so quiet during the day, but the at night time it is. Arriving to Paris from Brussels by train, it is very easy to take the RER line to Luxembourg station, the closest one to the hotel. We felt privileged to have a room with a view to the Pantheon. The staff were friendly and attended to all our requests for assistance. The area is full of small brasseries and it was very pleasant to walk to the Jardins de Luxembourg. We will definitely return and have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: aj1809
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a very good location, staff very friendly and helpful. Had feared the worst re room size after reading reviews of other Paris hotels, but these were fine. Beautifully decorated with roomy and spotlessly clean bathrooms. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: Barolata
Reviews.Content: terrific location, great room, friendly staff and a terrific view. Well worth taking the superior rate to look over the Pantheon. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Daelius
Reviews.Content: Although It was my first and just one night stay in the hotel, I discovered this small gem during a previous visit to the city. The situation is pretty (in front of the Pantheon), the hotel is very nice, the service was wonderful. The only problem -but this is a problem with mostly all the Paris hotels - is that the rooms are small, very small. I'm sure, when I'll come back to Paris I will come back to the Hotel des Grands Hommes.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel des Grands Hommes delivers”
Reviews.Author: happy2bealive
Reviews.Content: What else can we say about the excellent little boutique Hotel des Grand Hommes that hasn't been said already by other reviewers? It really is a gem in a fabulous location - in the heart of the Latin Quarter, close enough to many great cafes, restaurants, parks and sights, yet quiet in the evenings in a super-safe location. We had first-class service from the moment we checked-in with Roman at the front desk. We had booked a Superior room with a view and originally they had assigned us a room on the first floor. Roman knew we wanted a great view and he arranged for us Room 41 on the fourth floor, overlooking the Pantheon. We loved our room - it was comfortable, clean, larger than most other Paris hotel rooms in this category and full of Parisian charm. The view from our picture windows was amazing! The bathroom was very clean and had a large tub (not the mini ones we've had in other Paris hotels). Pros - The hotel lift fits 2 adults and 2 large bags easily. We had a peek at the Standard rooms and strongly suggest you spend a bit more and get at least a Superior room. The extra space and view makes a world of difference! The staff are wonderful. Thanks Roman especially, for making us feel so welcome and all your wonderful suggestions for restaurants, sights and even booking the airport shuttle for us. We loved the many great restaurants within walking distance from our hotel. We strongly recommend L'Atlas at 12 Blvd St-Germain for fine Moroccan food, our perennial favorite Le Bar A Huitres at 33 Rue St-Jacques for the most amazing Fruits de la Mer and Miramar at 17 Rue St-Jacques for roast duck and noodles. We really enjoyed seeing Paris from the Batobus and Bus 24 which took us past many of the Paris must-sees on a rainy day. Cons - Nothing! We look forward to returning to Hotel des Grands Hommes soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place”
Reviews.Author: Doomster
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel just beside the Pantheon. Very central and walking distance to numerous bars, restaurants and metro stations. Welcoming, helpful staff and very comfortable. Rooms are a tad small, but ok. Would definitely recommend and wouldn't hesitate staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Emer78England
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its price, location and the reviews we read on trip advisor and we weren't disappointed. Our room was lovely and a good size, and the hotel staff were always friendly and helpful. We were just a couple of minutes walk from Notre Dame and there were plenty of lovely restaurants close by. However, it was about a 40/50 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe, so pack you walking shoes. We didn't mind the walk, as we had lovely weather and you could always take a trip along the Siene to get there. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sincere, welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: squivs
Reviews.Content: From the moment of booking I found the staff extremely helpful - offering advice on the best way to reach the hotel. On arrival the staff were friendly and eager to help. The rooms were very well appointed in a distinct French style, we had to take two rooms as we are a family of 5. The view from one of the rooms was the majestic Pantheon - lovely to sit on the balcony of an evening enjoying a glass of red wine. Location is perfect - a short walk to Notre Dame and 5 mins to the metro station. I certainly intend to return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “review hotel des grands hommes”
Reviews.Author: lassiLondon
Reviews.Content: staff nice and welcoming. We got the room at the top floor, with a wonderful view of the pantheon. I would not recommend breakfast though. Also, shower could be definitely improved. Overall a good stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des GH is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: lululd624
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of it! The location is great, with a birds eye view of the Pantheon right outside our window (you could practically touch it). There are plenty of cafe's and shops nearby for a quick bite to eat after a long day of sightseeing. If you want to venture out , St. Germaine de Pres is also within walking distance, with even more cafe's and great shopping. The hotel's service was impeccable- especially the woman who worked the day shift during our stay (unfortunately, we can't recall her name). She helped us with numerous touristy questions and she was always very friendly and easy to talk with. The rest of the staff was also extremely helpful and friendly (which wasn't our experience with other hotels in France). The room decor was beautiful and well maintained. Although a bit small (which isn't a surprise), the room was very comfortable (with a true queen bed, not two beds put together which is normal by most European standards). And again, the view of the Pantheon....fantastic! We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. As someone who uses Trip Advisor for hotel feedback, I'm happy to say that the previous visitor's comments were right in line with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: sbedard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with my in-laws and had a great time. The hotel staff was very nice and considerate, and had great recommendations for dinners. So helpful with booking taxis, getting us to bus stops and the metro. Would highly recommend staying here. The location seemed great to me as well. This was my first stay in Paris, but we were only a few blocks from Notre Dame, the Metro and Luxembourg Park. Quiet area too. The room was a bit small (as I was warned) but very clean, and nicely decorated. The air conditioning worked well too!!! Just a side note: I was told people in Paris could be very rude to travelers (specifically Americans) and I found that to be COMPLETELY untrue. I've never met nicer people in a city!

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: Stradwick
Reviews.Content: This is a delighftul boutique hotel in a terrific location. My stay was for 3 nights in August. I found that I was able to walk to almost all of the places I wanted to visit, and barely used the metro pass that I had bought at all. The RER connection to the airport from the Luxembourg station makes for a straightforward transfer. The room was compact in size but with the stylish decor and the benefit of a high ceiling with its exposed beams the overall effect was elegant, and the bathroom was generously proportioned. Everything seemed spotless and well-maintained, and the staff possess the hallmark of a well-run hotel by taking pride in their work and appearing genuinely interested in providing an enhanced level of service. The price:value ratio exceeded my expectations, having booked through the hotel's website. My room was at the rear of the hotel and was very quiet at night. I only took the breakfast buffet one morning; I felt that it was fair value for the range and quality of what was being offered; for those prepared to wander further afield there's a fantastic organic bakery at the northern end of the Rue Monge which is 'vaut le detour'. This was the first time that I had stayed on the Left Bank, and the Grands Hommes has changed my mind completely about where I should stay in the future; I look forward to staying there again the next time that I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: pragueelvis
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grands Hommes is a superb small hotel very centrally located next to the Pantheon. For a 3 star hotel the facilities are great and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. All also spoke excellent english too. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: avaSolihull
Reviews.Content: After spending an eternity on the internet finding a suitable hotel with rooms having an extra bed for our 5 year old son we ended up staying at the Hotel Grands Hommes. What an absolute delight! We booked through the hotel`s website and saved a fortune. The full price should have been 999 euros for a triple room for 3 nights but we ended up paying 550 euros. We stayed in Room 22 (good size for a triple room in Paris) overlooking the Pantheon - wow what a view! We loved everything about this hotel including the staff, cleanliness, location and top quality interior design and decor. Everywhere was beautifully furnished (more like 4 star) and the beds were very comfortable. The location is fantastic with lots of cafes and restaurants all around. It is easy to arrive by train from CDG Airport and just around the corner from Luxembourg Metro - great location for all the major sights. We felt the breakfast was a little steep for our 5 year old at 12 euros so used the two nearest cafes on Rue du Pantheon - great crepes. This hotel was lovely to return to at the end of tiring days sightseeing - a real haven of tranquility. We will certainly be returning to the hotel when we next visit Paris. It would be difficult to find such a great hotel with so much charm in such a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JonathanS7
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Paris was fantastic and the hospitality we enjoyed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes made the weekend even better. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was spotless and clean, the food was delicious and to cap it all we had an excellent view of the Pantheon. I highly recommend a stay at this hotel. And thank all the staff for an excellent stay..

Reviews.Title: “J'aime hotel des Grands Hommes!”
Reviews.Author: dakf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel des Grands Hommes for two trips to Paris in the past couple of years. It was great both times. It's excellently located, very well appointed, and the staff is fantastic. I also stayed at their sister hotels, Hotel Ferrandi and Hotel Sorbonne, both these stays were also great experiences. Although Hotel Sorbonne was not as well appointed (perhaps they haven't finished renovating to the 5th floor, because all looked great except the room - which was fine, just not as lovely as at HdGH or HF), it too was still an above average stay I'd happily repeat anytime. thanks for all the very pleasant stays- David Flory

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hunkerdown
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charmingly cozy with a very friendly, helpful staff. The location is great, just steps away from the Latin Quarter and the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. We loved the plentiful, scrumptious buffet breakfast which we were thrilled to have included in the room rate. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel to our travelling friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MacCamLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Hotel des Grands Hommes to anyone looking for a hotel which is reasonable, exquisitely furnished and decorated, close to sites and subways, quiet, clean with very friendly attentive staff. Truly the best hotel we stayed in on our two week tour of London, Scotland and Paris. A gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: DorsetFoodandWine
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a great location. Watch out for Paris in August, many of the good restaurants close for their summer holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: TEDAsker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel des Grands Hommes for five nights, and had a wonderful stay. The staff was nice and helpful, the location was great, and the hotel was both charming and good standard; clean and with air-conditioning. We would recommend this hotel to all travellers! Couple, 27, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Great People, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VespaManRome
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Tripadvisor and was extremely happy with it. Booking through the website was simple and communication was prompt, courteous and clear. I was pleased with the price quoted. My daughter and I stayed here for a couple of days during our trip to Paris. The first thing that strikes you is the location - right next door to the Pantheon, in the heart of the Latin Quarter and within walking distance from Notre Dame. Upon entering the hotel, the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness of the quaint and intimate hotel lobby was truly welcoming. Free wifi connection was an excellent benefit and everything in the room was just great. Our room overlooked the square around the Pantheon which is quiet throughout the day and night. We didn't use their breakfast facilities because there are so many pretty street cafes which demanded our attention. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a welcoming, reasonably priced, intimate hotel in the heart of Paris. We'll certainly stay another time.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to imagine a better hotel in Paris for the money!”
Reviews.Author: happinanci
Reviews.Content: I spent months deciding on the best hotel for my honeymoon and first visit to Paris. I reserved other rooms, but still wasn't satisfied and kept looking, until I found Hotel des Grands Hommes. This hotel is everything I was looking for! It is located in the 5th Arrondisement, Latin Quarter, directly adjacent to the Pantheon. When you look down the street, you can see the Eiffel Tower in the distance. It is across from Luxembourg Gardens, which are a lovely place for a picnic. The RER stop from the airport is (Line B) is right there, so we didn' t need a cab. It's walking distance from the trendy Place St. Michael which is full of restraunts that are open late, and close to Notre Dame. This hotel is also in the low to moderate price range I was seeking, but without giving up the charm and comforts. I was worried a hotel like this didn't exist in Paris, but I finally found it and highly recommend it. The service was great. Our French is terrible, but everyone at the front desk spoke excellent English and was very friendly. They upgraded our room to a superior free of charge because it was our honeymoon. That was a great suprise! They also ordered our cab for transport to Orly airport to leave, since the RER doesn't go directly there, just to CDG. The room was so lovely and charming, just like in the pictures! It had an amazing view of the Pantheon through a big view window. The walls were covered in lovely wall paper and the high ceiling had exposed beams and crown moulding. The bed had drapery on the wall behind it, beautiful bedding, and was very comfortable with lots of pillows. Everything looked new and was spotlessly clean. The large bathroom had a bidet and towel warmer, and a fancy enclosed shower. The a/c worked great, and I didn't hear anyone in neighboring rooms once. The breakfast was fine, but I recommend eating in one of the many local cafes or the craperie on that street. It's also fun to visit the nearby outdoor market Moufetard and take a picnic to Luxembourg. The breakfast room, like all the common areas in this hotel was nice. The only drawbacks to this hotel, and pretty much any hotel in Europe, was that the elevator was small and slow (but at least they had one). It also is a bit of a walk to the nearest metro stop, but it still only takes 10-15 minutes and we didn't mind at all, especially for the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ssk_traveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on this hotel twice, once on a business trip and now I took my family there on vacation. The hotel is in a superb location for experiencing Paris. We chose the standard rooms, which are small but still comfortable. Everything is nice and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeP52
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Paris and our first stay at this hotel. Everything was perfect. Great location, beautiful room with wonderful bath/shower. The front desk staff were wonderful to us. Our room included breakfast and we loved it both mornings of our stay. Easy to get around Paris from this hotel - close to Metro and you can walk to many of the most popular attractions. We highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here on any future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “J'aime beaucoup l"Hotel des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: HSTeacherBostonMA
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great - a short walk down the street to the Metro, Blvd St.Michel, Luxembourg Gardens. My room, although small, was beautifully appointed and fit my needs very well. I would definitely return for another stay, and would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for Left Bank / Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: IamFromCanadaEH
Reviews.Content: Super clean and great sized room. We had room#1 and it was large with a bathtub and shower. Toilet separate. TV reception was poor but we never reported it nor cared. Was fine for a quick CNN fix. Air conditioner was perfect and if anything...got too cold when maxed out. We had to adjust it. Perfect. They were rewaxing the floors, painting the exterior and doing many little maintenance jobs. The property is very well cared for. Location was great and very near RER and Metro. Everyone was very helpful and pleasant and there was always someone around to answer questions. There are many places to get great food in the AM so we didnt try the breakfast and they never even mentioned it to us. Lastly for North American visitors. The hotel uses European sockets and they do not have converters to US. You can use a US razor in the bathroom ok, but if you want to plug in your laptop and take advantage of the great and free high speed connection supplied by the hotel, you will need to supply your own converter. Eventually I found one in a store after a small search but I recommend you bring your own from home! Internet tip: during my stay the hotel next door which they also own, had a much quicker wireless connection so try both. This hotel CARES and deserves to be well rated.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable in the best part of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: dfilmalt
Reviews.Content: We have just returrned from a European trip and the stay in Paris was the highlight made more memorable by the excellence of the Hotel Grand Hommes which exceeded our expectations in all respects apart from room size. The Hotel is ideally positioned in the Latin Quarter opposite teh Pantheon and within walking distance of countless restaurants, the River and public transport. The rooms while small are spotlessly clean, with top quality bedding and classy decor and the staff exceptionally courteous and accommodating. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to fellow travellers and will look no further for accommodation in Paris when I visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decoration and service”
Reviews.Author: JKB50
Reviews.Content: Service was superb, from making the reservation all throughout our stay. Such a nice place in the middle of Paris. The rooms are usual Paris size, but decorated with the nicest furniture. A very classy place to stay right next to the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: L-B_Christchurch
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right by the Pantheon and about a 10-15 minute walk to Notre Dame. Extremely welcoming on arrival and very helpful to our requests for directions, offering a map of Paris to help with our bearings. The room was small but as I expected this it wasn't a surprise. It was still big enough for the two of us along with our luggage. Very clean and tidy with a good sized bathroom , and with a tv and minibar and comfy bed. Felt safe in the area and there were a number of cafes in the area. I really enjoyed my stay here and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others and would definitely stay here again. Hotel staff were very friendly and always willing to help or just say hello when we saw them.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Globetrav
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable hotel. We were with our two teenage kids and booked two rooms and the hotel accomodated all our requests. The rooms were next to each other and they had one of the two rooms ready for us at 9 o'clock in the morning (as requested) even though the check in time is much later. Since we flew in from New York and arrived early in the morning, this allowed us to quickly wash up, freshen up and hit Paris by 10am that morning. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful - helped us with all our questions and arranged for taxicabs as well. One negative : breakfast should be included in the room price. Breakfast is an extra 12 euros per person which means 48 euros for our family of four. Somehow paying $80 just for breakfast did not make any sense to us.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Hotel des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: Wethered
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming small hotel over the Bastille Day weekend. We liked the atmosphere from the moment we entered the stylish lobby and got the slow but quiet lift up to the 5th floor. We recommend front facing rooms on the top two floors for the view over the square to the Pantheon and because the square can be quite noisy. Our room was a small double, beautifully decorated and with a very comfortable canopied bed. It was well equipped with large room safe and fridge, and a moderately sized ensuite. The attitude of the staff was excellent throughout although service in the basement dining room at breakfast was a little sloppy at times. Occasionally we found the lift mysteriously stalled on the service floor for long periods. Not cheap but well situated, clean and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice french style hotel”
Reviews.Author: HiTK
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed in this hotel many times in the past while traveling for business purposses - her office in Paris was close to the hotel. She always wanted to go there with me. The hotel is good for both turists and business trvaellers - it is in a quiet location but close to city attractions. The only disadvantage was a poor air conditioning system.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Grand Hommes”
Reviews.Author: chickpeatoronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly situated 5 minute walk from the luxembourg train station. We took the train from Charles de Gaulle to the hotel with no problems at all. The hotel reception was very friendly when we arrived. Our room was beautifully appointed, a very comfortable bed and large size bathroom. The room itself was on the smaller side, but still very comfortable and clean. The hotel is right beside the pantheon and was about a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, 5 mins to the Luxemborg Gardens. You can also see a view of the Eiffel tower around the corner from the hotel. There are many cafes and restaurants close by. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel des Grand Hommes and would definetely return and recommend. We had a good rate by booking via the hotel website, although you should be aware of the cancellation policy.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying repeat stay at the HGH”
Reviews.Author: PeteCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the third time at this hotel. Its location is ideal, being close to the Luxembourg Gardens, rue Mouffetard (lots of restaurants there), and St Germain's shops and neighborhood. Management upgraded my room to a more spacious Superior room, with a large desk and a double-bed, a rarity in many Parisian hotels in the Latin Quarter. I had no major complaints, and the staff were very courteous and helpful. My only minor comment is that the bathtub/shower really needs full curtains. I never understood why the French prefer the half-pane of glass in the bathtub/shower, and not full curtains to prevent shower water from splashing onto the floor. Also, the windows should be replaced with better sound-insulated glass, especially in rooms facing the Pantheon (like mine). Many 3-star hotels in Switzerland and elsewhere have sound-proofed windows installed. Other than these minor quibbles, I would certainly come back here fo my vacations in Paris. The rates I paid were quite reasonable for this type of room (100-190 Euros in July). Why spend more for such a fine room in a perfect location?

Reviews.Title: “full of character”
Reviews.Author: anon73
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in July of 2004 (a very belated review). This hotel is only a 3-star, and harbor no illusions - it's a 3-star hotel. However, in terms of style and character, it has more than some of the better ranked properties we've stayed in Paris. We had the mansarde room with view of the Pantheon. The room, while small, is tastefully decorated and has a large balcony with a great view. This is really what made our stay special. Had we stayed in a different room, our review would not have been as positive, as the public and private areas of the hotel are quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: akp31
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great location, small but charming rooms, staff very helpful, perfect for a sightseeing visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ajhdmb
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, so we were flying sort of blind (thanks Tripadvisor). I had been through briefly on business, so I knew we wanted to stay in the Latin quarter, but that was all. Hotel des Grands Hommes seemed to fit the bill, so we went for it. We couldn't have enjoyed it more. The hotel was top notch and the staff was extremely helpful - and spoke English. Fara (or maybe Sara?) at the front desk helped us with directions each day and arranged a dinner cruise. She even gave us free RER tickets to the airport when we mentioned we were going to take the train (apparently left there by another guest). Our room on the 5th floor (542) had no balcony, but we were lucky to have a large bathroom. The size and shape of the rooms vary quite a bit. I was a little nervous about the European air conditioning, but we had the control and it got cold if you wanted it to. We didn't eat in the hotel - too many nice places close by. Our routine included crepes for breakfast at the Crepe-a-go-go around the corner. The hotel is on the plaza of the Pantheon at the top of the hill overlooking the latin quarter. The Pantheon is worth a visit, but probably won't be the highlight of your trip. The location is perfect - a short stroll to Blvd. St. Gremain and all the latin quarter action, but removed enough that you're not kept up by the noise. There's so much to do in Paris, you won't spend much time in the hotel, but I couldn't ask for a better base to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: c3ath
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this intimate, friendly hotel. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and booked a deluxe room with a view of the Pantheon. Our room was superb, with a terrace and lots of space to relax. We loved the view across the rooftops of Paris. We were particuarly impressed with the friendliness of all the staff and with the tremendous standard of housekeeping. We had breakfast in the tiny hotel breakfast room on two occasions and enjoyed the experience but we also found a great cafe on the small street directly behind the hotel which served breakfast coffee and croissants and was definitely a better budget option. The location of the hotel really is great - just a few minutes walk from Notre Dame and the Seine, but away from the bustle. We enjoyed exploring the quieter lanes and squares of the Latin Quarter. There were any number of metro stations within 5-10 minutes walk which allowed us easy access to other parts of the city. Although the Place Du Pantheon is relatively quiet at night we were woken up a few times, especially at the weekend. Rooms overlooking the hotel courtyard are likely to be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler7575
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel des Grands Hommes for a week in late June. The rooms were reasonably sized (for Paris), and in good condition. The style of the decor is from another century, which was not to my taste (though it was well done). The staff were courteous and helpful when responding to a request to change rooms. The second room had a balcony facing into the small interior courtyard, which was very nice. The hotel is in the Place du Pantheon, close to the RER B line (which goes straight to Charles de Gaulle airport), and Luxembourg garden. I would recommend the hotel without reservation to anyone who is looking for a comfortable, tasteful place, but doesn't need a luxury hotel experience (i.e. lots of staff, and overpriced service charges for everything).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: nic281
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is literally next door to the Pantheon! The first day we walked to all of the major sites; second day we were a bit tired so we took the metro that is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The metro is very easy to use, but keep in mind that is stops running around midnight. The room was very clean and a good size, with a comfortable bed that slept two. The bathroom was surprisingly huge! The reception was very helpful and gave us excellent directions and advice. THe hotel is near many cafes and a couple souvenier shops. My friend and I (women in late 20s) felt safe walking around this area at night. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely return myself.

Reviews.Title: “True to their word”
Reviews.Author: nkinsley
Reviews.Content: Grande Hommes was very well placed in Paris. The rooms although small were very clean and well appointed and quiet. The price on the web-site was cheaper to that advertised in the rooms and they remained true to their word. The service was very good. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel! Great location! Terrific staff! Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl041672
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this location and, once again, found it to be perfect for our needs. Booked through the hotel's website which offers various discount specials depending on the time of year you will be visiting. Greatly appreciated the parking garage down the block, as we typically drive into the country (we live in The Netherlands). The rooms are Parision "cozy", however nicely appointed with toile fabric, antique furniture and spacious bathrooms. Great "French' feel and extremely clean! I would recommend to the hotel that a mattress topper or new quality mattresses be considered to make the beds more comfortable. They feel "worn out" and we felt the same on our previous visit. Would make the stay MUCH better, as a good night's sleep is important on holiday. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and were patient with my blossoming French! A terrific recommendation was made for dinner one night, that we probably would not have experienced had we searched on our own (Marie Verte on Pontoise). Love being next to The Pantheon, as well. Be prepared to walk a bit to reach various sites, however walking to The Notre Dame and picking up one of the hop-on-hop-off busses or a cab is definitely doable. We took breakfast in the hotel and found it quite sufficient--terrific table service (the waitress is simply lovely!) and a nice selection of foods to choose from--fresh breads & croissants, cereals, cold cuts and cheese, fruit and yoghurt, juices, coffee and tea and an option to take omelettes, if you desire. Convenient, as well. Although we have not experienced the other properties in this hotel group, we will definitely consider them if we elect to stay in other parts of the city in the future. It is quite evident that the managers and staff are concerned about their guests and how they enjoy their stay. Their commitment to excellent customer service is greatly appreciated. We have found our hotel of choice when we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “First rate”
Reviews.Author: Ferney46
Reviews.Content: Last stayed (in fact next door, at the Pantheon), some five years ago and the same excellent service, decor and attention to detail continue. The location is ideal for getting to everywhere you want to be, and the comfortable rooms a real pleasure to get back to after a long day. Will not hesitate to stay again and will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Grandes Hommes”
Reviews.Author: Freya08
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel in a great location. Rooms were small but well appointed. Staff extremely helpful. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in style!”
Reviews.Author: zvoomb
Reviews.Content: Absolutely marvelous experience. Very witty decoration, lovely old-style sunny bathroom, excellent location. A real delight!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: bjorkkr
Reviews.Content: I realy liked this hotel. It was in good walking distance from many interesting places like Notre Dame and Louvre. Also many resturants. We realy liked the resturants on a lively street near Notre Dame - you´ll find it when you walked from the hotel down Boulevard St. Michel. The hotel is very old and charming. The room was small but nice and clean. The breakfast room was also nice - as the breakfast. The staff was healpfull and nice. The elevator was the smallest I´ve ever seen but I think that the elevators in Paris is all rather small. We loved Paris and when we go back - witch will be - I will surely book at this hotel again. Didn´t cost to much and was worth any penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsSandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location and the room we had was small (Paris usual) but beautiful. Breakfast was not to our liking as we are on a wheat/dairy free diet and there was nothing much we could eat, but if you can eat anything they had plenty to choose from. Staff were very helpful and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, amazing blog”
Reviews.Author: Garnaal
Reviews.Content: I stayed quite a while ago at this hotel at a discount which made it great value for money. Rooms are nicely decorated and bathroom was impeccable. Staff was very friendly and not intrusive. But actually what I like best about this hotel is the way they keep in touch with customers through their own blog: [--] Once a month they produce a beautiful newsletter with tips/reviews/images that you won't find in your usual city guide. I think this has to be the best way to keep you longing to go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrttravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very recently traveled to Paris. Never having been I was a bit nervous about booking "blind" hotel reservations. Thanks to this website and the very honest reviews given, I was able to select this very nice hotel. FYI- if you want a view of the Pantheon from your room, be sure to request. The accommodations were very nice. The decor of the room was beautiful! It was small (that's just Europe) but comfortable. Breakfast is not included in the reservation but, there are so many bistros and shops along the way. Theres' a store two blocks or so behind the hotel. The location was perfect in that the street itself was nice and quiet at night, but you only need to walk a block and you are in a circle full of shops, restaurants and people!! The hotel staff was more than pleasant and very helpful. This hotel would be my first call once after booking plane tickets!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jilt5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grand Hommes to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. It was an ideal location for our needs, as we enjoyed the close proximity to Luxumberg Gardens and the colorful markets of Rue Moufftard. The staff at the hotel were very nice and helpful and offered wonderful suggestions for dining, etc. The rooms are on the small side (like many rooms in large cities), but they are very clean and tidy. Our room was 11 and overlooked the Pantheon. It can get a bit noisy during rush hour traffic and also at night because the students like to hang out in the square well into the morning and due to the design of the 5 surrounding buildings, it echoes. Bring earplugs. Some travel tips for Paris: Bring a light jacket (it was very cool during our stay in the middle of June) Buy a Paris Museum Pass - if you're planning to visit multiple museums and landmarks, this is a deal, but it's worth it in itself because you can override the long queues at most of the museums including the Orsay and Louvre. It's 45 euro for a 4 day pass and was worth every cent. Buy a Metro Pass - purchase a metro pass only for the number of days you need and the zones you know you will travel. Unless you're planning to visit Versailles or use the RER to get to and from the airport, you don't need more than zones 1 - 3 to see all of Paris's landmarks. Do as the Parisiennes and enjoy your meals with time to spare. Learn a few phrases in French, like "je voudrais" - I'd like and please and thank you. The French appreciate the effort, even if you butcher their elegant language.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon at Hotel des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: zoosoup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for our honeymoon in May. We were there for 10 days and we absolutely loved the hotel. We were on the fourth floor and the room was absolutely beautiful. The windows opened up right onto the Pantheon and it was simply an amazing view. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was European sized, but it was plenty big enough for us and the bathroom was quite large. The staff made us feel welcomed and at home. We felt close enough to everything and had no problems getting around. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Woodlands_John
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the room was spacious by Paris standards, but, most importantly, the staff did all they could to make sure our stay was comfortable,

Reviews.Title: “Parisian style at Hotel des Grandes Hommes”
Reviews.Author: Tomas_8
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at des Grandes Hommes over the years, before it was tarted up: which has been done in great style. The rooms are delicious. The service by the front desk staff is friendly and efficient. The Hotel is in an excellent spot (and always has been!) for the tourist unfamiliar with Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive 3* but worth every cent !”
Reviews.Author: WordlyWoman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location and most Paris sights and a great selection of restaurants are within easy walking distance. The proximity to the RER for quick access to and from CDG airport is a real bonus. As bedrooms in 3* Paris hotels tend to be on the small side, we were pleased with the relative spaciousness of our room, which was spotlessly clean. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and readily did internet searches to answer any of our queries. A bit to the upper limit of 3* prices but quality-wise I would regard it as 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulyg123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and it couldn't have been better. The staff were all very helpful. Location was great - very central with view of the Pantheon from our bedroom. The room was pretty small but c'est la vie for a hotel in the middle of Paris. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: hixy
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights in april. hotel was lovely. nice friendly front desk. stayed in room 12 over looking the pantheon. bathroom clean and spacious. sofa area in bedroom and bed large and comfortable. enough storage. down side was at night you could hear traffic noise over the cobbles outside and in the early morning you are woken by the sound of road sweepers!!! but this aside i would stay here again. beautiful decor. didn't have breakfast as we were out and about early. plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. we went to the moulin rouge which was a good experience, went down very well with my husband!!! book before you go. metro excellent way to travel as taxis can be slow and expensive. all in all lovely stay made more special by this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Rooms a little Small (but hey, it's Paris)”
Reviews.Author: tiffandrew
Reviews.Content: The location was great (facing the Pantheon, close to the Metro) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We'll stay again nexy time we're in Paris. The only minor negative is that the rooms are awfully small (huge beds make it even worse). You can pay more and get larger rooms so that may be a good option. All in all we had a great stay and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ReubenWinston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the Hotel des Grands Hommes quite nice and would certainly stay again upon our next trip to Paris. The staff was very helpful and friendly, we didn't experience the food as we were on the move our entire four day stay and the room was comfortable clean. The location is in a great spot especially if you enjoy walking to explore the city, there was so much within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Family in France”
Reviews.Author: MissJaneAustralia
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Paris with husband and 3 children. The stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes was a high light. The rooms reflected the atmosphere of Paris. The view on the Pantheon was to die for. The children loved how they wrapped up their teddies in a blanket. Little extras like chocolates and CD were a treat. It wasn't the cheapest place to stay in Paris but the great location, lovely rooms and view was worth the money. Viva la France!!

Reviews.Title: “April in Paris - The Best One Yet”
Reviews.Author: Tyneside_Travellers
Reviews.Content: We've visited Paris several times over the last few years and have come to love the Latin Quarter area. This was our first stay in Hotel des Grand Hommes and we were very impressed by the quality of service and standard of accommodation; it certainly lived up to all of our expectations (and it is now a hot favourite for a future visit). Our room (number 52) was an absolute delight, with a fantastic view... The hotel itself has a cosmopolitan ambience, and the staff are very accommodating and efficient in their dealings with all who stay there. It is very close to everything that you are likely to need, yet the immediate area has a very quiet and laid back feel to it, especially in the evenings. Whilst the hotel doesn't provide full bar facilities, we were delighted to find a great traditional cafe just around the corner - ideal for combining nightcaps with a bit of people-watching !! We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to other visitors...

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Conceicao
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights in this wonderful hotel with a friend. Everything was just perfect. The superb location, the nice room (bathroom was new and beautiful) with a splendid view of the Pantheon, the kind and very efficient service delighted us during our stay. Definitely, my hotel in Paris. I strongly recomend it even for very exigent travellers. Maria da Conceição Sampaio de Sousa

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: owlhothot
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. I don't remember the young lady's name behind the desk but she helped us out and showed us to our room. We were coming from London and forgot to set our clocks forward and missed breakfast the next morning. she arranged for us to have an extra couple of minutes to eat breakfast downstairs. wonderful staff. and a wonderful and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect holiday in springtime”
Reviews.Author: obereisbaer
Reviews.Content: A very nice little Hotel with friendly staff. The rooms are not so big but this is normal for Paris. Pretty view to the Pantheon. Metro and busses are very close to the hotel. We had a nice stay and we would booking this hotel once more.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel near the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: lalusk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice. The rooms and bathrooms are extremely large for Paris standards. The decor and room furnishings were of equisite taste and in excellent condition. The staff were kind and helpful. Being an American, I'm used to air conditioning and it would have been nice to have it on one hot day (a/c is not provided until the hottest months of the year). The hotel is literally feet from the Pantheon. We found that the best metro stop was the RER stop at Luxembourg (which is to say that the hotel is only a couple blocks from the Luxembourg gardens). That's the only other drawback -- that the metro isn't super close by. But, the area is safe and beautiful. Don't miss out on the Eglise St. Etienne du Mont. It's basically around the corner from the hotel. Check the hotel's website for great rates. And if you haven't stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes before, be sure to put it on your list for your next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: jgmattera
Reviews.Content: We couldn't be more pleased with our stay at the Grande Hommes. The central location, charming room and pleasant staff far exceeded our expectations and we will be happy to stay there again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines' Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Gums_Addict
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a standard room for 4 nights, me and my husband. The hotel is very nice, quite small, our room was particularly small (with a strangely large bathroom!) but perfectly formed. Nice decor, and really felt like you were in Paris which is not often the case if you stop at a chain hotel like Hilton. Breakfast room was nice and the staff were very friendly. The only downside was on the last day they were filming something in reception and we weren't allowed in!! We were running late for the airport so we made nuisances of ourselves so we could get in to get our suitcases. Not a great way to end our stay unfortunately! Good location close to Luxembourg RER and Cardinal-Lemoine metro station. Walking distance to Notre Dame, Louvre etc.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in spring time”
Reviews.Author: TauntonTambo
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Fab loction in a beautiful area. Me and my friends stayed to celebrate our 40th Birthdays and we had a great time. Would recommend this hotel to anybody. It would be nice to have tea and coffee making facilities in the room, especially after all that sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: Carole75
Reviews.Content: The hotel's website annoyed me because the headline rate only applied to the first night, with subsequent nights going up in price. It also had a 'bargain basement' feel about it. In fact, if it were not that our friends had already booked into the hotel, I would have gone elsewhere. Therefore, when we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to find a much more upmarket establishment than the website suggested. The room and ensuite bathroom were both fine and well-appointed. Our only complaint was that, even though the heating was off, it was terribly hot. Our friends found the same in their room. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English. The location is excellent (the Latin Quarter) with good cafes nearby and good transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: Quik9s
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. All the staff was very friendly, anticipated our needs by offering to book restaurant reservations, checking to see if we needed a taxi to the airport a few days ahead of departure, to offering umbrellas to us the day it rained. The place was clean, the bathrooms great by Parisian standards. The Metro stop was close, as was the RER making a return trip to the airport very easy, as well as getting around for sightseeing. My only suggestion is that the hotel staff inform you that you need to put your key card in the slot by the door so you can operate the lighting in the room, it took us a few minutes of consternation before we figured this out on our own. the hotel staff was very kind when we forgot the key card in the slot in the room and retireved it for us with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: MartiniLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading all the great reviews, they were right! Wonderful small hotel, with exceptionally pleasant staff. I felt as though I was staying with family because of them and the general homely feeling of my room. I booked a single room for €97 on Expedia, best rate I could find. It wasn't a large room, but still a small double bed rather than a single. It was remarkably clean, and a lovely bathroom. If the rooms would be slightly larger it would rate 4* I believe. But it's a hotelroom, you're not moving in there permanently. Only minor issue was that my (standard) room was on the internal courtyard. I had to keep my window closed because of the noise of other rooms which all had the windows open. It was unusually warm for May and the airconditioning wasn't able to keep the temperature down. I will definately return, but opt for a more expensive room at the front with views of the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated on the left bank. The staff were helpful and friendly and the room, while small (European small) was well appointed and cozy. It clearly had been upgraded and renovated tastefully in recent years. The only thing a traveler may want to know is that the closest underground is the RER three blocks away (across from the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens). That means taking the RER to another station and transferring to the Metro to reach most places in the city (Chatelet seemed the easiest transfer point). We did not find it to be a problem, but travelers should be aware of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: TXTravel-chick
Reviews.Content: Staying on the left bank was a delight and the Hotel des Grands Hommes is in a fantastic location. Our room overlooked the Pantheon and is a short walk to Notre Dame and the Seine. The neighborhood has a great vibe and lots of restaurants, bars and cafes are close by, yet did not seem at all toursity. The hotel is small and friendly with very efficient and freindly staff. We really loved our stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Grands Hommes is Grand”
Reviews.Author: Papa11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple planned to be in Paris for 2 nights - April 18 and 19 - before joining a tour. Our friends had not been to Paris before and we decided to try and find a smaller Parisian hotel in an area where we hadn't spent much time in previous visits. After reading the reviews of the Hotel des Grands Hommes, we decided to book there and were completely delighted. Our rooms were standard doubles and the decor was very pretty. I didn't think the room overly small by European standards. It was very quiet. The staff was uniformly pleasant and helpful. The location immediately across the street from the Pantheon and just up the block from the Sorbonne, with relatively short walks to both Notre Dame, the Marais, and the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens, was very good. There are many good eating places nearby. That's one reason we didn't take the breakfasts at the hotel, so I cant offer anything about the quality of the breakfasts there. Try it, you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: spg4y
Reviews.Content: We were only in Paris for one night, April 21, and wanted a hotel that would allow us to see as much of Paris in the two partial days we were there. The Grands Hommes fit the bill. As two architects, the view to the Pantheon out the window could not have been more perfect. The staff was a pleasure to deal with, and the location could not have been more centralized. I think we logged 12 miles of walking the loop of Notre Dame (right down the street), the Pont Neuf, Louvre, Tuillerie Jardin, Eiffel Tower, and Luxembourg Gardens. Cafes and good dining abounds in this area. Access from the airport was crazy easy via the RER and transport to the Gare Monteparnasse was simple via the bus system (which is INCREDIBLY clean). Five stars in my book for the Grands Hommes. I will definitely stay with them again on my next (perhaps longer) jaunt to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit but not our last”
Reviews.Author: UnicornUDIC
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit - September 2005 and now in April 2008 The décor in the hotel public rooms and bedrooms is gorgeous with fabric-clad walls; exquisite furniture, little touches of luxury and care throughout and the bathrooms are very well appointed. The location could not be better, both for the major sites of Paris – use the BatoBus it’s fabulous – and even within steps of the hotel you can find shops for wine, cheese, pastries, charceuterie, deli, books, clothing, you name it, and restaurants and bars of every type you could want and of course, the Pantheon right there. I have read the previous comments. First: the elevator (lift), yes it is slow, but it’s there and it works and after all it is an old building and a small hotel. The slowness is worst during the morning; we are guessing because of check in and outs and/or people going up and down to breakfast. Also housekeeping probably increase the delays at that time as they push the housekeeping trolley on and off at each floor but hey, the rooms are perfectly clean and the staff have to get there to do that don’t they? With regard to the issue of having no irons in the rooms, yes it would be nice to have but the space is tight. I gave it some thought and think that it could work if they incorporated a fold down small size ironing board on the inside back of a closet or bathroom door and supplied those tiny travel irons. It would be all that most people need and for anything more there is a laundry service. Other than that… as a person who is on the short side my daily exercise reaching up and even jumping a bit to get a towel off the rack was somewhat amusing but stretching is good for the body anyway isn’t it? The staff are wonderful. Charming, patient, courteous and attentive and nothing appears to be too much trouble, they are always ready to assist each and every guest. We would both just like to add that the fact that the staff are also incredibly good looking – we are talking ‘they are probably models in their spare time off’ type handsome/beautiful looks here - had no impact on our opinion. ;o) Can’t wait to go back again, we miss it already.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: harriettg
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay - excellent location; room was beautiful and comfortable with very nice amenities; staff and service were great. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel with grand view”
Reviews.Author: KLTSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for four nights in April 2008, in a Superior room with view. Was a fantastic experience. The staff were incredibly helpful and all seemed to speak English. We were prepared for a small room having read what Paris hotel rooms are like, but were pleasantly surprised. The bathroom was small, but the bedroom had enough room to fit a 2-seater lounge as well as the bed plus enough room for two suitcases on the floor. The view of the Pantheon was magnificent. Hotel is in a great location with plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby. Will definitely be staying in this hotel when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel- Spectaular Staff”
Reviews.Author: johnny_winter
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in April. Room 61, a superior double room on top floor with a terrace. Room was small even by European standards, but plenty of storage space so luggage was out of the way. Room looked out on the Pantheon and was very quiet after 10p. Also wonderful view of Effiel Tower from in front of the Pantheon. Real shower and tub in nice sized bathroom. A 4-5 min walk on wide smooth streets from the Luxembourg RER station which only has 2 flights of 7 stairs, so only have to carry your luggage up 14 stairs). Direct train from/to CDG. Parc Luxembourg has a good jogging trail around perimeter. Roman (sp?) and all the reception staff were fabulous- very friendly and helpful. All spoke English and helped me make or cancel several dinner reservations. I cannot say enough about how great the staff was. They even got two plates and two wine glasses for us so we could eat a picnic lunch on our terrace. (food stuff, wine, cheeses and fruits we bought at the open air maket on Rue Moffeltard) Breakfast room is in a wonderful cellar, but breakfast itself was just okay. Easy and short "downhill" walk to main St Germain area and to Notre Dame. Plus several Velib city bike rental racks nearby all of which were primarily empty, a major concern when you want return a Velib bike. Lots of good restaurants in the area. Dont miss all the little eating places on Rue Pot Au Fer. Our favorite place was Les Papilles, a small wine store at 30 Rue Gay-Lussac (3-5 min walk) with 10 or so tables. No ordering here, you eat what they cook that day-- a 4 course meal with sittings at 730p and 930pm. You pick your wine from their retail store selection and pay store price plus 7 euros corkage-- so you get great wine at decent price. Call to make sure you like what they are serving that day. The famous Balzar brassiere is a 5min walk. We booked on hotel website and got tremendous rate around 60% discount, but had to prepay with no cancellation.

Reviews.Title: “For the price I paid this hotel cannot be beat!”
Reviews.Author: jenchap
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week with my husband and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The rooms were well appointed and the beds were very comfortable. We got an excellent rate by booking directly through the hotels website. The room was small but I only need enough space to sleep so that did not bother me. Staff were very friendly and helpful. They all spoke English well and were very approachable. The breakfast was good-- they had a decent assortment of cereals, breads, meat, cheese and fruit. A nice healthy way to start the day and it filled me up for a long time! If you are a coffee drinker it was worth spending the money to eat at the hotel. They offered filtered coffee with breakfast which was great, and there is a Starbucks a few blocks away. The hotel is in a great location and you can walk to many ,many sights. There are lots of restaurants and shopping nearby, but the street the hotel is on is quiet in the evening. (And sadly, we were right across the street from the Pantheon and never, ever made it inside-- too many things to see and do!) I would definitely book at this hotel again. and would recommend it to anyone travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: afcok
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our 3 night stay because of the excellent reviews by other Trip Advisor travellers and it fully met our expectations. Centrally yet quietly located, very friendly, comfortable, safe, clean and good value. Grands Hommes more than meets all the essentials which is not the case for most Paris hotels we've previously visited. Our second floor double room overlooking a small courtyard was in very good decorative condition and the style was indeed decorative! Pale blue wallpaper with ornate floral motif, cerise and white timbered ceiling contrasting with the blue/gold patterned carpet. It was 'cosy, ie. small. The furniture was somewhat crammed in and their was limited space for hanging clothes had we been staying longer. The bed was firm and comfortable. We had a minibar, safe deposit box and small tv with CNN and BBC World. The bathroom also appeared to have been very recently refurbished. It passes the acid test - we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Margot01
Reviews.Content: Had a quick trip to Paris with my teenage son, to see the sights. The hotel is in a great and safe location and we had a superb view of the Pantheon from our room, but thankfully, the room was quiet overnight. The room and bathroom were very well appointed, though there really isn't a place to sit and relax; but we weren't in Paris to sit in a hotel room so it didn't matter. The hotel was clean and all the staff were friendly and helpful. I look forward to another opportunity to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific folks at the Grands Hommes!”
Reviews.Author: Scrubs69
Reviews.Content: We stayed eight nights and had a wonderful time despite horrific weather - it snowed on us! We were prepared for "cool" weather but not snow. Our room was on the fifth floor and looked directly across the square to the Pantheon - wonderful location - we walked everywhere in "old Paris" and received great directions and restaurant suggestions from the very helpful staff. Breakfast was terrific each day with marvelous folks serving - very cheerful and happy each morning. Would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accomodations, with exceptional Staff.”
Reviews.Author: AudioAero
Reviews.Content: The staff was uniformly cordial, hospitable, helpful, and seemingly always smiling! Each one of the six or seven staff members I encountered during my one-week stay was fluent in English and willingly accommodated my inept French speaking skills. I can't say enough about how well-mannered and accommodating the folks at the Reception Desk were. I booked a standard double room to ensure having sufficient space and was pleasantly surprised, on checking in, to hear that my room had been upgraded - to what I did not determine, and did not really care, since the room was far more than adequate for one person. The bathroom was very special, both in decor and in spaciousness, with, for instance, a separate, lighted nook built into the wall for one's toiletries, alleviating the crunch that occurs on having to place everything on or above the sink. The shower and tub fixtures were excellent and versatile in delivering plenty of hot water with no plumbing problems. The lavatory was in a separate room. The built-in closets and shelves were very spacious and were configured much as one would find them at home. Opposite the bed was a sliding glass door giving access to a small balcony with a table and two chairs, which, in warmer, drier weather would have been wonderful either for breakfast in the room, or an after-dinner glass of wine, reading, or simply relaxing after a long day in town. The room decor was truly exceptional and beautifully integrated, from wallpaper, to carpet, to painted doors and molding. There were two bed-side tables, a small desk and chair, and a separate table for a small TV set. One could hardly ask for more. Above all, the room was QUIET - acoustic isolation was superb, and that is a quality I seek and value above all. Interestingly, and quite strangely, the hallway was always lightly scented with the pleasant fragrance of, yes, chocolate! I was unable to detect that aroma in my room or any other area of the Hotel, however. The breakfast area, when full of patrons, did feel somewhat crowded, but le petit dejeuner itself was quite enjoyable, with a reasonable variety of items. Nevertheless, I've had more varied and substantial breakfast fare at other hotels in the same price range as the Grands Hommes. The location of the Grands Hommes was excellent in regard to proximity to certain key Paris sights, such as the Pantheon (directly across the street), Musee de Cluny (highly recommended), Luxembourg Gardens, etc. Granted, the nearest Metro station was several blocks away, but that was offset set by the nearby RER B station down Rue Soufflot, at the Luxembourg Gardens. Most importantly, the location opposite the Pantheon meant that the Hotel was never exposed to the maddening, insane traffic noise that one must suffer at so many other hotels in Paris. The location contributed to a much more quiet experience overall, and especially in the evening, when a good night's sleep is absolutely essential. Finally, on leaving, the taxi ride to Charles de Gaulle airport Terminal 2A took only 30-35 minutes. Bottom Line: book it, pay more for a larger room, and you'll always look back at the wise decision you made to stay at the Grands Hommes.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Winkie77
Reviews.Content: Really nice room. It was small but it didn't feel like your average hotel room, because the furniture and decoration was classy and unusual. Good location, a couple of minutes' walk from the Metro and a stroll from many of Paris's best-known sights. Terrific view of the Pantheon from our room. Facilities fine. Only sour note: I phoned reception the day before we arrived to order flowers for my girlfriend's birthday. They were really helpful and the roses duly arrived outside our room in the morning. However, the effect was rather ruined as we were checking out, when the morning receptionist told me, loudly and in front of my girlfriend, that there was a problem with the bill as "we still owed 36 Euros for the flowers". er, thanks. And the lift is recommended only to the intrepid.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a Paris break”
Reviews.Author: family74
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms Ultra helpful reception staff Great location Spotless clean. We stayed for a few nights with 2 young children and found it ideal. We had two rooms, one at the front, small with lovely views and one at the back , dark but very quiet at night. Toilets were modern and very clean. We walked to Lux gardens, Isle St Louis, jardin du plants etc so location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris so far!”
Reviews.Author: imds
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to Paris, and we have generally stayed on the Rive Gauche. The Grands Hommes is a small place, but we found the atmosphere welcoming and the whole building spotlessly clean. All the front desk staff were keen to help us, and the service was way above its 3 star rating. There's no bar, but the hotel makes drinks available to the room all day and night. We had a front room with a great view over the Place de Panthéon, and a good en-suite bathroom. All in all, a great place to stay that doesn't leave you feeling ripped off! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: Rat1
