Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to go to Paris without kids and absolutely loved L'Hotel des Grands Hommes. The service was great and the beautiful room we were given had a balcony overlooking the Pantheon. It was just a gorgeous view! We could see as far as Montmartre on a clear day. The closest Metro is the RER Luxembourg station, a couple of blocks down and the neighborhood was great. The breakfast service was very good, the lady in charge (I think her name is Marina) is lovely. OK, so the rooms are a bit small, but who cares? This was Paris! Highly recommendable - Quite a charming place!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible hotel near Pantheon!!!”
Reviews.Author: bizhaoqi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel des Grands Hommes for 3 days / 2 nights in March for our 1st wedding anniversary. I had painstakingly researched about 25 hotels via TripAdvisor, Lonely Planet, tourist guides, etc., and finally chose Hotel des Grands Hommes, particularly based on its location, price, romantic feel, and quality rooms. We were not disappointed at all, and instead were totally stunned at its romantic, convenient, and safe location next to the Pantheon in the Latin Quarter; its wonderful staff (2 women and 1 man that we met, all of whom were warm and friendly and spoke excellent English); clean, spacious rooms (neither of us had been to Paris but had heard how small the rooms would be--I believe ours was a complimentary upgrade and was very comfortable); and just a great overall ambiance and quality feel. Our room had a great view of the Pantheon, we had plenty of good hot water, the hotel architecture was beautiful, and as mentioned, the hotel staff was friendly and surprised us by upgrading our room to a larger size overlooking the Pantheon. Our only inconvenience, which is minor considering how very much we loved the hotel, and which seems to be common in Paris, is that the shower was mostly unusable at normal heights due to only a small glass enclosure between the tub and sink that didn't totally seal, leaving water running onto the drainless floor unless we took a bath or brought the shower head down almost to the rim of the tub. However, this probably wouldn't even be a problem without our water-wasting American habit of standing underneath the shower instead of "bathing" by holding the shower head in hand! All things considered, we had a wonderful, smooth, convenient, romantic time, and went away thinking the hotel should actually be called the Hotel Par Excellence!

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bon!”
Reviews.Author: schmoopybunny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Des Grandes Hommes from March 5th to March 10th. This was our first trip to Paris, and we were beyond pleased with the hotel. We spent a lot of time trying to decide which hotel we were to stay at; checking numerous web-sites, and reviews. First, no matter which web-site you check, the reviews of the hotel are consistent. All web-sites rate the hotel highly, and most all who stay are very pleased. Second, the hotel was spotless, and upon entering for the first time, the lobby is beautiful and classy. The photos of the hotel on the websites are accurate. The hotel looked as good as the pictures they posted for advertisement. The staff is extreemly helpful and courteous. They attended to our needs immediately, and spoke English, in my opinion, very well. I did speak a little bit of French, but they let me off the hook, and always spoke to me in English. We had no trouble communicating with them. As for the size of the room; understand that hotel rooms in Paris are not big at all, compared to American standards. However, I felt the rooms were plenty big. We had a room with a balcony, so it was lovely to sit on the balcony and look at the Panthenon. You have about 2 feet of walking space arount the perimeter of the bed. A large writing desk and chair where the TV sits, with about 2 feet on either side. In our room (#51) we had two nice sizeable closets. One with multiple shelves and a mini fridge where we placed all our folding clothes, another closet, where we put our hanging clothes, and it was also large enough to hold our suitcases. The bathroom was plenty big. Only one sink, but it was large enough for both of us to be getting ready at the same time, and we didn't feel too crowded. Overall, I recommend the hotel highly. You are close to everything in the Latin Quarter, and besides, there is nothing like leaving your hotel , turning the corner, and having the perfect view of the Eiffel Tower to start your day! Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “charme and elegance”
Reviews.Author: RobTelAviv
Reviews.Content: A beautiful period hotel, Kind and friendly service, a midst the heart of paris. everything is near by, and you can feel paris at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for city tour, friendly staff, Very nice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: barmy18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in March 08. The location is perfect for exploring Paris, only a 5 minute walk from the central hub of the city bus tours. We were able to catch three different tours for this point outside the Notre dam Church. The staff at the hotel were freindly, the room was on the small side, but think it was bigger than everage for Paris, nice decor and very quiet. Nice big bath, and the room was well looked after. Would stay here again, no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cafedude
Reviews.Content: Picked this place out for the trip during which I proposed to my girlfriend. They had the best mix of high TripAdvisor rating, cozy size, reasonable price, and fantastic location. Felt as though they were a partner in the planning of my proposal trip, and made an effort to find me a room with a full balcony and wonderful view of the Pantheon. Location in the heart of the Latin quarter is unbeatable. The Sorbonne right nearby and there's a cool student-vibe in the streets at night. Only consideration would be that they obviously don't have the staff of a Hyatt or Hilton so don't always expect things like the front desk picking up the phone immediately at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SuttsDublin
Reviews.Content: You can get a RER train from CDG airport stops at Luxembourg Gardens which is a 5 minute walk way from the hotel. Stade de France is also on the same line which makes the hotel a good location if going to a 6 Nations game. Hotel is also walking distance to Notre Dame. We booked the hotel based on the reviews on the trip advisor and were not disappointed. We asked and got a room with a balcony & view over the pantheon which was excellent. Would stay here again on our next visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel,”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller0828
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes in March of 2008, for 5 nights, we booked two double rooms which were quite small but adequate for our purpose for ourselves and my two teenage sons. The rooms were nice and clean, although they overlooked the interior courtyard which was not very nice. But since we were out most of the day it didn't really matter. We found the staff to be very helpful with suggestions and making any arrangements for taxis or restaurants. The hotel is about a 7 minute walk to the nearest subway station, and there are cafes and restaurants everywhere, including an internet cafe. I would recommend this hotel to any one who wants to stay near the latin quarter which is within reasonable walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: cflemeta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently got back from our Paris vacation. We stayed at this hotel in no small part to the reviews we found on tripadvisor. We had a great time in Paris. Overall the hotel was great. The staff spoke English which was wonderful as our French are extremely limited. We found everyone to be friendly. The check-in and check-out procedure was as expected with no issues. We stayed in room 54. I saw some of the comments from other travelers and they were mostly confirmed in that the room size is small but adequate for our stay and as expected for European standards (our hotel room in our London visit was pretty small as well). Everything was kept clean which is most important for us. There are a few things to note. First of all regarding the location. It's true that the Metro and RER stations are not right at the doorstep like they might be for other hotels however having both the RER and Metro nearby was very convenient since it provided more options. We ended up using the RER to go back and forth to the airport and used it mostly to get out and see the sights (after transferring to Metro stations). I would not recommend airport transfer using the RER for anyone with a lot of luggage that can't be easily transported up and down stairs, or for anyone with kids. Otherwise I personally found it convenient and cheap! A few words of caution. Don't count on using an iron. The only iron in the hotel is at the basement, next to the elevator and besides the restaurant. If you must use it, avoid the mornings when people are going back to forth to breakfast and you are in the middle of it trying to iron your clothes (like I was :)) I would recommend that a portable ironing board and iron be made available to guests on request. A minor nuisance as I only needed to use it once, but still something to watch out for. Next I found out that unlike with most hotels you turn in your key to reception when you leave your room and retrieve it again when you return. That was fine with me although what was strange is that to retrieve your key you just walked up and requested the key for room XX. There was no confirmation that it was your room, you were just handed your key. Theoratically I could have asked a key to whatever room I wanted (assuming that someone was checked in) and could have gotten it. Again, not a big deal, but it struck me as odd and unlikely something that would have happened in a US based hotel. In a similar fashion, when I checked in they didn't request any ID, I just walked up, said my name, and was handed a key. Very different from US based hotels, not better or worse, just different. There was one nuisance and that is a couple of times during my stay I would leave at 9 am, come back at 5 pm and either the room was in the process of being cleaned or in one case it was half done but the person had left in the midst of it. Maybe coincidence but I started hanging the tag that indicates "please clean the room" when I would leave and didn't have that issue anymore. That was only a minor point. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would definately return if and when I come back to Paris. It was a comfortable stay, we liked the location of the hotel and he staff were all courteous and helpful. Oh, and if you do stay at the hotel I recommend going to "Crepes a Go Go" a great little crepe place a couple of blocks away from the hotel. Loved the staff and the crepes were awesome! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: patmyers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a superb location, but is very quiet and away from the rush of Paris traffic. The rooms are on the small side but perfectly comfortable, with excellent bathrooms, and very good room servicing. We booked room only, so are not able to comment on the hotel breakfasts. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and we would be very happy to stay here again, or in the sister Hotel Pantheon, on any future visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great As Always”
Reviews.Author: SamF1971
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and we liked it as much as the first time. It’s a perfect three star hotel, and for us the location can’t be beat. All the major shopping and dining areas, and sights, are in easy walking distance, and it’s no more than five minutes walk from Luxemburg RER station, which brings you directly to Charles De Gaulle airport. Thanks to the hotel’s proximity to the Sorbonne, the nearby bars and restaurants are always buzzing, and the prices are more reasonable than the more obvious “touristy” places. The room we had this time was smaller than before but it had a balcony with a view over the Pantheon to Sacre Couer which was fabulous. Even though it was March, we had a glass of bubbly here every night before heading out for dinner. We will definitely be staying here for our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: boomerEngland
Reviews.Content: A really super hotel in a great area of Paris. We had a superior room on the third floor with an amazing view of The Panthenon. Hotel staff all very helpful and polite. I would certainly stay here again. We got a super deal from the hotels own website This hotel is a great place to stay, I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the noise.”
Reviews.Author: LibbyEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the G.H. A hotel with character, good location, great cafes nearby, five mins. to R.E.R. station, charming room on fifth floor (51), front of hotel. Was a anniversary trip and were made most welcome by all staff . First night had a good sleep - quiet night- Second night little sleep - Pantheon opposite had work being done on it (putting up banners between the pillars using loud hoists). Checked windows were closed. Down to reception to explain problem, could not resolve problem as it was outwith the hotel, which to be fair it was, I was also informed no other guest had complained. This work stopped as 4.42am. Thrid night noted hoists still in place - bought ear-plugs at pharmacy down the road. These were required and worked as the racket started again late at night. A really nice hotel, but best pack some ear-plugs these banners will have to come down sometime! Would have given much higher rating if not for noise.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: GeoCat83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for 2 nights at the end of February 2008. The hotel was easy to get to from Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport by train to the centre of Paris (St. Michel Station), then a 10 minute walk from the station to the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel our room had been upgraded so we had a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the Pantheon. The room was lovely, clean and very comfortable plus the ensuite had a bath (recommended after a long day sight seeing around Paris). Breakfast was not included in the room rate but at 12 euros per person, I would recommend it as there was a really good continental style breakfast with lots of choice and great value. The staff were very friendly and really helpful throughout our stay. The hotel is in a lovely area and really central for many of the sites, which are in walking distance and there are lots of cafes and resturants close by for meals and drinks on an evening. I have already recommended the hotel to a friend and would definately go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: moken
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, Feb 25th to 29th. did not arrive until after midnight but this was no problem. Reception staff were very helpful and friendly throughout our stay and they all spoke good English. we did not have breakfast at the hotel but there are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Hotel very centrally located right beside the Pantheon. Rooms were small but very comfortable and cleaned every day. No complaints about hotel and would definitely stay here again. One word of warning, be careful of pickpockets, especailly young girls aged 11 or 12, on the Paris underground. They are very professional and your purse could be gone from your bag in a matter of seconds!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tantek
Reviews.Content: After reading several wonderful online reviews for the Grands Hommes, I went to their website and booked a standard room for the last month of February. I arrived and was so delighted by the charming room in this elegant little hotel right in the middle of the Latin Quarter. Toile de Jouy lined walls, Empire decorations, lovely, modern bathrooms. The staff was always very pleasant, the rooms were quiet and comfortable and the nearby cafes and restaurants very good. I look forward to recommending this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bill1952
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay at this hotel. I have used Trip Advisor many times but this is the first time that I have felt so strongly that I wanted to write a review. I agree with all the good comments we read on Trip Advisor. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel was very clean and in a great position. It is true, as others have said, that the room was small but it was a lovely room. We paid the extra for a room with a view and it was well worth it. I booked on the hotel website as it seemed to offer the best rate for the room. We will certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expecations”
Reviews.Author: gatopoder
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal for this hotel thru fastbooking.com; instead of paying the 300 euro a night fee, we ended up spending around 100 euros a night. And what can I say...? It felt like a Parisian 300 euro a night hotel! The room was immaculate. The furnishing comfortable and the wallpaper whimsical, even a bit of a surrealistic nod to famous former lodger, Andre Breton (see pic). The bathroom/shower was great. The staff was very nice. We were lucky enough to get a room with a terrace, which was very useful, considering the fact that one of us is a smoker and that the hotel is completely smoke free. The location at first feels as though it is in the touristy shadow of the Pantheon, but very quickly we discovered the lovely back streets of the neighborhood, and from the windows of the down-to-business neighboring cafes we came to enjoy observing the bustle of Parisian law students. All is all, if you can get a good rate, definitely consider this hotel. Clean, Comfortable, Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Paris”
Reviews.Author: kwag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes from February 16-21. We had an excellent time and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were small, but the norm for Paris and Europe in general. The bed was comfortable, the room and bathroom very clean, and we felt very safe at the hotel's location. Speaking of location-the hotel is easy to access via the Metro or the RER Luxemborg stop. It is also in easy walking distance to the Luxemborg Gardens, the Seine, and Notre Dame. I would highly recommend this hotel to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect by the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: AJT-York-England
Reviews.Content: Within 10 minutes' walk of St Germain and the river, and a couple of minutes from the Luxembourg Gardens, this place is excellent if you want a relatively quietly situated 'classy' small hotel with good rooms. As everyone says, the bedrooms are generally quite small in Parisian hotels, and our superior double was fairly tight, but very well furnished, with a big comfy bed and decent bathroom. It also had two pairs of French windows onto a little balcony with a tiny table and chairs, and a fantastic outlook directly onto the Pantheon. If you want a balcony you need to get a fifth floor room or higher. It's strictly B&B with no bar or dining room, but you probably wouldn't want those anyway as you're in a great part of the city with excellent bars and bistrots. Breakfast is 12 Euro and is taken in a nice looking room in the basement, but we didn't have it, preferring to go out to other places. All in all, thoroughly recommended and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFoolsNyc
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our stay of 4 nights at this hotel. The location can't be beat - a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame (and a 30 second walk to the Pantheon). The hotel was very clean. The room was small, but we are looking for a nice clean place to sleep, we aren't living in the hotel room when we travel. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very helpful - they gave us recommendations for dinner, and also helped print out our boarding passes for our return trip. There was alot of construction at the hotel next door (when I believe is the same ownership), but we only heard this when we stopped back to our room quickly during the afternoon. The TV did not work the first day, but we reported this to the front desk, and it was fine after that. We would definitely return to the Hotel des Grands Hommes on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We love the HGM”
Reviews.Author: japman2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Grands Hommes was everything that we had hoped for. It was very easy to find the hotel as it is only 5 minutes walk from Luxembourg RER station which is a very easy and convenient train ride from CDG airport. The hotel is also a very easy walk from Cardinal Lemoine metro station. Our superior room on the 5th floor was small but absolutely spotless and very comfortable and had a great balcony with view of the Pantheon. It was also completely silent at night and we slept beautifully. We felt that we were the only guests as during our entire four night stay we hardly saw or heard another soul. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel so cant comment on that. We preferred to grab a bite at one of the many nearby cafes or boulangeries. We liked the area that the hotel is in with a great studenty atmosphere but those looking to find night time action may find it a little on the quiet side. The staff were very pleasant although we did not really need to speak to them as we were completely satisfied with every aspect of our stay. When we return to Paris we would certainly consider staying here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “First class experience”
Reviews.Author: Jim028
Reviews.Content: A wonderful experience. Brilliantly located to allow us to soak in the ambiance of Paris. Small room but with a sense of elegance. Very helpful staff especially Matthieu the manager. Would thoroughly recommend the experience. Jim Belfast

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: flteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the upper floor with a direct view of the Pantheon. The service was excellent. The rooms are smaller than other boutique sytle hotels that we have stayed in previous years. A quiet, intimate hotel that was just a few blocks from the heart of the Latin Quarter. Even though we are very close to a metro stop we were also a few steps from a bus stop . This time in Paris we bused everywhere. Much more pleasant than a metro. Having lived in Paris for a year as a student (a number of years ago) we felt that we were geting a true "French " experience. The staff however, does speak English. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Chokopie
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing little hotel. Trip Advisor's ranking for this hotel did not let us down. Excellent service and the room was clean and beautiful. The room was smallish, but the furniture was arranged in such a way that it maximized storage space. We had a view of the Pantheon out of our window. Incredible! We will come back here again! Thank you Hotel des Grands Hommes for making our trip to Paris perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Hotel Des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: LondonWilton
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend at H des G H after seeing loads of great recommendations on Trip Advisor. The hotel was pretty perfect for what we wanted: great location, within walking distance to the Marais area plus right next to Luxembourg Gardens and some fab cafes and a few bars. The room itself was pretty small but not unbearably so and we loved the Parisian decor. For a friendly, small hotel, in a great location for a similarly good price it's definately worth a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: JoeSydney
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Grands Hommes provides a truely excellent experience. The rooms are of a high standard although small - typical of Paris - the bathroom was well appointed and relatively large. The location is only a short walk from the heart of the Latin Quarter - the place to be in Paris. The staff were also helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were hoping for”
Reviews.Author: Oz_To_Europe
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel des Grandes Hommes (we were to spend 7 originally) and were slightly disappointed with the hotel. Although it was at a great location the room left a fair bit to be desired. The reception on the TV was very poor and although we were promised that it would be fixed immediately it was the same for our whole stay. Also the lighting in the room ws very poor and the internet access was virtually non-existent; that is to say that it did have connection but the service was too slow to do anything. I tried to use the internet at all times including 2am just in case it was a heavy user problem but even then it was completely useless. In the end we felt that we wanted to leave as the hotel wasn't worth the price we were paying. It was a disappointing end to an 8 week holiday as we had hoped to have a bit of luxury at the end of our time on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Awarded the three C's”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerlover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights - late December 2007, our first visit to Paris. Booking through the hotel's internet site is recommended for the best rate. From our experience we have awarded the Hotel des Grands Hommes the 3 C's for being charming, clean and comfortable, all that a traveller needs. Our arrival at the hotel was just before 9:00 am after a long flight from Brisbane, our first impression of the exterior and lobby was excellent. We were aware before arrival that we would not have access to our room until 2pm so were able to leave our luggage and return early in the afternoon to check in. As other reviews have stated the rooms are small (even the superior ones) but adequate with storage provided in a built in wardrobe with a safe. The bathroom was a good size with a large vanity and shower/bath tub, and of course all the necessary equipment - hairdryer, magnifying mirror and plenty of towels. Our room and the public areas of the Hotel were spotless, and the cleaning staff would always greet us if we met in the hallways. We opted to have breakfast in the Hotel as a croissant and coffee at a nearby cafe was 8 Euros each, and McDonalds is out of the question. A plentiful supply of coffee, fresh pastries, muesli, yoghurt, fruit, toast and toppings for 12 Euros was good value, and served by welcoming staff in a charming room. The front desk staff were proficient, but lacked warmth - no friendly conversation, at times we felt as though we were a nuisance, as they were busy and seemed unapproachable, so we only had contact with them on check in and departure. We did ask at check in - for recommendations for organised tours of Paris, but I felt that I knew more about what was available than the Clerk. Improvements - the reception staff could be more informative regarding Paris and the facilities within the hotel and understanding guests needs. For example on departure we discovered that there were powder rooms in the lobby, these would have been wonderful to use when we arrived at 9:00 am directly from 30 hours of travel. It would have been bliss to groom ourselves and redress to add a warmer layer of clothing. Overall we had a pleasant stay, with the hotel meeting our expectations for the price paid but not surpassing them.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and silent!”
Reviews.Author: woman29
Reviews.Content: Cosy little hotel with stylish and clean rooms, slept very well thanks to comfortable bed and silence. Bathroom clean and modern. Breakfast was sufficient with diffrent alternatives, breakfast room could be moved from the cellar to the ground floor. Great location next to the Panthéon, nearest metro station if you head for the West of Paris requires some walking.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: reiziger_1963
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service and situated in a very nice part of paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely star in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: AlisonCass
Reviews.Content: We have recently had a lovely long weekend and throughly enjoyed our stay at this charming hotel. Whilst not top end luxury this hotel was a haven after a long day walking. It was very clean and tidy compared to some other 3* hotels we saw around the city and the staff were very accomodating. The rooms were of a decent size with good view out of the window ! It is located just nicely outside the latin quarter -(2min walk away) and a also a 2 min walk away from the nearest metro station (luxembourg). The breakfast in the hotel is pricey at 12 euros each but would recommending eating instead in one of the cafes nearby or even McDonalds at end of road at it is very cheap at 2euro for coffee and an egg mcmuffin ! Unless you have recently won the lottery try not to cross into the 6th arrondisement - the other side of the bvld de St- Micheal - as the cost of breakfast increases to almost 10 euros for the same thing as you would pay for 6 in the 5th arrondisement ! We found a fabulous little brassiere on the rue de ecoles (near the bvld de St Michael) called Brasserie Balzar. The waiters are very traditionally dressed as is the deco - the food was gorgeous and very reasonably priced. Much more traditional than your fondues etc that you will get on the tourist run !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: PetalSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week over Christmas 2007 and found it to be charming, very clean and very well run. It is centrally located in the Latin Quarter so we were able to walk to many museums and attractions during our stay. As you would expect in Paris, our room was very very small but beautifully furnished and extremely clean. The central heating worked very well. On our first night there was no hot water in the bathroom, although this was fixed the next day. Our room was at the back of the hotel facing the courtyard and was very quiet. The staff were very helpful with organising trips outside the city and with general directions. Valerie in particular was great! We used the laundry service which the hotel offers but found this to be exorbitantly priced. We would have avoided using this service if we had known the laundry bill would be so high. Overall we enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: Spockie
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes from 17 Dec - 20 Dec 2007. We booked a Christmas special on the hotel website for a family room, which was two separate rooms - one double and one twin. The double room was very small with spacious bathroom (we kept both our suitcases in the bathroom as there was no room in our bedroom). The twin room was larger with smaller bathroom. Both rooms were decorated beautifully and very clean. No views from our rooms but this didn't worry us as we were out all day anyway. We arrived at the hotel before 12 noon but our rooms were not ready as checkin time is 1.00pm. That was ok so we went off sightseeing for a few hours and arrived back at the hotel round 3.30pm to find our rooms were still not ready! We waited for over 30-40 minutes and finally one room was ready. The other room was ready another 30 minutes or so after that. This was a little inconvenient as we had arrived in Paris after a long flight from Hong Kong and were pretty tired and expected that the rooms would have been well and truly ready on our return from sightseeing. However, this is the only criticism we have of our stay at the Hotel des Grand Hommes - everything else was wonderful! The hotel is in a great location opposite the Pantheon, surrounded by lots of good cafes, restaurants, shops, internet cafes and about 7 minutes walk to Luxembourg Metro station. Beautiful back streets filled with interesting shops, pattiseries, cheese shops etc. The staff were good with Matthew on the front desk particularly helpful. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was served in the cellar of the hotel, which was a delightful little area! We had no problems getting seating for the 4 of us even though the room only has 7 or 8 tables. Breakfast was more than adequate with a selection of cereals, juices, fresh fruit, cheeses, sliced meats, fresh bread and croissants, coffee, tea etc. All in all, we had a lovely time at the Hotel des Grands Hommes and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “xclent location”
Reviews.Author: DOTH58
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in this lovely hotel. The hotel is in an very good location. Handy for bus (tour ) & the metro. We found the staff VERY helpfull & friendly . Hotel is surrounded by eating places both cheap & pricey. Try the back alley ones also !! The rooms were small but with very big windows. I would return again to Hotel but use standard taxi service as we paid double for our pick up from CDG airport. I look forward to going back to paris . Doth. Adelaide South Australia. 2008

Reviews.Title: “Very Cozy, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PhineusFogg
Reviews.Content: This visit to Paris was our fifth in four years. January is wonderful in Paris with fewer crowds and moderate weather. We stayed at the HGH for 8 nights in an interior room with no view. We chose the hotel for its location (5eme) and we liked our previous stay in the sister hotel, Hotel du Pantheon, next store. The price was wonderful. It included a simple breakfast of coffee, breads, jams and meat and cheese for about 120 euros/night. The rooms are beautifully furnished and the bathrooms are large with a nice tub. There is no coffee or tea maker in the room. The service was very polite and responsive. The first room that we were given was small even by Paris standards. They allowed us to move to a larger room the next day. The only detractions were that the room's wifi was painfully slow. You could take a shower and get dressed before a page might load. You might prefer to visit the internet cafe across the street. I would also note that they are making improvements to the hotel next store and the hardest working guy in France starts hammering at about 8AM. I would highly recommend this hotel for the moderately price conscious traveler who loves the 5eme. Great, affordable restaurants are everywhere and you are still close to the Seine and St Germain-de-Pres.

Reviews.Title: “Great with a couple little snags”
Reviews.Author: cbarri
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews on this hotel, my wife and I booked 4 nights for our recent first anniversary stay. All in all, the hotel was good, not great. I think it's easy to build up your expectations based on others' opinions/reviews, so maybe mine were a little inflated. I booked directly with the hotel, which was far and away the best price. Based on the price I paid, I was happy. If I had paid their standard rates, I would not have been. The two main problems I had were actually with the service, not the room. -We flew in via redeye. When I booked the hotel, I requested an early check-in, and was told they could not guarantee it, but would make every effort to have a room available as early as possible. When we arrived at 10, we were told to come back at 2. When we came back at 2, we were told the room had not been cleaned, but that they would 'do it right now', and we were told to sit and wait in the lobby, which we did - for 40 minutes, with no apology. This, in my opinion, is not acceptable. -The second and more serious problem was our returning to our room one afternoon to find the door propped open, and no housekeeper in sight. Apparently they had just left the door wide open after cleaning. My wife went down to the desk, and was told 'relax, our hotel is very safe'. While this may be true, it was a truly shocking response. Again, no understanding or apology. And I think it goes without saying that despite how safe or unsafe the hotel may be, there is at a minimum a privacy and respect issue, whereby a hotel should not leave a guest's room open. This seems like hotelier 101 to me, and really just basic common sense. Aside from those two issues, the staff was very courteous, and helpful. Some other general thoughts on the room (we booked a 'superior'): -As should be expected, the room was very small. If you have more than one large suitcase, you will have trouble storing it. We had to put ours under the desk to be able to walk around the bed. -The shower is insane, as is typical in europe. No curtain/door, so expect the floor to have half an inch of water when you're done. Get extra towels for the floor, or bring your flippers. -The bed was comfortable - we slept great here. No noise problems. - Location is great. Beautiful views of the Pantheon. Lots of restaurants nearby, but less of the elegant little places like you find around Saint Germain. Definitely feels more catered to students, as it should given the location. All in all, I would say the issues we had were probably unusual, and that as long as you know what you're getting, this hotel is very good. Just go into it expecting that it feels like the low end of the 3-star rating, and don't expect service to be excellent - just good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Grands Hommes is very good”
Reviews.Author: enzdek
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel very conveniently located to some of the main Paris sights. Great reasonably priced restaurants nearby. Hotel staff very friendly and the room decorated to a high standard. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: honeymoon_in_Paris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated in the Latin Quarter with a terrific view of the Pantheon. We actaully got the room we requested back in July. The staff was kind and curtious, made us feel truly welcome. Our stay in Paris was a dream come true.

Reviews.Title: “HotelD Fantastique!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Simone_8
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend just returned from a seven day stay in the hotel and have only amazing things to say about the hotel. Our little room on the sixth floor overlooking the little courtyard, was one of the most romantic places I have ever stayed at. The staff were exceptionally friendly, the service outstanding, the room gorgeous and clean, the location magnificent (literally in front of the Pantheon, steps away from the lively Rue de Mouffetard market, blocks from the Seine, and the Notre Dame cathedral, as well as the Luxemburg gardens). When you stepped out of the hotel and stood in front of the Pantheon you could see the Eiffel tower hovering in the distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of staying in Paris!!! THANKS Hotels des Grands Hommes for making us fall in love with Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: mariaheit30
Reviews.Content: The Grands Hommes was warm and inviting with beautiful french decor...the rooms were beyond charming as was the staff! Great location across from the Pantheon - with our room having front-side balcony overlooking the majestic Pantheon. Down the street from Luxemburg Jardin and easily walkable to Seine and St. Germain..... a little spot of perfection...loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SarahandMike
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a quiet location with stunning views of the Pantheon out of the bedroom window. The hotel had easy access to the nearby RER. In fact we found it very easy to get to all the main sights on foot, with the Ile de la Cite just 15-20 mins walk away. The room was a bit on the small size but was nicely decorated and perfectly adequate. The hotel staff were friendly, courteous and helpful and recommended a superb atmospheric restaurant called Le Coupe-Chou on the nearby rue de Lanneau which is one of the best that we have been to! Would suggest checking out the hotel's website as they offer the best prices and special offers we found - we booked early and got breakfast included in the low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by interior decorating”
Reviews.Author: danoise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a romantic trip to Paris for a few days without children and wanted to stay at a central romantic not too expensive hotel. We found Hotel des Grands Hommes at the yellow pages and booked via the hotel's website at a very favorable price. The hotel lived up to our expectations. It was very centrally situated in the heart of the Latin Quarter and with a very impressive decorating. The rooms were not very big, but for at few days it was all we needed. However, I still do not understand why hotels in most countries still use blankets instead of duvets. All in all recommendable for a romantic weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTony
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel ... the location is unbeatable, directly opposite the Pantheon and an easy walk to all the benefits of the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame etc. The people were very helpful and pleasant and the service excellent. The front desk staff were happy to book taxis or even make dinner reservations for local restaurants. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated, charming and clean, as is the entire hotel. Our room was on the front of the hotel and looked out on the Pantheon. It gave a very special feel to our stay. We didn't notice any problem from street noise ... it was very quiet through the night. There is no ironing facilities available in the rooms and you have to do your ironing on a fold-out ironing board in front of the lift doors outside the small downstairs breakfast room, so its not ideal. However, we would definitely stay there again. If you accept that it is a small hotel, no dining etc. other than breakfast and think in those terms, it is a wonderful place to stay. Tony Hill

Reviews.Title: “C'est fanastique!”
Reviews.Author: Imogen85
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel was really fantastic. From entering the hotel to leaving 4 days later, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The reception staff were extremely helpful, spoke fantastic English and humoured us through our poor French (rather than making us feel silly for trying!) and assisted us with everything we needed. The room was lovely- tres Parisienne, and they had put us in a room with a balcony in front of the Pantheon and two sets of double doors opening out. They had also left some sweets and a note in our room wishing us a happy anniversary. The street is a bit noisy through the night but it shouldn't bother you too much if you're used to city living. The location was great. Close to many restaurants (some of which were really good) and shops, nice and quiet at night and we felt very safe. A few really good underground cocktail bars as well. Very quick walk to the Seine (ten minutes?) and good metro access (closest station was Luxembourg where you can take line B direct to and from CDG airport in about 30 min). Only negatives were that the pillows were quite uncomfortable, and we found the room really hot. It appeared that the heating was underfloor as there were no radiators, and the dial on the wall said it was on the lowest. So it was quite hot throughout the evening when trying to sleep. We didn't try the breakfast, as 12 euros is quite a lot, but the breakfast room was really lovely. We would definately stay there again- that balcony would be lovely in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Parisienne hotel”
Reviews.Author: jujuking
Reviews.Content: We had requested a room with a view and we got the room facing the Pantheon. The room is modest in size but it's not too small. It was a really charming room, with the toile wall paper, trimmed doors, and decor. The room for 2 had a nice size bed, I think it was 2 doubles stuck together. It wasn't the plush kind of bed we are used to in the US but I was exhausted from sightseeing all day and jet lagged that I slept like a stone anyway. Also, what's great about the room is that you don't hear any noise from the other rooms. The hotel is in walking distance to everything. The metro isn't too far and there are tons of great restaurants near by. I read about Le petit pantoise on one of the reviews so I tried it. The food was amazing! I see why people rave about French food. We also tried ATELIER MAITRE ALBERT, which is near by. It seemed very trendy and it was always packed. It has modern, minimalistic decor. It was as if I was dining in a restaurant in NYC. The food was good but I think Le Petit Pantoise was much better. I love the Latin Quarter, where the hotel is located. On Saturdays, there is a farmer's market with just about everything. Also, there is a great boulangerie - Eric Kayser. The Parisiennes were lining up out to the sidewalk for the fresh baugettes and pastries. It's a great place to start the day with a nice croissant and coffee. Becaues it's a college town, there are tons of ethnic eateries too. The only small complaint about the hotel is that it's up on the hill. After a full day of walking around and sightseeing, the hill that was waiting for us at the end of the day was dreadful. However, when you stand front of the Pantheon, you can see the Eiffel tower straight down the avenue and it's quite a view. Overall a great stay and a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff & Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: bruceleelaroche
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The location is quiet and close the to Metro. The staff is very, very nice and the woman is in charge of breakfast is just GREAT! We had a nice room..but remember, the rooms in Paris are very small. We plan to stay here again in June. Anyone who needs more info, just give a holler at bruceleelaroche@aol.com.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: canarican
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from the Pantheon and about 5 blocks from the Luxembourg Metro station (which is on a direct line to CDG Airport). No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ppower3
Reviews.Content: Simply a great place to stay in the heart of the Latin Quarter! Couldn't fault the hotel in any way - the staff were super !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth97
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Paris for my birthday weekend and really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. It's in a great location with beautiful views of the Pantheon and less than 10mins walk from the Notre Dame. (Its also very easy to get to if you are travelling from London by Eurostar) The hotels decor is very unique keeping in style with its location. Our room was very clean and extremely quiet at night. We found the staff friendly and they also spoke excellent English. There are plenty of bars/cafes/restaurants in the locality. For a really nice meal reasonably priced there is a lovely French restaurant closeby called "Le Vin Qui Danse". We booked through the Hotels own website which worked out cheaper than some of the general websites as they offer some good direct online reductions. Overall we had a fantastic time in Paris and would definetly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alpaca11
Reviews.Content: This was a really lovely hotel in a great location. All the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good. Only tiny negative point was that the room was on the ground floor. But the room itself was really really nice - and the bathroom was the cleanest hotel bathroom I have ever had the pleasure of using. All in all a terrific stay and I would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Templeogue
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights last week in Hotel des Hommes. Lovely boutique style hotel. Spotlessly clean with fresh linen on the bed every day. Ideal location, handy for Notre Dame, Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and strolling alongside the Seine. Quiet at night but still close to restaurants bars etc. Despite our advancing years, we liked the buzz of Sorbonne students in the area. Far superior to the "retirement home" feel of some places. Paris is great. In general people were friendly especially staff at the reception in the hotel. We found the best value and range of restaurants on the Rue Moueftard/Descartes. Go right as you exit the hotel and its about 5 minutes walk. For the price it would be hard to find a better hotel in Paris. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwiondoner
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel in a fantastic location - very near all the bars and restaurants of St Germain. Great value for money and really lovely staff. Would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tr4v3ll3r
Reviews.Content: A charming, small hotel in an excellent position directly opposite the Pantheon. We greatly enjoyed our two nights here. The staff were very helpful and the room small but immaculate. Every aspect of the hotel and service was well above average.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and quaint”
Reviews.Author: DeniseFernandes
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was fabulous! The staff our wonderfully friendly and the breakfasts are held in a beautiful underground restaurant. We had a wonderful view of the Pantheon from our hotel room and the hotel is extremely close to many sightseeing experiences in Paris. The room is nice, clean and comfortably warm and sound proof... We recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxed experience in Paris....

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel but an uphill walk from the Metro”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for 2 nights, Nov. 19-21. We booked directly with the hotel, several months in advance. We got their Internet Rate and pre-paid in full 353 Euros for a deluxe double room with a view of the Pantheon for 2 nights, not including breakfast. Everything the other reviewers have said about this hotel is true. The Hotel des Grands Hommes is a smart, stylish hotel on a grand piazza facing the Pantheon and has beautiful decor, nice clean bathrooms, lovely downstairs lobby, helpful and efficient staff, etc.. Our balcony looked directly onto the Pantheon and was stunning. The traffic noise was not bad at all. I really loved the hotel but feel that it is important to note for future travelers that the hotel is uphill from the nearest Metro stop - about 15 minutes away. If you are European and used to walking so much, well ok. But the average American (like me) may not be and after walking around Paris all day, it was a bit exhausting to emerge from the Metro and then face an uphill walk to the Hotel des Grands Hommes. Frankly, at the end of the day, my feet were tired and it was generally dark, cold and drizzling rain and the last thing I wanted to do was trudge up that hill again, past the Sorbonne with all the student- types loitering about. As much as I loved this hotel's decor, etc... I think that for my next visit to Paris, I might rather stay somewhere a bit closer to the Seine and a Metro stop- such as the Hotel Louis II (newly renovated and about 100 ft. from the Odeon Metro stop).

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience at Hotel des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: 123AC
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault our recent stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. Polite efficient reception staff, superb room (v. quiet) with views of the Pantheon across the street and Sacre Coeur in the distance from the floor to ceiling windows. Bathroom in need of a slight modernisation, but that would be a minor quibble. Great location if you want something a little less frantic than staying in the Marais, with romantic walks at your doorstep across the Jardins de Luxembourg and down to Isle de la Cite. Would stay again without doubt (please note we only didn't see any other rooms apart from the one we had and therefore cannot comment on this aspect of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mcmck_2001
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel des Grands Hommes. The staff was wonderful, super helpful and the location was unbelievable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all. We also got a great rate by going direct to the site (versus online travel sites).. hundreds of dollars cheaper!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here regularly when in Paris. Like the Quartier, love the view.”
Reviews.Author: LondonConnoisseur
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy staying in this hotel. It has a quirky French character which is perfect for a stay in Paris. the staff are always helpful. The rooms are compact and the ones at the back not very well lit, but they have everything you need for a short stay. The front rooms with have a great view over the Pantheon. don't expect 24 h room service, and the breakfast is French rather than international style. The "cave" where you eat is an interesting experience, and it can get a little crowded at times, but the coffee is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Lipton2
Reviews.Content: SHORT REVIEW: Tasteful and charming clean, fresh bedrooms; no tattiness to be seen; unique decor; spotless bathroom; good water pressure; good hairdrier; fresh towels everyday and toiletries; minibar; room safe; BBC world; tidy and attractively furnished reception; polite staff; good location (not touristy); freshly served and presented brekkie; lots of bars, brasseries, cafes etc in immediate vicinity; taxi, metro and RER within 3 mins stroll; would stay here again without hesitation. Absolutely no faults - and I can find them if I have to. 10/10 for everything. A management team and support staff that should be very proud of themselves. Superior 3* hotel. LONG REVIEW: Part of the fun for me when going away for a break is to research my hotels, and I tend to use the Trip Advisor website as my first port of call to get a general feel. And I am glad to report that again, the write ups this hotel received do truly reflect it. We stayed 3 nights from 28 Nov - 1 Dec 07 inclusive, and stayed in room 54 which was unfortunately - and I would like to strongly emphasise it was the only down side to our stay here - at the back of the hotel. Hence, no view of the Pantheon! :-( We reserved some months ago via the website directly and got a good deal which included breakfast each morning. HOTEL The building is very pretty and faces straight onto the Pantheon. The Hotel Pantheon (part of the same chain) is right next door. Reception is tastefully furnished and check in desk discreetly tucked away to the left. Staff very curtuous, efficient and helpful. Our room was on the 5th floor. OK - it was small but we didn't care. Size isn't everything just so long as it is clean, comfortable and pleasant on the eye. And that it was - tasteful, clean, crisp and fresh as was the bathroom also. Loved the light fixtures by the bed. Plenty of toiletries and fresh towels each day. Bed was super comfy, windows could be opened for air in both room and bathroom, adjustable thermostat, mini bar was well stocked (bit expensive though - half bottle of champagne was a cracking 24E!!), and there was also a safe and a hairdrier. TV had BBC world. Without a shadow of a doubt, this has got to be the cleanest hotel I have every stayed at. Each morning when heading for breakfast, the corridors were a hive of activity with the maids setting about their business - and the entire establishment reflects this. BREAKFAST As we had the brekkie included, we actually only had breakfast on 2 of the 3 mornings there (had a lie in on the Saturday and so missed the 10.30 cut off). The breakfast room is in the basement which is sooo cute. Cavernous. Although on the small side, it did surprisingly always seem to have at least a table free for the new arrivals. You could help yourself to juice, cereal, fruit, yogurts, toast, jam/butter, dried fruit, 3 types of cheese and 3 types of salami/ham. Once seated the waitress would bring you a basket of fresh baguette, hazlenut bread, mini croissants and pain au chocolate. If you wanted anything such as omlette or eggs, you could have but there was an additional charge (on average 2-4 euro per item ordered). To be honest, what they offered as standard was already absolutely fine. LOCATION Great location. We actually walked everywhere whilst in Paris - so much that I don't think we got the full value of the Carte Visite Paris which we bought and is mentioned below. Anyhow, it's a 5 mins stroll down to Notre Dame from the Hotel, and from there if you walk along the bank of the Seine, you can get to the Eiffel Tower or Arc de Triomph (at a leisurely pace) in about 45 mins. Obviously, if you stop off at the attractions in between (Louvre, musee Dorsay, etc it will take longer). EAT AND DRINK NEARBY Near the hotel there are indeed lots of bars, cafes, brasseries and restaurants - including a McDonalds and Quick fast food outlet if you are that way inclined. Also within the immediate vicinity is a pharmacy (which I needed on Saturday morning - ahem, to go along with the medicinal lie in!!). Just thought I'd mention it. As you are only a 5 mins walk to the Latin Quarter and St. Severine, you MUST go there at night as there are simply lots to choose from. Look for Cafe Rim - Italian - which was very popular the night we were there with groups waiting up to 20 mins for a table. Good sign. But all in all, there are so many places, it's hard to choose. One thing I noticed - lots of Savoie restaurants serving cheese fondue!!! TO GET THERE When we arrived at CdG airport (terminal 3) we took a short walk over to the train station which was in another terminal. Literally 5 mins walk. There we bought the Carte Paris Visite ticket which opens the doors to the whole Ile-de-France network : Metro, RER, Buses, Trams, SNCF overland suburban trains, the Montmartre funicular, Montmartobus, Noctilien and the Optile bus network - depending on the zones you choose of course (Zone 1 to Zone 3 or Zone 1 to Zone 6). You can buy it for either 1,2,3 or 5 days. We bought it for 3 days and for Zone 1-6 as CdG airport falls into Zone 5. The price was 38.50E but obviously the price will vary depending on exactly which one you opt for. As mentioned above, we walked everywhere so I don't think we got the full value - but not to mind. FYI a one-way ticket CdG-Luxembourg is 8.20E. There is also a taxi rank outside Quick fast food. ++ At the moment, there is a big wheel located at the place de la Concorde so at early dusk it's an idea to make your way there for a quick ride on it with a bag of warm churros to keep your hands warm!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toadman
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel next to the Pantheon. The rooms are clean and our interior room was very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful and made reservation for us on several occassions for different restaurants in the area. We would not hestitate to stay here again or to recommend this hotel to friends and family planning a trip to Paris. The location is near to the Luxembourg Gardens, the Seine, Rue Mofftard, Notre Dame, and many very nice Cafe's, shops, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I like it”
Reviews.Author: alex_chuk
Reviews.Content: Great place, good service, clean and comfortable. Very quiet, I could not hear my neighbors, except for sounds of their doors. A little bit expensive may be, though Paris is always expensive. The only thing I disliked was a difficulty to receive a booking confirmation. May be it was because of my bad English and no French at all. Overall, I enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience”
Reviews.Author: markp30
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes was absolutely wonderful. It had been several years since I visited Paris, and I was cautiously trying to find a hotel with comfort and charm at a (relatively) reasonable rate. The room was a typical size for a European hotel, but the terrace overlooking the square below was a surprise. We enjoyed a bottle of wine (maybe two...) sitting outside our room in the evenings. The room itself was comfortable, although the closet space was limited. The bathroom wasn't big, but very clean. It surprised us that sound from the television was piped into speakers in the bathroom. It wasn't bothersome, just something we hadn't seen before. The view from our room was spectacular. Waking up in the night to see the lit up dome of the Pantheon outside is an experience I won't forget. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl35
Reviews.Content: We found the Grand Homme after research online. We loved the hotel! The room was very charming and very clean. The staff was very helpful, prompt and courteous. The price was very reasonable. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: RED555
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Paris. I had googled lots of 3 and 4 star hotels - knew we wanted to be on the Left Bank and found this place. Checked it out through Trip Advisor and it had good to great reviews across the board - price was reasonable and we could get a double room with a view of the Pantheon - it was near the Metro and the Morais, the Seine etc. We got there at 7 a.m. - our flight got in very early. The conciierge was very nice, held our bags and went over a few things including good directions to all the places we wanted to see. Our room was pretty, sheets fantastic, bed firm, nice pillows, good towels and a had a bathtub!! A big plus for us. This is a totally no smoking hotel also a very big plus for us. The only negative or the only suggestion I would make that would bring me back would be to include a simple breakfast - cafe crème and a roll - maybe some fruit - that's it. Every other three and four star hotel we stayed in France and Italy offered that. I was surprised a breakfast would cost 12 euros. We went out every morning and had a cafe crème and a roll at some neighborhood cafe but NONE were no smoking - we sat outside - slightly bundled - it was about 50 degrees. All in all a great place and a great location. Very pretty accommodations. thanks to all staff who made our stay pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: Romantic getaway for me and my girlfriend. Stayed four nights at the hotel, booked through the hotels own website after reading the reviews on tripadvisor - saved around 100 Euros compared to the cheepest booking agent (hotels.com). How was the hotel: Great loction located 50 meters from the Pantheon in the Latin quarters. We came from Orly, and the railroadstop was just 5 minutes walk from the hotel.Check in was smooth, ok english, greated with a smile. Lobby is small, but nice and clean. Room was small, the bed a little bit hard, but ok size. Minibar and safe, window to the backyard. Bathroom was clean and nice, spaceous compared to the bedroom, bathtub. Quiet, and slept well. Had breakfast the last day, was ok, coffee/tea, toast, a few cheeses and salami/ham (Euro 12 per person). We usually got up around 10 and ate great breakfast on different corner cafe's (usually around 8 euro for "french breakfast"). What to do in Paris:We bought the Paris card for 5 days (buy it at the airport) and you have cheap transportation for the rest of your holiday, and it was nice to not have to pay everytime you took the metro, which you do a lot to save your legs :). We went to Louvre (closed on tuesdays), Eiffel tower, Sacre cur, Triumph Arch, champse E., versailles, Montmartre (was a big disappointment - looked like a getto with a lot of gangs going a round, felt unsafe compred to the latin quarters) and took an evening dinner criuse at the river seine - expensive but definetively worth it,Beateux Parisiene, booked at the office close to the eiffel tower - 125 E per person,(95,125,180 E dependent on service) great dinner, had snails for starter, wasn't bad, 745 pm - 11 pm), versailles (went there with local train covered by "Paris card", located just 5-10 minutes walk) and just walked around. We found the Latin Quarters were the hotel is located to be the niceste part of town, a lot of cafe's, bars, restaurant and it seemed very safe! Have a nice stay in Paris and i would definetively recommend the above mentioned hotel and the Lain quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Hotel des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaMatilda
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the charming Hotel des Grands Hommes. The room was immmaculately clean and beautifully decorated, with a very comfortable bed and fluffy pillows. The staff was first-rate and always helpful with directions and assistance making dinner reservations. We booked early and prepaid the first night, so it was an excellent value. Its a terrific neighborhood, close to the Luxembourg Gardens. There was some noise from carousers at the nearby plaza of the Pantheon one early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Superb ... a perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: catherinesally
Reviews.Content: From the second we entered the Hotel we were thrilled with our choice. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. The room, which was characteristically small, was superb in every detail. We spent the first 15 minutes taking photos of the room and the incredible view of the Pantheon. We then sat with smug smiles on our faces feeling like 'the cat that ate the cream'! We had read only one negative review on this property which said the rooms were small. Yes they are small but for us this did not compromise in any way the marvellous appointment of the property or the prestigious feel. During this holiday we stayed in some very impressive 4 star hotels. The Hotel des Grands Hommes exceeded the standard of some of those hotels and certainly matched the better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this gorgeous little hotel ..”
Reviews.Author: hockeysticks
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this lovely hotel for three nights, got a great deal on the hotels own website .. by booking online in June and paying up front we paid €400 for three nights, double room with ensuite. Although we did not have a balcony or view of the Pantheon we did have a nice sized room (maybe small by American standards but more than adequate) with a huge bathroom. It was beautifully decorated and always really warm and cosy. The reception staff were very nice and helpful even looking up website for us when we enquired about the bus tours and going to Disney (which was great fun worth a visit for children and adults alike also booked online for a better ticket price). The hotel is within easy reach of the Luxembourg RER station, the Notre Dame is lovely walk and there are various shops and restaurants around the area. I would highly recommend this hotel for a romantic break away in a beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Elliott2199
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 25th anniversary and were advised by friends to stay in the Latin Quarter. First time in Paris. Read reviews on tripadvisor and decided to stay here. Very nice, clean hotel in a great location. Felt very safe walking in the area and we had every dinner within walking distance of the hotel. Excellent choice of restaurants (make reservations) nearby, so why travel? It was great being able to walk to the restaurant, have delicious wine and have a leisurely stroll back to the hotel. Our dinner was our evening entertainment - 2-3 hours because one was never rushed. People at front desk gave excellent recommendations, but a Paris Zagat's book was VERY helpful. Le Petit Pontoise was our most delicious meal. We were seated next to a retired chef that said, "This is the way French food tasted 20 years ago and this is the way it should taste". Train stops nearby, but be prepared to do a lot of walking. Pick up Paris City Walks at a bookstore. It gives one EXCELLENT walks in different areas of Paris. Paris is the most beautiful city we've been too. We were there for 8 nights and it was not enough time!

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Downunder99
Reviews.Content: One of the best 3 star French hotels hotels we have stayed at following 3 visits to France in recent years. Hard to fault, great location, lovely decor in keeping with the lovely old building and very clean and quiet. Very helpful and courteous staff, particularly the front desk. Nice rooms with relatively spacious bathroom. Like most older continental hotels the bedroom was a little small but a minor problem compared with the overall experience. Would be my first choice next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: EnglandEmma
Reviews.Content: Spent a magical 5 days in Paris at the Hotel des Grands Hommes on our honeymoon. This was my first stay in Paris and I'm hooked - looking forward to spending many anniversaries there. We stayed in room 22 overlooking the Pantheon - the room was beautifully decorated and a great view! The hotel is in a great location and I would recommend it to anybody. Only one disappointment during our stay which was dinner on the bateau mouche - nice trip but very average food and definitely not worth the money. There are plenty of good restaurants close to the hotel - take your pick.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DublinTraveler1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. Had a minor problem with our room and it was resolved promptly by the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: dhardiegb
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated room, although compact in the manner of all central Paris small hotels, good bathroom. Excellent vista over Place du Pantheon from front of building rooms, close to RER line from CDG. Very good neighbourhood adjacent to Luxembourg Gardens, plenty restaurants, good walking. All-in-all, an ideal location for a short-break holiday in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Hamps
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay @ the Hotel des Grands Hommes, the hotel is ideally located facing the Pantheon, 5 minutes walk from Luxembourg metro / Luxembourg Gardens & 10 miutes walk from Notre Dame. A good variety of cafe's & restaurants closeby. Hotel staff very welcoming & helpful, rooms spottless. Would definately return & recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in the latin quarter”
Reviews.Author: MACreadie26
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that this hotel was superbly comfortable , quiet and i would rate it in the top 30 hotels in Paris i had a few minor dissapointments . Sadly , when you see highly rated hotels on this website you tend to expect them to be everything to all . Biggest disappointment for me was looking forward to drinking a bottle of wine from my balcony and watching the sun go down over Paris. I booked the most expensive room ( Deluxe- number 1), assuming i would get the best view but ,sadly whilst this was very ornate and large it was on the ground floor overlooking the street: tip: book superior with balcony if you use the hotel website. Also the breakfast room is small (about 6 tables ) and located in the basement although pleasent enough. . Breakfast is poor by international standards- usual continental fare but no cooked breakfast available. If you book early on the website & get a deal including breakfast then take it or if you can't be bothered to get up in the morning and go search out your breakfast then take it. Otherwise for half the price you can get a much better selection for half the price at numerous bars , restaurants , cafes and crepe bars less than 100 yards away- most open extremely early. On the plus side the staff were excellent. All spoke English well and check in and check out was quick and efficient. Hotel is very plush , surprisingly quiet (even on the ground floor) - air con means you can shut the window if you want + heavy curtains. No tea and coffee making facilities but that seems to be the norm for hotels in Paris. Location perfect. Couldn't fault it for the money and despite my small criticisms wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in Paris unless i received a very high recommendation from a close friend - and only then if they came in the top 20 rated on trip advisor! Tips: 1)Get one of the passes that allows you to use the metro /rer for a few days- you can then hop on and off without scrabelling for euros or thinking of the price and sometimes you just wan't to bet from A-B as fast as possible. 2)If you want to walk up the Eifel tower, get the right leg(s) of the tower-- some are for lifts, some for walking. 3)Visit Mont Martre - outside of the central tourist sights but beautiful. Nearly didn't go and would have missed the best part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: Mike037
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel with excellent location. The rooms were clean and comfortable, if not particularly large. The bathroom was just fine. The bed very comfortable. The best thing about the hotel is without a doubt the location - get a room with a view of the Pantheon - superb! Also within walking distance of many of the main attractions. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Grands Hommes - Excellent Location and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walkerwanderer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated across the square from the Pantheon and with easy access to the main sites of Paris by foot such as Notre Dame. This proved invaluable as our stay coincided with a nationwide transport strike! The room that we had was not large but it was very comfortable and nicely decorated. A nice touch was the turn down service each evening which we hadn't expected. The staff were very welcoming and quick to sort out a minor problem that we had with the television not working properly. A continental breakfast was included in the room rate and again was good with a nice selection of fresh breads and croissants brought to the table by the friendly waitress. I would certainly recommend this hotel and am looking forward to staying there again on my next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mavroudis
Reviews.Content: Great location and good value. Managers were extremely accommodating, specifically the new night manager. Enjoyed our stay there and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! (with a very few exceptions!)”
Reviews.Author: ravensgirl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfully romantic stay at The Hotel Grands Hommes. The view from our balcony was magnificent and worth every euro to be able to sit there with a bottle of wine in the evening and gaze across Paris to Montmarte watching the twinkling lights of the city appear. We adore stayng in the Latin Quarter and this hotel is ideal...The staff was very polite and helpful and made us feel welcome. It was peacful and quiet at night enough to leave our windows wide open ....until...Friday night...when every student (as students do) decided to party like it was 1999 in the Patheon Square. It rocked LOUDLY until about 3 morning which made it really rough since we had a 8 o'clock flight to Rome. It was too warm to close the windows entirely so all in all it was not a great night. So...our advise is DO stay at this hotel just try and stay during the week...or stay on the weekend and go out and party like a rock star.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownTraveladdict
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a typical Parisian Hotel,and found exactly that. The rooms are charmingly decorated, and one of our 2 rooms had a lovely view over the Panteon with a quaint little balcony.Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: teaslton
Reviews.Content: Very professional and accomodating staff. Manager made special effort to change our room to one that suited us more. Great location, though not near metro line to most sites. Beautiful Luxembourg Gardens nearby as well as many nice restaurants. Despite location at Pantheon, very little automobile traffic at night. Breakfast room a bit cramped so prefered local spots for light continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff! Nice bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Annettencalif
Reviews.Content: Nice place! Across from the pantheon made it easy to find. Staff was helpful and courteous. The bathrooms are great! The bedrooms are tight, but they are for sleeping! Note that when you open a window the a/c automatically shuts off. Lights are automatic as in the hallways as well. The elevator will fit you and a couple big bags or just two people. But, things ARE small in France, get used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Grand Hommes"”
Reviews.Author: lcharvin
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel des grands hommes next to Pantheon. Not-only the location is perfect, but the hotel is very clean and beautifully decorated. We had a nice room on the 5th floor with a balcony and a view. Above all we appreciated the hotel staff. Special mention for the front desk, professional and friendly. Even more special mention for the breakfast "maitre d'hotel". She went out of her way to make the breakfast a very pleasant moment and she greeted us everyday with her "bonne humeur". Will definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great option in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Glassman77
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before... and we came back, which I guess is a recommendation in itself. A great location - in the heart of the Latin Quarter - very quiet but surrounded by lots of bars and restaurants. Very good access to Gare du Nord and the Eurostar - just 3 stops on the RER (door to door in 25 mins). Nice, cosy and clean rooms, good service and an adequate breakfast. My only concern is that the room rates seem to be creaping up...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: MBD48
Reviews.Content: We are so grateful we booked the Hotel des Grands Hommes for 16 days in August for the following reasons: 1. Location: walking distance to the heart of the city, 5 minutes to the Metro; local neighbourhood was charming and romantic. Le Berthaud was our favourite restaurant: authenic cuisine, supported by "locals", reasonable (15.5 eu for 2 courses) and 3 blocks away. 2. Price - the hotel website was the best deal; the staff we very prompt and courteous in describing various options; we decided that "breakfast included" was better than an early-bird discount. 3. Breakfast - small, but very adequate cold "buffet". We might have found a better value outside the hotel, but the convenience, bottomless cups of coffee and Marika's warm and cheery welcome made this a far better option. 4. Staff - always friendly, approachable, accommodating and helpful 5. Accommodation - rooms were small but immaculate; the ensuite was pristine. We stayed in a standard interior room which had no view but was quiet. We stayed in a superior room (extra 30 euros) which had a spectacular view but could be noisy into the early morning hourd if we left the window opened.
