Both rooms neded more shelving for clothing. 6. Cable TV - BBC and CNN kept us informed. There were other stations in Italian, German, Spanish and French. TV "size" was not an issue. 7. Free WIFI - we brought our laptop; the internet connection was perfect. A convenient way to keep in touch with family, local news back home, to store photos, to confirm attraction information, etc. Local internet cafes were 4 eu/hr. 8. Cheap telephone - 10 "Euro cents" per minute to North America; direct dial 9. Access to airport - we took RER commuter train to hotel for 8 euros; the stop was a 10 minute walk to the hotel; We took "Parishuttle" back to the airport (19 eu/pp) since the escalators from streetlevel only went "up" and it was rush hour. The staff booked the shuttle for us. 10, Air conditioning: a luxury in the summer and not common in Paris We definitely hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Small, but quaint, great character”
Reviews.Author: redsox_flyers
Reviews.Content: stayed here in august, and did enjoy our stay. The hotel was very quaint and could be defined as 'cute'. Hotel staff was pleasant and spoke english very well. Both bathrooms and room were very clean and very well kept. Only part we didn't love was the location. Took a while to get to the main parts and attractions, and there's really not alot by the pantheon. If we were to go back we'd prefer to get closer to the Arc or the Louvre, but was very happy with the accomendations here.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Stay at Hotel des Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: alipriest
Reviews.Content: A pure delight. To-die-for location in the 5th arrondisement, accommodating and friendly staff, and beautifully appointed if somewhat small rooms. We would have happily extended our stay if we hadn't made former plans. Also, out nights were amazingly quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tomzach
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right next to the Pantheon, Sorbonne, Latin Quarter and only a few blocks from Luxembourg RER (metro line to CDG airport). Walking distance to Notre Dame. We asked for a room on the 5th floor with a balcony and got one along with a nice email welcoming us. The rooms on the 5th floor have small balconies and the ones on the top (6th) floor have larger balconies. Staff is friendly and helpful, free Wi-Fi internet, very good breakfast. I usually don't go for hotel breakfasts but I recommend this one. Room was clean, comfortable, and not noisy despite the fact that we overlooked Place du Pantheon. Good value given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see all the best of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: tenniscrazy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel des Grands Homme offered the perfect location for a great price. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very helpful and they all speak English; and since most Americans don't speak the lovely French language this is a plus. I did experience one small minor incident with breakage and the management was very courteous and handled the situation appropriately. I highly recommend this hotel for tourists who are in Paris to see the sites and not just hang around and lounge in their hotel room. The metro stop and the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens are three blocks away, the 24 hour internet store is two blocks away and there are numerous shops on the Avenue Sofflot. Enjoy beautiful Paris and I recommend the Hotel des Grands Hommes as your home base.

Reviews.Title: “This place was perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: afink78
Reviews.Content: The hotel was intimate, comfortable, clean, and perfectly located. Our room has a balcony looking right out onto the Pantheon. It always felt great to come back to the hotel. The staff was warm and helpful. We fell in love with Paris all over again, with this as our homebase. We will be back to both Paris and this Hotel des Grand Hommes very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Les Grande Homme”
Reviews.Author: chrisbriz
Reviews.Content: This was a most enjoyable stay and all we could have asked for. Front couonter staff were superb - most helpful whenever possible. Marie (at breakfast) was a delight, and breakfast was delightful. The area of Paris was perfect - Luxembourg Gardens were lovely and peaceful; The Pantheon well worth visiting; Close to Universities, and OK to walk to the city (though give yourself time fro a pleasant amble. Restaurants nearby all great, and transport fine. I couldn't fault our stay.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: DublinTravelOne
Reviews.Content: I visit Paris for business 3 or 4 times a year and this was my first time staying at Hotel des Grands Hommes. I chose it based on reviews on Trip Advisor, its location close to Jardins de Luxembourg (a beautiful spot in Paris for a Saturday morning stroll) and its convenience for getting to the airport (it is very close to the RER station Luxembourg which is on the airport line). The rates were very good on the hotel's website (summer special). If you can get this hotel at a good price I would defintely recommend it. The rooms are a good size (for Paris) - beuatifully decorated (completely over the top but very stylish and comfortable). The rooms at the front overlook the Pantheon - a little noisy on the Friday night I stayed there but it didn't last too late and so sleeping wasn't a problem. The breakfast (€12) was very good - a good selection of cold meats, cheese, bread, pastries, cereal, yoghurt, juice and tea/coffee. The staff were polite and helpful. I have a new favourite hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect week at the Hôtel des Grand Hommes”
Reviews.Author: VT_Professor
Reviews.Content: I spent seven glorious nights at the Hôtel des Grands Hommes during my first trip to Paris in July 2007. I chose a “superior” room facing the Panthéon, booked months in advance on the hotel’s website at a special summer rate. It did not disappoint! While small in size, the room was exquisitely decorated with fine furniture, an open beam ceiling, and upholstered walls in a Toile de Jouy pattern. This was a boutique hotel in the truest sense of the word. There was none of the bland and uniform decoration typically found in chain hotels. Instead, there was sheer style that constantly reminded me that I was in Paris! The hotel’s location on the Place du Panthéon was ideal for exploring the city by metro or on foot. It was just a five minute walk from the Luxembourg RER station, which traveled directly to Charles de Gaulle airport, and a fifteen minute stroll to Notre Dame cathedral. The hotel was also well situated for dining out. There were many delightful places to eat nearby, including inexpensive sandwich shops and creperies, ethnic restaurants, and those that served traditional French cuisine, such as “Le Coupe Chou.” There was a fabulous boulangerie around the corner, an Amorino ice cream shop, and a patisserie called Dalloyau which made wonderful macarons. Along the Rue Soufflot, I found basic but vital amenities such as a 24-hour internet café and ATM machine. Finally, I would like to comment on the staff at the Hôtel des Grands Hommes. While a recent reviewer felt the service was somewhat “impersonal,” I must disagree. I conversed with several staff members during my stay and all went out of their way to be pleasant and helpful. They put me at ease in their willingness to speak English (and to tolerate my halting French), and were kind to make several reservations for me at local restaurants. My hotel room was kept spotlessly clean and I looked forward each night to the piece of chocolate left on my pillow by the maid. I hope that this review will serve as a sincere “thank you” to all of them for making my stay in Paris so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: jules71Glasgow
Reviews.Content: I booked directly with the hotel and got a package which included breakfast,and a stay in a superior room with a small balcony which looked out right onto the Pantheon. The room was nicely decorated, very clean and had very good and easily controlled air conditioning. The room was an adequate size but they should think about adding some drawers into the closet space and maybe some shelving in the bathroom - there wasn't room for both my own any my partners toilletries around the sink area. The overhead shower was rather weak but the hand held one had good pressure and there was always plenty of hot water. As I mentioned our package included breakfast. This was served in a small but pleasantly cave like room in the basement of the hotel. I really can't recommend the food served however. There was a really limited choice on offer - no hot food unless you were willing to pay 4 euros for an omelette or 2 euros for a boiled egg! We were given a basket of bread and pastries each morning with a choice of a couple of cold meats/cheeses etc buffet style but overall you would be far better eating outside. They should either scrap the breakfast option or give you a better selection. The staff were always very pleasant and helpful and the hotel is in a lovely and surprisngly quiet location with easy access to various metro stops within a 10 minute walk. There are lots of nice cafes and restaurants nearby and I would recommend trying some of these rather than walking down to others on the main streets such as Boulevard St. Michel and St. Germain. Overall we really enjoyed out stay - just don't book breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect way to enjoy Paris”
Reviews.Author: f_d_mcEcosse
Reviews.Content: This hotel has quite a bit going for it even before you consider the staff and rooms: it is right in the heart of the University quarter of Paris, on the site of Mont Saint Genevieve, where Abelard opened his first school and the first King of the Franks was buried (the remains of the church across the square); the Pantheon is outside - a remarkable piece of architecture, whose classical beauty is enhanced by it history (a church which was later converted by the humanist revolutionaries into a humanist cathedral after the revolution); the Sorbonne Law school (ecole de droit) sits majectically at the entrance to the square; and the Luxembourg Gardens are at the end of the street! A brief (all too brief, as the area really is so pleasing on the eye)walk of 5 minutes down from the mount brings you into what is left of the bustling medieval heart of Paris, with its narrow lanes and Roman ruins incorporated into medieval palaces (Hotel du Cluny - you must visit the musee du Moyen age inside: magnificent). There are some great eateries here (Balzar, as one reviewer has already highlighted, is great - try the rum baba; they drown it in St Martinique rum, then leave you the full bottle just in case you want more! And don't start me of the steak and frittes) and also some really tasty eastern mediterrenean takeaways which can be eaten while walking past statues of Charlemagne on the way to Notre Dame and the Louvre (I could sit in there and look at Delacroix's paintings for a year and a day). The train (Luxembourg) to both PCDG airport and Orly is right next to the hotel. This was perfect for us as we flew into CDG from Edinburgh and out of Orly to Avignon.No taxis, no rip-off, no 'scenic' detours. Brilliant. The hotel itself is realy, really good value for money. We stayed in some very expensive hotels in Southern France, but not one of them could compete with the view we had out of our room. The hotel gave us the central room with the large balcony which looked straight onto both the Pantheon and Sorbonne in the background. We drank Reinhart champgne on the balcony while watching everyone coming and going from the Pantheon and the Luxembourg gardens (connected to the Pantheon by a beautiful street which the Pantheon dominates). The rooms were very tastefully decorated. Classical motifs swirling on the felted walls, with wooden beams elegantly holdng up the roof. The bed was comfy and spacious. The room itself was typically (Parisian) compact, but not obtrusively so. The staff were helpful and friendly (chatty even at 6 in the morning as we flew off to Provence). On behalf of my wife and I, I want to thank the staff and the owners at the Grands Hommes for ensuring the first few days of our honeymoon were so memorable. Your hotel is everything that a Parisien hotel should be: friendly, warm, beautiful to look at, and, above all, classy. We will be back. Keep our room free for our 1st wedding anniversary next 4th of August.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lrinbxl
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay in this hotel. The rooms aren't huge, but well designed and decorated with very comfortable beds. The Pantheon area is a great choice for a hotel because it's quiet at night but very close to great areas to sightsee, eat and shop. I very much enjoyed staying here and would absolutely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel,great value”
Reviews.Author: Carmelanna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the 5th arrondissement in Place du Pantheon. What a lovely view! Our family of 6 had three rooms. Two on the the 5th and one on the 3rd. All three rooms overlooked the courtyard. The bathrooms were terrific and the beds and linens most comfortable. One of the bathrooms was quite spacious and even had a large window. The breakfast was quite good and varied but at 12 euro each was too expensive for us. We ate there on the first morning only. The hotel is very near a major metro station. The lobby looked very well kept and the staff was helpful and friendly. The elevator and hallway are a bit tight when you have large luggage. The online rate was great [110 euro] compared to other comparable hotels. I would certainly go back ----probably as an anniversary trip just with my husband [I'd ask for a larger room overlooking the Pantheon--unfortunately,cost would most assuredly be higher]. Carmelanna from Toronto in Canada

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sped123311
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. We had a "room with a view" that faced the Pantheon. It was nicely furnished in blue and white, it reminded us of Wedgewood china. The bathroom appeared to have been recently updated and followed the same color scheme. The hotel's location was very convenient. We walked to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and most other attractions. A Metro station is close by and there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. Breakfast was included in the room rate and was served in an attractive room in the hotel basement. We would recommend this hotel and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Winner!”
Reviews.Content: What a great discovery. Hotel des Grands Hommes is extremely well located for the Blvd St Germain & Blvd St Michel areas. Rooms are very comfortable & nicely decorated, as is the charming reception area. Very good value for money; we will certainly stay there again! Keith & Louise Manwaring, Alabama, USA.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Doctore
Reviews.Content: The location adjoining The Pantheon makes this hotel ideal for a short stay in Paris. Very well equipped with above average furnishings and decoration. We went 'standard' for the price and the room was small but very tastefully furnished - large comfortable bed and great bathroom. Only drawback was our view over the inner courtyard rather than at the front overlooking the Pantheon. So for a little bit extra we would recommend you go 'superieure'. With a rack rate of 255 euros our rate of 96 euros through Tripadvisor represented very good value for money. And there are free Guardian newspapers in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: AZULION
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the numerous rave reviews, I am somewhate surprised at the popularity of this hotel after staying there for a couple of evenings. The service was impersonal with a different person at the front desk nearly everytime I walked past. The previous year I stayed at Eduard VII near l'Opera and found it much more charming, accomodating, with friendlier reception and service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the grand hommes”
Reviews.Author: ceciliaAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect romantic room with a view over the Pantheon. It was our first holiday with our 8 week old babygirl. We had a baby cot in our room and our baby slept like a rose. We would recommend this hotel it's in the Le Quartier Latin a vibrant area, nice restaurants and cafés. The beautiful Le jardin du Luxembourg is less then 10 minute walk. Free parking in August was a big surprise. Willemsens family, Amsterdam Holland

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel - Snooty Staff”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBelle50
Reviews.Content: We returned from Normandy to stay one last night in Paris before departing back to the States and chose to spend the night in a different area than we had stayed earlier in the week. The Hotel des Grandes Hommes was absolutely beautiful. We got a great deal on Expedia. My husband just about had a heartattack when he saw the posted rate but I assured him we were not paying that rate (I think we paid 118 Euros for the night - the posted rate started at 300 Euros). The only negative was the staff. They were very snooty and generally not very helpful - a big turnoff to a Southerner! Although we really enjoyed our stay, we loved the Rue Clear neighborhood more.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Habibi_Music
Reviews.Content: I got a room as a last-minute deal through the hotel's web site. Ended up with an absolutely beautiful room with a spectacular view of the Panthéon. I've stayed at the hotel next door which is run by the same people and every time I've had an excellent experience. Very nice, clean facilities, romantic decor, pleasant and professional staff, central but quiet location. Would strongly recommend as long as the secret doesn't get out so I can't get a deal there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “We HIGHLY recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lrak47
Reviews.Content: Just back from a very pleasant stay at the HGH. First off, it is a 5-10 minute walk from the RER-B train line stop at "Luxembourg", that is a direct shot to both Orly and Charles deGaulle airports. In a pretty, quiet-ish part of town but plenty to do around there. Lots of good cafes within a 5 minute radius. Easily walkable to many, many tourist spots. The room was very nice, clean and the bathroom was huge and immaculate. Fully updated. Good A/C. Friendly staff. Easy booking (with no problems) and best rate through the hotel's own website. We'd definitely go back there and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBarbara
Reviews.Content: Very cute hotel in a good, safe location. We walked to everything from this hotel. The hotel interior was beautifully decorated and the staff very helpful. Our room faced the Pantheon. The room was quite small but very clean. We would stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value will go back!”
Reviews.Author: VacationBound
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Paris and we did alot of research on where to stay. We traveled with our two teenage girls and opted for two rooms; one superior and one standard. Both rooms were very nice, the superior room faced out the front of the hotel and overlooked the Pantheon, the standard room faced the court yard in back - no view. The rooms were both small by American standards but were decorated very nice and both bathrooms were large! For adults, I would upgrade to superior if possible. Also, some rooms on the higher floors do have tiny balconies. The staff at the hotel were all very accommodating and pleasant! Their English was great and they were very helpful on city questions etc. The location is ideal, close to the metro and easy walk to variety of restaurants and shops. $50 taxi ride from airport. Worth it though, there's an RER stop a couple blocks away, but we had traveled all night and found the taxi worth the money. We were able to get a great rate booking from the hotel's direct site. It was a great hotel for the value!! St. Paul, MN

Reviews.Title: “A "Grand" 3 Star Hotel! Affordable Luxury for "Normals Hommes et Femmes"”
Reviews.Author: pwsull
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 & 1/2 week vacation in France, Finishing our stay with the last two nights at the "Hotel des Grands Hommes" in Paris. We have stayed in a number orf different small or "Boutique" hotels in the Latin Quarter on Paris' left bank over the past 20 + years, and have nothing but good things to say about our stay this time. While the rooms are small by American standards, this is quite normal and expectable for small hotels in Paris. If you want an American style hotel there are plenty to be found, but you will really miss out on something special. After all, aren't you going to Paris to experience the real thing? Furnishings were antique and lovely; beds were firm and comfortable for my bad back (not always the case in Paris); and the bathrooms luxurious with plenty of hot water. The rooms are air conditioned (also not always the case in small Paris Hotels). We decided to save some money by taking rooms on the back of the hotel, but many of the front rooms have terraces or balconies which look out onto the Pantheon right across the street. Maid service was very good. The breakfast, served in the "cave" or in your room is an extra 12 Euro per person (about $16), but it is "all you can eat" from a sumptuous buffet of fruits, juices, yogurts, cereals, charcuterie (deli meats), & cheese. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate, croisants, pain au chocolate, and baquettes are served by the staff with butter and jam at the buffet. The staff was very courteous, deferential, and helpful....fluent in English, but very accomodating and polite in allowing me to use my somewhat less than fluent French. In addition to the Pantheon being right across the street, The Luxembourg Gardens are down the street, Notre Dame and The Jardin des Plantes are a ten minute walk, and the Louvre is a pleasant 20 minute stroll across the river and down the bank past the "Bookanist" stalls. Great restaurants abound all over the neighborhood, but Brasserie Balzar on Rue des Ecoles, our personal favorite, is worth the 5 to 10 minute walk and the cost ($70 to $90 per person with wine and coffee). This is not the first time we have done business with the hotel's parent company "Hotels Paris Rive Gauche". They own several hotels in the neighborhood, offering other options at primarily the 3 star level (one 2 star). The also offer a beautiful apartment between the Pantheon and Place Monge which we rented for one week at the beginning of our stay, and enjoyed immensely (but you have to enjoy doing your own shopping and some cooking). We have also stayed at their "Hotel Residence Henri IV" which offers mini-apartments with a small kitchenettes. That was lovely too. Booking direct with the company's website is very easy, and they offer a variety of discounts. The rate listed in the room was 255 Euro/night. Not including the breakfast we paid 121 Euro/night ($160). So what are you waiting for? Allez-y! Philip & Elizabeth Sullivan

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Grands Hommes a great choice”
Reviews.Author: scoutKC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hommes for 3 nights. The location, near the Pantheon, is excellent. Our room, on the top floor with a balcony, was wonderful. The staff was very attentive, and we enjoyed the breakfasts in the lower level. The entire experience at the Grand Hommes was beyond our expectation. We will definately stay there again should we be lucky enough to return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FinickyinDC
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful room overlooking the Pantheon. The room was a little small but fine for one person, and the surprize was the bathroom, which was huge even by US standards, and very modern. The hotel has a nice lobby, and the location is perfect. The RER station to the airport (Luxembourg) is about four blocks away and the area is loaded with great places to eat. The Sorbonne, Luxembourg Gardens and Notre Dame are short walks. There is a great internet place down the street if you need to get some work done. I had to pay a steep price since this was the week of the Paris airshow, but it would be a good choice at other times.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: sashalun
Reviews.Content: The welcome basket and note in our room was a pleasant surprise when we arrived. the staff are friendly enough and the loacation is good. yes, we would recommend our friends and relatives to stay there should they visit paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TravelusMaximus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grands Hommes Jun.04-11/07 and loved it. The tripadvisor reviews were spot on. Had a very charming room on first floor overlooking Place du Pantheon and, of course, the Pantheon itself. Very impressive. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom was pristine. Front staff are all very polite and their English is infinitely better than my French. Awesome continental buffet served every morning in very cool vault like stone room in basement where a very charming Parisienne waits on you. For a couple euros more, she'd whip a VERY hot omelette for you. Location can't be beat ... heart of Latin Quarter in heart of Left Bank. Good vibes from all the university students/profs around. Only 3 blocks to the west you find the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg and the Luxembourg RER train station. Great restaurants, sidewalk cafes abound. Check out my pics! Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small and perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: avjj
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, quiet, the best location, all is good.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: nthdegree04
Reviews.Content: I had room 21 with a balcony overlooking Place de Patheon. The room is not large but with its high ceilings and the balcony was quite lovely. The staff were most gracious. The free wireless internet did not work in the lobby but thankfully did work in my room. The location is terrific - just a tad removed from the hub-bub of St Germain but an easy walk to either the Luxemborg garden or Jardin des Plantes - perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully styled boutique hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: anneliz
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay while in Paris! After a thorough review of hotels we decided on this hotel. The position was perfect if you are arriving from Charles de Gaulle as it is 5 minutes from Luxemboug Gardens RER station and there are no transfers. If you are arriving at Orly there is only one exchange. We actually experienced three rooms. We had booked the lowest price and although the room was spotless and beautifully decorated, it was small and at the rear of the building so we asked if a superior front room was available. Although not large by North American standards, the superior rooms are definitely worth the extra dollars if you are spending a few nights or more. We stayed in two rooms for the remainder of our stay and both were very comfortable. In each case we had a balcony and the rooms overlooked the Pantheon. We had very little night noise and that suprised us as we were so close to various Sorbonne buildings. The hotel is part of the Rive Gauche group and the Hotel Pantheon adjoins this hotel. All seem to be of good standard but we did not see any of the individual rooms at other hotels in the group. The furnishings are of a superior standard. As an Interior decorator I enjoy staying in pleasant surroundings but at an affordable price. The Grand Hommes is a small Parisien styled hotel where attention has been paid to every detail. The walls are covered in fabric and there are antique pieces in the rooms. Bathrooms vary in size, but function very well. We would definitely stay at Hotel Grand Hommes again - I hope soon as we fell in love with Paris. It is a beautiful city. I would have displayed some great photos but unfortunately my camera was stolen in Monaco!!! The web site however is a good representation of the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDM_Enterprise
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel: neat room, friendly staff, convenient location and best of all, free wi-fi access

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ALJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The rooms are beautifully decorated based on the classical roman theme and the bathroom was lovely and clean. The staff were friendly especially the lady who serves breakfast! The location was superb - a few minutes walk from the RER and metro stations. We definitely would go back to the hotel again next time we're in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RagnheidurHM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days and we liked it a lot. The room we got was very nice and clean, but was facing the backyard so we recommed that you ask for a room with a view when you check in. The breakfast was good and the staff really friendly. The location is very good, in a walking distance from the Notre Dame and the Luxemburg Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KSSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights from 12 - 15 May and thought I would add to the other positive reviews of the property. The Hotel is, as other reviewers have stated, in a great location - right opposite the Pantheon and close enough to the RER, Metro etc, and has some nice eating places close by as well. We had booked 2 rooms, a double and a twin, and both were fresh in decor and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was great and looked recently refurbished. The hotel staff were very friendly and polite. Had breakfast in the hotel's breakfast room one of the days... was adequate but for 12 Euro (plus additional charge for use of the hot water / tea making facilities) we prefered eating at the local cafes. As previously stated the hotel is in a very quiet area. Our rooms faced into the courtyard area so we heard no street noise (if there was any during the night), but unfortunately on the Saturday night someone neighbouring the hotel had some kind of party and there was music and drunken whooping / screaming etc etc coming from their apartment into the courtyard area continually until about 4.30am. Not the hotel's fault though, and no doubt if we had called down to reception they would have tried to assist. Do they have noise curfews in Paris though?? All in all a great place to stay and would not hesitate to recommend. Will be staying there again next time in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: casey0999
Reviews.Content: Booked a "superior double" room, in the hopes of getting one of the two that has a balcony, but instead got a fairly large room with a view of the Pantheon which was fine. Although the room was large in comparison to the others we glimpsed, it sadly lacked a writing table of any kind, which would have made it perfect! Otherwise, the hotel was quite satisfactory, and the staff generally very friendly. There is a small safe in the room which was handy. Having the RER line nearby was an added plus, although we couldn't use it on the day of departure because of something going on in the Jardin du Luxembourg. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Torca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after reading so many positive reviews about the hotel on T/A (our bible!!). We arrived early, before noon, our room was not ready till 2 p.m. but they stored our luggage while we went to an exhibition at the Musee de Luxembourg. We returned about 4, and were shown to our room. We had booked a Superior room with view and were disappointed to be given a room facing into a dark courtyard, not what we had requested. After speaking to the receptionist, she quickly found a solution. We were given room 1, on the ground floor, a very large beautiful room with sitting area, overlooking the Pantheon. We had this for one night, then had to move to another room on the first floor, also overlooking the Pantheon, which was smaller but just as perfectly formed! Both rooms were immaculately decorated, with good bathrooms and well above average compared to previous experience of Paris hotels, and although we had to move rooms it was a small inconvenience and took no time at all to do the transfer. Many thanks to the hotel staff for their professional attitude to all of the above. We had breakfast at the hotel which was in a charming room below stairs - a very adequate continental breakfast that kept us going throughout most of the day. Whilst reporting on Paris, may I point out our experience of two restaurants five minutes walk from the hotel (both in the Rue de Lanneau) - Le Petit Prince and Coup Chou. They are both charming, with excellent service and although the Coup Chou restaurant is wonderfully interesting with lots of quirky rooms, I would say that by comparison the food at Le Petit Prince was marginally better. That is not to say we did not enjoy our wonderful Bouef Bourginon at the Coup, it was plentiful and excellent. This visit to Paris was perfect in every respect. The Lalique Exhibition at the Musee de Luxembourg was breathtaking - weather was lovely, and an 8 mile walk around the sights on Sunday left us aching but not too guilty about all that gorgeous food!! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: though
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. This was my first trip to Paris and wanted a place that was close to everything, but would also provide a good neighborhood vibe without feeling to touristy. The hotel is located directly across from the Pantheon, a gorgeous neoclassical building. Its an approx. 7 minute walk to the metro and several great cafe's are located a block away. This metro stop (Luxembourg) was very convienent for getting around Paris and seeing all the attractions, and also provided direct transport to the train station and airport. The rooms were small (we're from NYC so this didn't bother us), very clean, well kept and we loved the parisian decore. The hotel was unique with lots of charm! Amenities we used included hotel safe, minifridge, hairdryer, soaps, breakfast cafe, concierge. The staff was very helpful- provided wine glasses for us to drink in our rooms and called a restaurant for us to make reservations (since we don't speak French). I will definitely come back and will stay here again. Best of all, the rates can't be beat for the atmosphere, quality, cleanliness, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Clive_Arm
Reviews.Content: We splashed out and booked a room with a balcony - which we received. The view was great and the room was nicely proportioned (probably larger than your average Parisian accommodation) and comfortable. The big downside was the noise. Our room was on the 6th floor and there must have been air conditioning units or similar on the roof above our room causing the walls (and light fittings) to vibrate - we did wonder if there was a helipad above us. Luckily we had ear plugs which were essential. Being on the 6th floor meant a dependence on the lift which was incredibly slow and as typical in Paris, tiny - so don't try and get anywhere in a rush. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: grangetowers
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 2 night stay in mid April. Our standard room on the third floor looked directly out over the Pantheon (booked directly with the hotel for €90 per night). It was spotlessly clean with a good sized bathroom. We did not notice any noise from the street or from other guests using the hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful, and the atmosphere and decor was calm and relaxing. The location was perfect, with plenty of bars and restaurants close by. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Neat, old, classy”
Reviews.Author: mickbiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent position & outlook. Friendly, helpful staff. Nice condition. Comfortable. Rooms rather small but price fair - that's Paris. Only quibble - the free wifi is exasperating with poor penetration. They'll fix that I hope. Our second visit. Would certainly recommend. 60 year old Australian couple; 1 week stay

Reviews.Title: “Charming Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SFTravel_Dad
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, centrally located near the Pantheon with easy access to the Metro. We had a superior room and a standard room. The Superior room had a great view overlooking the Pantheon and was reasonably quiet given the traffic. The standard room faced an inner courtyard and was thankfully quiet, even with the window open at night. Just wish they had softer sheets on the bed... was a bit harsh. The family enjoyed the daily breakfast in the cellar, which was included in our rate. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “they want payment in full, before we go!”
Reviews.Author: Buoyantone
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided on the Hotel des Grands Hommes for our trip to Paris this fall, because of all the great reviews. We contacted through email and by phone, booked our room, paid the deposit and then received an email from them asking us to pay in full for the week that we'll be there! Needless to say we won't be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A peacful comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Daisy444
Reviews.Content: A 3 night 2 day stay...had a wonderful time...booked via internet, return emails were always prompt and informative.arrived late..10.30pm..easy check in.Flew to Orly caught orlyval express train then RER B line to Luxembourg..10 euros..5 minute walk from metro to hotel..easy!! Lovely room with balcony...superior but worth extra cost. Breakfast 2 days out of 3..a little more than local cafe but nice atmosphere convienient and lots to eat!! Location wonderful ..quiet haven after each hectic day..near lots of restaurants,,and as I said 5 mins from metro. Very clean,warm friendly hotel..will return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fab decor and great location.”
Reviews.Author: heart_of_england
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as a long weekend in Paris for my Boyfriends birthday. The hotel was perfectly located for viewing all the sights and is only a short walk to Notre Dame. We had an excellent piew of the Pathenon but because of this we found it very noisy at night. The room was a perfect size (above average for the rest of Paris!)and very clean. The decor was fabulous. Didn't really have much interaction with the staff although the receptionist on the final day was very helpful and allowed us to store our bags while we spent the day site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: JudsonFamily
Reviews.Content: My mother and I visited Paris for 3 days in early April and chose to stay at Grands Hommes because of the rave reviews on TripAdvisor. It is a small hotel with attentive, but not obvious staff. The location is fantastic for many reasons. It is quiet, but not deserted. There are numerous cafes and restaurants in the vicinity (We ate at the Tibetan on the street behind the hotel twice and recommend it). The Pantheon, as a landmark, can be used to direct taxis to the hotel if you are less than fluent in French. Our room was immaculate! There wasn't a spot that wouldn't pass the white glove test. I took a bath the first night without hesitation and it was fantastic and deep with plenty of hot water. The only reason we deny a five star rating is the price. There was nothing to complain about and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful, tasteful corner of Paris, but it doesn't come cheap. We paid roughly 185 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Jewelinsb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superb in every way. Excellent location, friendly staff, and quality rooms. Several cafés and brasseries are nearby for breakfast (cheaper than the hotel 12 Euro breakfast) and meals. There is a great Italian restaurant on the street behind the hotel. We stayed 4 nights at the beginning of the week and 1 night later in the week (after spending a few days in the Loire). Our first few nights, we opted for the Superior Room, (#22) which I strongly reccomend. The Superior room has more room and a separate WC from the bathroom. When we stayed later in the week, we got a smaller room on the 6th floor, which was difficult to maneuver with our luggage and the WC wasn't separate. One great advantage is that the parking outside the hotel is free from 7pm - 9am. Since we returned with a car, it was much better than paying the 21 Euro for the parking garage overnight. If you must use the parking garage, however, it is a short 2 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: aber-fan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights here in early April 2007. The hotel has an excellent location, near many sites worth visiting. We know Paris well (having lived there for 4 years), and enjoyed being able to walk to the Latin quarter, the Luxembourg gardens and the Jardin des Plantes. There are many good cafes and brasseries nearby, too. All staff encountered were friendly and efficient - a special thank you to the lovely 'breakfast lady', who coped single handed with feeding the visitors! Any grumbles? Very few - the shower was a bit weak, the bed slightly firm for our taste, and there was some humming noise from a motor audible on the top floor (this seemed to run 24/7); this disturbed my first night, but I got used to it and slept well thereafter. Advice? Book on a website - the room rate is much lower than the 'official' rate which is shown on the bedroom wall (by law, in France).

Reviews.Title: “Location, Style and Amenity all rolled into one”
Reviews.Author: RestlessMostPlaces
Reviews.Content: On this occasion I took my wife and three young children to Paris and stopped at the Grands Hommes, I had stayed previously whilst on business. Before we arrived my youngest daughter asked what the hotel was like, I found it difficult to put into words, but it is perhaps easiest to say what it is not like. It is not a large multinational chain hotel and does not have a swimming pool, gynasium or a large entrance foyer. It does have plenty of character, comfortable rooms, friendly staff and is very clean, it has a terrific position about 10 minutes walk from the latin quarter and Notre Dame if you are able bodied or nearby access to the Metro and buses. Rooms at the front of the hotel also have a view of the Pantheon. Finally, for the view alone down the Rue Soufflot and towards the Jardins du Luxembourg and the Eiffel Tower, this hotel is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “our trip to paris !!”
Reviews.Author: sallyann1
Reviews.Content: I asked for a room with a view of the Pantheon as it was my daughter's first trip to Paris and a treat for her 13th birthday. We were given room 31 on the third floor, which although small had a great view and a lovely bathroom. Once we got used to the small room we loved it and didn't want to leave !! The breakfast was great and the waitress lovely even though she spoke no English and we very little French! She had a very kind and friendly manner. We would certainly stay at the Hotel again, the only thing that would improve it further is to consider having tea and coffee making facilities in the room as this would have been welcome when returning back from a long day sightseeing !! All the staff were friendly and helpful and we felt safe there even at night when out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecvtraveller
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a central, quiet and affordable hotel in Paris then you need look no further than the Hotel des Grands Hommes. Great service from the front desk staff, clean rooms and delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris”
Reviews.Author: MartinaBerlin
Reviews.Content: Ist was our second stay in Hotel des grands Hommes and like the first time ist was again a really wonderful stay. This time we selected a standard room, which is small, but it' s enough space. Ther furniture is really nice, the room very clean und the bathroom with everything, we needed. And the most important - it is really quite. The reception is friendly and helpful. Thr location of the hotel is perfect. In front of the panthéon an very easy an quick to go to by train from Orly an Charles de Gaulle. Only some steps to the Jardin du Luxembourg and to many buses. Around the hotel are many nice restaurants and cafés. We are sure that wie will next time in paris stay again in Hotel des Grands Hommes. For us it' s perfect.

Reviews.Title: “good but can be better”
Reviews.Author: passure
Reviews.Content: lovely room and gorgeors view, nice staff and service. however, asked for toothpaste & tooth brush, promised it will be there but never appeard, maybe forget.......?

Reviews.Title: “Terrific price/quality value!”
Reviews.Author: funkazzista
Reviews.Content: Clean, silent, and cute rooms. Nice and very-well placed building, exactly in front of the Pantheon and near the Sorbonne University and the Luxembourg gardens. No need to add any other word, really, topic says it all. :-) Cheers from Italy! Andrea

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DigbyAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Paris was made all the more memorable for having stayed at this hotel. We loved everything about it, its location was great with many restaurants within close walking distance and a short walk to the train station made it very easy to get around and see the city. A great little hotel for tourists. Our room was on the 4th floor with a lovely view of the Pantheon, the rooms are a little on the small side but the bed was very comfortable and had a nice large bathroom which was clean, as was the room. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel, which we throughly enjoyed. If and when we return to Paris, we would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: robin m
Reviews.Content: Chose hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and the location. We were not disappointed and would recommend it to anyone. Great location, friendly staff and reasonably spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: Theklablue
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit as we enjoyed our first stay so much. The rooms are comfortable although compact and the location is excellent. It's worth requesting a front room as it's glorious to wake up to the Pantheon right outside the window. People watching is great value with the Sorbonne being so close.The staff are unfailingly helpful and courteous and although we didn't have breakfast there once on our first visit, we took it there almost every morning of our second visit. It was a lot cheaper and more substantial than in a cafe and the waitress was wonderful. There are plenty of good local restaurants within easy strolling distance and the Musee de Moyen Age is close by and well worth a visit to see the beautiful Lady and the Unicorn Tapestries. We will be happy to go back again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LondonGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Room very clean and fairly spacious. Fantastic Location. Hope to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in downtown Paris”
Reviews.Author: Eyquem
Reviews.Content: Very nice small Hotel in downtown Paris, next to the Panthéon and close to Luxembourg Garden. Turned a 48 hours business trip into a two days pleasant staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrwnIz
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes was one of the highlights of my trip to Paris. The hotel is directly across the street from the Pantheon, in the Latin Quarter, and is easily accessible from several metro stops. There are also several excellent restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. As soon as I checked in the staff made me feel welcome and they were quite accomodating. I was traveling with a friend and had requested a room with two twin beds. When we arrived the room had just one double bed; the staff graciously changed our room and we ended up with a room on the top floor with a balcony and an incredible view. We could see all the way to Sacre Couer (on a day without pollution). The rates were extremely reasonable and included a complimentary breakfast, which saved us time and money in the morning. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris and would stay there myself again. The highest recommendation goes to the staff - they were friendly, very helpful and left me with a wonderful impression of the French people.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SFCottage
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in Paris and we feel we did very well to choose the HGH. We initially booked an 'inside' room because I'm fussy about noise. It looked a little dull and we upgraded to a room overlooking Pantheon Square. It was great to have such a lovely outlook and the noise level was perfectly tolerable. The Hotel is well placed for trips all over town - but we must have walked at least 10K on one day alone! The room was a little on the small side but everything was in immaculate condition. The staff were perfectly friendly and hepful. There's little more you can say about a hotel as a base for a sight-seeing trip. I'd certainly recommend it. Richard Abrahams

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed stay at the Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: Sheilaritchie
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant wee hotel at the side of the Pantheon. Nice, very clean room. Very helpful staff. There's a breakfast room in the basement which we didn't use- used a cafe down the street instead. They advertise a bar, but it's really just a couple of tables in the lobby, and they bring the drinks from next door. I'd easily go back. Quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Small French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laine39
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Hotel des Grands Hommes in March. I had booked an internet rate (declined the breakfast) and thought the value was excellent. My room was in the rear, overlooking a courtyard, which was not a problem. The room was charmingly decorated, sparkling clean and the bathroom spotless. It was typically small, but as I was alone, space was not an issue. I cannot say enough about the courtesy of the entire front desk staff. Always a warm greeting, courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BernieBonham
Reviews.Content: We decide to make a special trip to Paris for my wife's birthday and Grand Hommes was just right. Great location and great little place. The room is small in typical Paris style, but perfectly fitted out, neat and clean. The staff at the hotel were also helpful and very obliging. We would definitely stay there again, although next time, if we booked more in advance try and get a room looking at the Pantheon (we sneaked a view of one of the rooms with a view, really lovely!).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location and Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Al&Bev27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night break in late Feb. Hotel was great - we booked a standard room but requested a view if possible (most standard rooms are at the back and don't get the view of the Pantheon). Received an email saying a superior room was available for extra which we declined. When we arrived we were put in an amazing room - with wonderful parisian decoration, double french doors overlooking the Pantheon and square - fabulous. We were charged the amount we agreed (standard rate) and had an brilliant 5 days. Watched Wales loose in the rugby, did all the usual sight seeing - the metro is so good compared to the UK - short walk to the stops which take you anyway (buy a 10 book ticket). A gentle walk down to the Jardin du Luxembourg for a stroll, restuarants, shops in close proximity - just great. Suggest you buy a museum ticket as you can advance queues - saying that only Musee D'Orsay had a significant queue - the others were short. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Would recommend it! Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Service, style and location”
Reviews.Author: DoctorRobert
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Grandes Hommes is very welcoming, stylish, clean and perfectly located opposite the Pantheon in the Latin Quarter. The staff are fully at your service, and it is so tranquil that you would think there was no one else in the hotel. Book well in advance!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: SussexTravel
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, clean, quiet, well-located in my favourite part of Paris. Room was small but bed was large. Didn't sample breakfast. Standard rates are high, but stayed in March for around EUR120 a night which is quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable & a good location”
Reviews.Author: mike_in_hampshire
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, the staff were welcoming & friendly, the room was warm, clean, quiet & comfortable. Good central location right next to the Pantheon. Only negative was that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room - so take a travel kettle! I would recommend it as a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cherubicon
Reviews.Content: Oh tripadvisor, you've done it again! After a number of catastrophic, dirty, stinky Paris hotels, I spent an hour researching Tripadvisors top tips, and then booked my holiday on Expedia. The hotel was dead cute. Very small room, and even smaller bathroom, but all perfectly formed, with really OTT '19th century' style decor - that was so extreme it was endearing. The area is fantastic, accross from the Pantheon and around the corner from the market of Rue de Mouffetard. The price was really reasonable, but there was some confusion with paying - I thought I had paid in advance on expedia, but the payment didn't seem to go through. Probably best to book direct with the hotel rather than expedia, as they say they'll beat any internet price anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: K72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for four nights. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. As it is close to the Luxembourgh RER-station it is very convenient and easy to reach from CDG Airport. The surrounding area is safe, peaceful and charming with nice restaurants and streets. The service in the hotel was friendly and the athmosphere warm and welcoming. The standard double room was quite small but so French and the bathroom was big and charming. You can really feel that you are in Paris! K & A Helsinki Finland

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: k&kLisburn
Reviews.Content: my husband and i and 2 friends are just back from our stay at this hotel and it was great.firstly,what a great location, right at the pantheon,our friends had a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the pantheon, almost within touching distance! my husband and i had a room on the top floor (theres a small lift) and at the back of the hotel but don`t think that this was an inferior room, it wasn`t, it was so warm and inviting and cosy just what we needed because the weather was very cold. the decor of the whole hotel was beautiful, all fabric on the walls and decorative plasterwork everywhere just the style you`d expect from paris! the place was also very well maintained and spotlessly clean, our bedlinen and towels were snow white. another lovely place was the breakfast room in the basement, it seems to have been a wine cellar in days gone by. breakfast itself was great, lots of choice and plenty to keep you going most of the day. the staff in the hotel were great too, very kind and helpful and courteous enough not to laugh at our hillarious french! this was my first trip to paris and this hotel made it special and i can`t wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: valentineDrogheda
Reviews.Content: I wanted to surprise my Fiance with a weekend break in Paris for Valentine's day. We stayed at the Hotel Des Grands Hommes after reading some of the reviews in expedia. The hotel is idealy locacted. We had a room that had a splendid view of the Pantheon. It was a small, clean room with a large bathroom. This is to be expected in Paris. We stayed in room 10 on the first floor. We were serenaded every morning from 07.00 hrs onwards by the street cleaners and binmen. Perhaps the noise could be reduced by placing shutters on the windows ? The breakfast was typically French. The croissants and pain au chocolat were in short supply and not the best quality. In Essence, this hotel is ideally located. The noise from the street can be heard in the hotel. The quality of the breakfast does not reflect the high quality of the French Boulangerie.

Reviews.Title: “stunning location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: weasel69
Reviews.Content: Just back from Paris where i have stayed quite a few times before. However i have to say that this Hotel is nothing short of spectacular. Great staff and a wonderful view from our room of the pantheon. The buffet breakfast was reasonable, but the real focal point is the rooms, Would reccomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: anonymous83
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this hotel. It is a very nice hotel, the staff is very nice, polite and helpfull. The location is excellent. The room was spotless. However, one day we came back to the hotel at 2.30 pm and the room was still being made. We had to wait downstairs for about 15 minutes. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel as we liked to eat outside. The room was a bit small and had not the view on the Pantheon as shown on the website. Our view was on a small inner court. We can fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very romantic”
Reviews.Author: jurkand
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for st. valentin in Paris, the rooms are not to big but very romatic and cozy. We loved it..... ps. and the breakfast...hmm!!!

Reviews.Title: “charming in paris”
Reviews.Author: gfgar
Reviews.Content: it's a real hotel boutique in paris i booked a standard room and it was like a superior the room is charming , very clean ,there are in an elegant setting some ancient furniture too the bathroom is varge and very well equipped the hall is small but with a neoclassic parisian atmosphere the only remark regards the approximate ordering of the room the price- quality propotion is very good

Reviews.Title: “wonderful candy box of a room”
Reviews.Author: dccymbal
Reviews.Content: lovely small hotel with all the right touches. quiet rooms in the 5th - and the rooms are on the small side but perfect - like candy boxes. fabric on walls, wood beams on the ceiling... just delicoius

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality & price”
Reviews.Author: adcatcher
Reviews.Content: Very stylish, clean and high standard for its price (~105 € per night). Excellent situation opposite the Panthéon with easy access to public transport and the famous Rue Mouffetard and Jardin de Luxembourg nearby (for those loving the french movie "Amélie"). Highly recommandable!

Reviews.Title: “Grands Hommes is grand!”
Reviews.Author: iris99
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great location, magnificent view of Pantheon! Have stayed in many 3 star hotels in Europe and this was the best so far. Staff was very friendly and helpful - and everyone spoke English. Located near public transport and situated in lovely area, close to Sorbonne university in Latin Quarter. We stayed in off-season (December) and paid less than 100 euro's per night for room with view.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful location - a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Coyoacan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely little hotel in early January; when Paris is quiet though still celebrating the Christmas season. The Grand Hommes is in a marvellous location overlooking the splendid Pantheon, in the charming Latin Quarter of the city - about 15 mins walk from the more touristy areas of Notre Dame. We stayed in a very nicely furnished front room (32), with magnificent decoration. The view from the room was stunning. Only point of criticism (and supports other reviewers) was the quality of the sheets - they are not of the best cotton...i.e. beware of sheet burns!! Apart from that, I would most certainly recommend this well organised and welcoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: DWJPR
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at the Hotel des grands Hommes in Paris. My husband and I traveled with our daughter and son-in-law, and both rooms (superior doubles) were very pleasant. The hotel is perfectly situated, attractively decorated, clean, and well maintained. Even in January we enjoyed having balconies that overlooked hotel's courtyard. We had the best of both worlds -- the convenience of the Latin Quarter, yet the absolute absence of street noise. And the Pantheon is quite a beautiful landmark to guide you back after a day of sightseeing in Paris. All the staff were friendly and helpful. I enthusiastically recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with the Big Men”
Reviews.Author: Per1964
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time I visited Hotel des Grandes Hommes, which is situated right next to the majestic Pantheon. And it will also not be the last - Hotel des Grandes Hommes is like a cosy home for me - in the heart of the romantic city of Paris. With the wide-open space of the Pantheon square, the Pantheon itself and the nearby Sorbonne, you cannot find a better place to breathe Paris. And a breakfast in your room overlooking the Pantheon - the Sun starting to paint its white facades pink - while Paris awakens, is unforgettable. And as for the hotel itself - beautiful. Small and beautiful. The staff is friendly and the day-time staff speaks English and are very helpful with advice and reservations. My room was decorated in egyptian style and with a balcony - perfect for red wine in the afternoon and champagne with the breakfast. :-) You know, it is Paris after all.

Reviews.Title: “A grand stay at the Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: skiingcouple
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent short break pre-Christmas here, soaking up the Parisian atmosphere in the smaller shops and cafes. The hotel is near to an RER station for direct rail from Paris CDG airport and if you enjoy walking as we do it is easy to reach the main sites on foot, or there are Metro stops. It is beside the Pantheon and our superior grade room had a wonderful view of it. The room was classically furnished and comfortable and breakfasts were good, with all staff most friendly and welcoming. It is situated on a very quiet square but handy for the Musee de Moyen Age, the Sorbonne, the wonderful bookshops of Place St Michel, the Luxembourg Gardens and Notre Dame. We would highly recommend this hotel for a reasonably-priced stay on the Rive Gauche -a great base for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: 1024Maine
Reviews.Content: Great little gem of a hotel. My husband and I stayed here in December and loved it. The room was small as in most European hotels, but just wonderful. I would like to keep this secret, but would not be fair to the Hotel. Don't hesitate to stay here, it is a home away from home. Janey Barthelette

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: pml
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location directly across from the Pantheon, and a few steps from the Jardin Du Luxembourg. Note Dame is a ten minute walk, 15 to the Right Bank. Staff is very friendly and all speak excellent English. Rooms were larger than expected and nicely decorated. Bathrooms were quite spacious with our a very large tub in our bathroom. We had a superior room and our two boys had a twin room. Splurge for the superior room, larger room and with a better bathroom (tub ). Best dessert I've had at Mouff Tartes on Rue Mouffetard. Organic bakery near there was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent choise in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cierco
Reviews.Content: It was ( and is, because I will return in the end of this month ) the third time I've been in Paris. In this hotel is the second time and I think that it is the best hotel in Paris. Last year, we spent 20 days and now we will spent about 15 days. ( some in the beginning, coming from Brasil and some at the end, coming from Barcelona ) There is a lady in this hotel, Gaelle, that makes the journey absolutelly calm and perfect. The room (last year was a double room and this year is a triple ) is fantastic. The breakfast is excellent and it is a good choice for you, if you are interesting in a good hotel with a perfect location. Agliberto Cierco and family

Reviews.Title: “Everything but the beds”
Reviews.Author: Finnatic
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with excellent serivce and unbeatable location. The area managed to be quiet and relaxing while still being very near great sites and transportation options. Many charming little neighborhoods to explore in the area, but easy to get to where the action is. The staff was very friendly and helpful (my dress strap broke as we were getting into the cab for New Year's Eve, and the desk attendant sewed it up and sent me off with a little sewing pack). We were promised a room with a Pantheon view but got one with a terrace in the back -- although I decided not to complain as we thought that might be more quiet and private. Had the weather been nice, we would have prefered the little terrace anyways. My other main complaint is the beds -- they were hard as a ROCK. And the pillows were the opposite, way too soft and fluffy. As much as I loved the hotel, my husband and I were in great pain and discomfort after 5 nights on those awful beds -- and as much as we really enjoyed the hotel, if the beds are all like that, we couldn't come back. I would have given 5 stars otherwise...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!!”
Reviews.Author: annettehj
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 wonderful nights at the Hotel des Grands Hommes in mid-November. Our room (no 1) was huge - with a sitting area and large bathroom and lots of storage. Situated on the ground-floor it looked right onto the Pantheon - breathtaking! We found the hotel staff to be very helpful and friendly. They provided us with information on some fantastic restaurants etc. We tried a lovely Thai restaurant behind the hotel, which was cheap and very good. The hotel staff also recommended Le Bar a Huitres (5 min walk downhill) which served amazing fresh seafood. Only a short 10 minute walk into the centre of Paris (all downhill) and situated in relatively quiet area this made the hotel ideal. We walked all over Paris (a good pair of walking shoes is recommeded!). In all we had a fantastic first trip to Paris - the people were very friendly to us even though we know very little of the French language, but we found if you smile and say and hello and thank you they will go out of their way to assist you. One word of warning, we visited the Sacre Coeur, which is an amazing building with fantasic views, but please be aware of the young men who stand at the bottom of the steps blocking the way. They will try to stop you and tie a bracelet on your wrist and charge you for this "friendship bracelet"! Be very forceful and push past, do not speak to them or before you know it you will be surrounded. Just a little warning! But please enjoy this lovely hotel and this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “A Short Stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: gerardNYC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a quite short 4 day trip to Paris & stayed at this hotel which we have stayed at before - we loved the room w & the location of the hotel is great as well however what made us most happy was the management and desk service - they were very attentive & helpful even checking on our last day that we were up & about after our wake-up call so as we would not miss our early flight - this is a very nice place to stay in such a wonderful city - gerard NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: The_Soph
Reviews.Content: This is definitely my favourite hotel of this category in Paris - I would recommend it to anyone and will be staying here again. The location is excellent, either as a central base for sightseeing on foot or with metro & RER stations within 5 mintues walk. The RER station nearby has frequent & direct links to the airport. (We also felt completely safe walking around this area at night). The hotel itself has a very boutique feel e.g. with fabric wallcoverings and carved winding staircase. The staff were very helpful, polite & welcoming (this makes a huge difference to any hotel stay in my opinion) My boyfriend & I appreciated the kitch luxe of our room and the unique details such as cherubs over the bedhead & chaise longue covered in cushions made the experience seem even more "parisienne". We booked a superior room with a great view across to the Pantheon, cannot comment on the breakfast as we took a stroll to the seine/Notre Dame for a coffee instead. Tip : visit the hotel website for special offers/discounted rates. Sophia & Rich, UK

Reviews.Title: “Promide a lot but didn't deliver”
Reviews.Author: Austinvisitor
Reviews.Content: This hotel promised a lot, but didn't really deliver. The expected views of the Pantheon and romantic balconies did not eventuate. The reception from staff was very professinal and pleasant but getting to our room from the lift was not so easy. A huge trolley with linen was parked outside the lift door and we were unable to get our suitcase past. This necessitated lifting the heavy suitrcase over the trolley as we could not move it. The room itself was delightfully furnished and the very comfortable bed had lovely linen. However as usual in Paris, space was at a premium. There was nowhere in the room to open 2 suitcases so we had to put one in the bathroom. And the view over the shabby internal courtyard was particularly uninspiring. So our final night in Paris had none of the romance I expected, and certainly no views of the Pantheon. The breakfast room (a vaulted cellar) was charming but cramped and claustrophobic. We were lucky in finding a table but others were not. The hot water urn was boiling and releasing its steam into this very small space. We should have gone out for breakfast. Usually we stay in 2 star hotels in Paris. This was our first foray into a 3 star, as a treat for our final night. Unfortunately not value for money. The other hotel we stayed in, the Hotel de Nice on the Rue de Rivoli was adequate in terms of facilties, cheaper and full of eclectic French charm. And the money saved could be used on a nice meal in the Marais.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Grands Hommes”
Reviews.Author: doc-trip
Reviews.Content: stayed for four days in a top floor suite...with a terrific view of Paris from the terrace facing the Pantheon. The room was an excellent choice. Consulted frequently with the front desk staff and was always given prompt, courteous and very helpful assistance. Hotel was conveniently located for either the Metro or for walking to destinations on either side of the Seine. We never used a taxi during our stay. We heartily recommend the hotel. The price was reasonable at around $200 a night. Our traveling companions stayed in a smaller room for around $160/night. Their room was quite reasonable. These two rooms were the only ones available when we made our reservation..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bananatree86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Des Grands Hommes in November for 3 nights. As soon as we walked through the front door we were very impressed. It is a very calm lobby with marble and lovely wooden features. The lady at reception was very polite and helpful. When we entered the room we were laughing so much because it was amazing!! we had the room with a balcony and a picture perfect view of the Pantheon, of which I truly recommend a visit. The decor was well very French!-see photos. Everything was so clean and the cleaner during the day tidied any little thing left astray! There was a safe and a large wardrode. Plently of room for two large suitcases. The two windows opened onto the balcony and were great for keeping what little noise there was out. It is 2minutes from the Luxembourg RER station which goes straight to CDG airport. it is located in the latin quarter just off Saint Micheal and the little area around the hotel is amazingly quiet considering it is so close to everything! Being Paris there are lovely little cafes just down from the hotel. We felt very safe and happy in this little find which we got for amazing value with an internet rate on the hotel's website. 110euro per night- which was AMAZING value!! the other hotels available at this rate have very plain rooms compared to this one. Id recommend opting for the rooms with view/balcony because at night the pantheon alit is breathtaking. We had one incident with a man on reception one evening who was very rude and unhelpful but every other member of staff was amazing and I feel it is a shame that man let them down. Overall I will recommend this hotel to every single person who tells me they want to go to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: RobertKentucky
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this charming hotel directly overlooking the Pantheon. My wife and I have been to Paris many times, and this was our favorite hotel. I would certainly choose to return to the same hotel, and the same room (#22), if possible. The room was more spacious than most Paris hotel rooms, but still small by American standards. But at least there was space to turn around. It was perfectly clean, and nicely decorated. I should mention that some other rooms I saw were rather smaller, although also nicely decorated. The location, on the Place du Pantheon, was perfect. And the price, off season at the end of November, was extremely reasonable -- about 109 Euros per night. I am sure it is much more expensive at other times of the year.The staff were helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Grands Hommes Encore”
Reviews.Author: haway
Reviews.Content: When visiting Paris, Grands Hommes is the hotel I select first, and I'm disappointed when its fully booked. The location opposite the Pantheon is one of the best in Paris, and it's easy to walk to other famous places. The decor is stylish and the hotel is quiet. Ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shane1
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights in this hotel and I would highly recommend it. It is in a great location, near some nice bistros and just 10 minutes walk to notre dame (and all downhill!!!). Although just one metro stop from the lively centre of Paris the surrounding area is very peaceful and relaxing. The rooms were clean and the decor was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Great Location with Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: SlimSlider
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in Paris and the Hotel des Grands Hommes. The trip was a surprise for my wifes birthday so I wanted everything to be perfect....and it was (relief !) The hotel is in a great location in the 5th Arr and a gentle stroll from the train station RER Line B - direct to CDG airport. It has plenty of restaurants and shops nearby and an easy downhill stroll to Notre Dame. Our room was compact but spotlessly clean and very well presented. The decor was very warm and romantic - which followed throughout the hotel - a very cozy and homely feel to the place. We had breakfast included which offered good choice and there was plenty of it to keep you going for the day. All in all a place I would defintely reccommend without hesitation.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel des Grands Hommes
HotelInfo.Address: 17 Place du Pantheon, 75005 Paris, France
